Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: shoshiw
Reviews.Content: I love the Arizona Biltmore. The grounds are stunning, the history is palpable, the pools stunning and the additional activity offerings and onsite restaurants, spa and shops are wonderful. The rooms, unfortunately can't hold a candle to the exterior beauty of the resort. Last year when we stayed here we were in a deluxe room and found it to be dated,dark and drab. This year we decided to upgrade to a villa suite as we thought it may be more upscale. While the room itself was spacious, with a living room, full kitchen, walk in closet and large bath, once again we found scratched furniture, stained cushions on the chairs and the carpeting was worn with ground in traffic patterns. Our only other criticism is the "reserving" of pool chairs. While signage states that one should not reserve chairs, this is clearly not the case. Almost every morning I saw people out as early as 7:00am taking towels and items from their rooms and reserving up to 8 chairs at a time. When I checked back later in the day it seemed these chairs had not been used until late afternoon! This is much too high class a resort for this type of activity to go on. There is no life guard so no staff monitor the pool activity. Also sorely missing were any wait staff taking orders for drinks, etc. This resort is a Hilton property, but honestly I have stayed at much less expensive Hiltons and had more updated rooms. We love the Biltmore, step up and renovate your rooms! Have the interior beauty of your resort match the 5 star beauty of the exterior!

Reviews.Title: “Old School superior service and beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Brian b
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at this wondeful hotel. Top notch service as soon as you pull up. Beautiful hotel and the grounds are full of blooming flowers and deep green grass. We had excellent service from Sarah while we had breakfast on the Frank & Albert's outdoor area. Nice quality breakfast and spot-on service. Sarah was great! Pools all over the property and fun people watching. Frank & Albert's has a bar and happy hour 5-7. Ask for Desirae as she will take good care of you. She waited on us twice and really was friendly and did a super job! Cannot wait to come back to this beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “So sad the service is so poor”
Reviews.Author: rose1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights to visit my son. Prior to coming I made my reservation for a spa/reserv. Great deal but no one knew what that meant. I called 3 times to get details but to no avail nobody knew what it meant. Check in, the front desk person didn't know either. Went to the spa and picked the least expensive treatments, and no one at the spa knew what I could choose. Long story short, at check out they charged me for all the spa treatments. Stood there for 45min while they tried to figure out what to do. Doris, manager, rudely came to tell me she would take the charges but if I did something wrong I WILL be charged. I tried to explain all I did, she shook her hand at me and said I already heard the story I don't need to hear it again. Dismissed by the manager of this resort. Shocking. The girls at the spa were equally rude. I thought to myself did I do something wrong.... but I did everything I could with no direction from the hotel. Sad Sad Sad

Reviews.Title: “pretty bad room”
Reviews.Author: jdferguson
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the quality of the room. Stained sheers on balcony door, holes in patio door where locked had been removed, paint peeling from bathroom light fixture, tattered bath robe (only one robe for a room with 2 beds). We asked for another robe and more towels and did not get either one. At check out we were told that we were in an older section that was due to be renovated. Yet we were still charged full price for the room. I think they should advise guests that they will be in an obviously inferior room and reduce the rate. They claim we were upgraded at check in but I can't imagine that was really the case. The grounds of the resort are beautiful and the staff was excellent from the front desk to the waiters in the restaurants and everyone in between.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: gatorfan2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night with my wife while driving from Northern Arizona to Tucson. Hotel website was running a half-price special so got a great deal on the room. Rooms are luxurious as you would expect. The room was huge as was the en-suite balcony with views of the nearby mountains. The sprawling grounds are immaculate. Room service whizzes by to the various hotel units on cute little bicycles. Avoided the valet by self-parking ahead of time and walking to the front desk. I'm sure one could easily get embroiled in lots of little extra costs in a longer stay but for us it was a surprisingly luxurious stopover at budget price. We had a nice, quiet morning strolling the grounds before we continued on our way. Probably wouldn't pay the full price to stay here, but for the price we paid it was a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Choose your room carefully”
Reviews.Author: v4nnm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in early April on business. I booked months in advance and am a Hilton Honors Gold member so was kind of hoping I might get an upgrade, but instead I got slung into what has to be the crappiest, most dated room I have stayed in since about 1994 which is when I expect this particular room was last furnished. To add insult to injury, a girl who turned up the day after me and was not a HH member got comped a suite which was a complete contrast to my room, as did others who were at the conference with me. Good bar, good restaurants, good wifi. Make sure that you don't use the hotel "taxi" to go to the shopping/restaurant area just down the road though. It was $20 to get us there, and only $4.50 to get back in a regular cab. Not good business IMO. Next time I am in Phoenix, I will stay someplace else most likely.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: vacationer0510
Reviews.Content: we relly love the convenience of staying at the Biltmore, it's close to everything from shopping, restaurants and hiking. The resort itself is quite large and it never really feels too crowded. The kids love the pools, they can pool hop if the temperature isn't right in one. The convenience of the cafe onsite is great for a quick breakfast, which the hotel gave us plenty of vouchers to use. I would recommend staying at the Ocatillia for the sheer fact the beverage and snack service is so great! We didn't get to do that this trip but have done it in the past and it was well worth the extra cost. Everyone including the towel guy is so happy there, I wish I can live there.... :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but not quite what you expect for a supposed 5 Star property”
Reviews.Author: blazer1115
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my wife and I have stayed at the Arizona Biltmore. The location is as good as it gets in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area but the resort just lacks that...extra "fluff". Being that it is a Hilton property, don't set your sights too high as it may fail your expectations. However, I would never rate this as a sub-par hotel. It is set inside a beatutiful residential sub-division with beautiful homes. The pools are very nice and the service is above average but not stellar by any means. The rooms can be far to walk to from the front entrance but at least the walk is usually through tranquil gardens. The spa is also quite nice and the gym is as good as you will get in any hotel. Would I stay there a third time...possibly but there are other great places to stay in Scottsdale which we would very likely explore.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky Start”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been going to the Biltmore for at least 10 years twice a year. Overall the grounds are always immaculate and the service is good. However the front desk staff is something to be desired. Last year we made the big mistake of coming to passover and not being told that the Octilla room that we had pre-paid for was not only given away the whole place was shut down. I made sure that this time around their wouldn't be that same problem, but yet again no one pays attention. This time we checked in and our 2 rooms that i had paid for in January "wasn't avaible." WHAT? We arrived at the hotel at 9 AM and didn't get into a room until after 6PM. Although we had an upgraded room the staff looked at me when asking what was going on they looked at me like they didn't know. It was not until Griffin (manager at the pool) went into the back room and told them we had been there all day. HELLO?! He also was gracious enough to give us 2 free cabana days at the pool since he's known us forever! I understand that conventions etc bring in a lot of revenue, but the "common" resort guest needs attention to. Especially when you can transform and ENTIRE resort for different parties....

Reviews.Title: “Here again”
Reviews.Author: Fysmd
Reviews.Content: My third stay at the Biltmore. It's a very long way from Yorkshire! Stayed in main building this time and rooms much the same though I had no balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Spring at the Biltmore is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: C-LynJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore for the second year in a row during the first week of April. I attended a conference that was at the hotel and it was the perfect setting for business combined with relaxation. The grounds of the Biltmore are really the most impressive part of the resort. They are so well taken care of and in April, all of the flowers are in their prime. This stay, our room was in the Valley Wing. The rooms were nice, but a bit dated. The bedding was very comfortable and we had a great balcony over looking the pool. The pool adjacent to the Valley Wing is quiet and while we were there, mainly used by adults. There is a larger pool not far from the Valley Wing that is much larger, and even has a slide. It seemed like most of the kids were hanging out in that area. The conference I attended was about 1200 people and I thought the meeting space was accommodated the size of group and activities planned very well. The continental breakfasts and lunches were also of good quality. My coworkers and I ate at one of the hotel restaurants, Frank & Alberts, for dinner as well as for breakfast. The food is excellent, however the staff were a little on edge. They were nice, but a little thrown off by special requests. The patio is beautiful. My only complaint is that there are a lot of birds that were sharing the patio with us at breakfast. As soon as other diners got up to leave, the birds would flock to the table for scraps. It was a little like a scene from a Hitchock movie ... kind of disturbing for breakfast. That said, still worth going just for the french toast or sweet potato pancakes!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous landscaping and many complimentary activities”
Reviews.Author: Mike V
Reviews.Content: Our family made a quick trip to the Arizona Biltmore for spring break and we were not disappointed. The lush grounds full of palm trees, orange & lemon trees, flowers, and green grass were very impressive and made for a relaxing stay. The aroma of flowers was present throughout the resort. Our family enjoyed the complimentary on-site activities so much that we hardly found time to enjoy other activities in the Phoenix area. The swimming pools, hot tubs, putting green, basketball court, croquet, dance studio, and fitness center were highlights for my family. Our room in the Valley wing was very spacious and centrally located. The Frank Lloyd Wright architectural influence of the resort is unique and pleasant. The only knock with the resort is the fact that the self-parking lot can be quite a distance from your room.

Reviews.Title: “3-Star Hotel with 5-Star Public Spaces”
Reviews.Author: IncreasePowers
Reviews.Content: I'd visited the Biltmore on previous trips, loved the gorgeous lobby and gardens, and was eager to try it out. It would be nice to report that the rooms were equally lovely, but sadly that isn't the case. We had a huge room (4100) in the more modern building at the back of the property, but it was sparsely furnished with cheap furniture tucked into corners of the room, with a giant empty space in the middle that highlighted the dirty wall coverings and worn carpet. It's as though they had turned a storage room into a guest room and couldn't quite figure out how to make the space work. Bathroom likewise was large but oddly arranged, with basic Hilton-level finishes. We ate dinner at Wright's, which again was a gorgeous room. Food was good but not great, service polite but not warm.

Reviews.Title: “It's no Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: oHIoOBP
Reviews.Content: Maybe I was expecting too much, maybe my standards are too high - but overall I thought the Arizona Biltmore was okay. I think they focus too much on style instead of functionality. There is no question the architecture and the grounds / landscaping are beautiful; it's the rooms that don't match up. The rooms have mission style furniture; but it is cheap and looks cheap. The desk and night stand had the veneer warped and buckling from I can only guess was water damage - just like mom always said, use a coaster for your drink or this will happen. One of the two bathroom sinks were backed up, as was the shower - these were corrected when we called to have the problem fixed. The shower stall had a soap dish on one wall and that was it, might sound petty, but I think the modern person / family uses more than a bar soap to bathe themselves. Any bottles of shampoos, conditioners, or anything else had to be place on the floor - end of the world? No, just annoying. The towel rack was on the opposite side of the shower, there was no place to put your towel near the shower - again, end of the world? No, just annoying to walk across the bathroom dripping wet to get a towel. Lamp shade had a decorative edging that was falling off and hanging down. The AC unit was excellent, actually got cold when it was turned down! Also, you will be able to hear your neighbor coming and going from their room - walls are thin, and the automatic door closure slams the doors. I was surprised when we ordered room service that it didn't come on a table, just a tray and you had to figure out where to place it to eat comfortably. If you don't valet park, and choose to self park - be prepared for a good walk to your room. There is one small parking lot, and a parking garage both are a good distance from the rooms - we had a 7 minute walk to our room. This was really annoying since we were doing different stuff in the city, we were constantly driving back to the hotel to change and then head back out again. They had a large parking lot right in front of the main entrance that was for valet parking only - so you have to pay someone to park your car 30ft. The employees all seem very well trained, nice, attentive. The putting greens were a nice touch, and very fun. If they would spend half as much time on the rooms as they do with the landscaping, this hotel would be outstanding. Just my 2 cents.

Reviews.Title: “Carolyn White employee at the Arizona Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: Anne J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went in September. I had not been to Arizona in 20 years. We stayed in the Ocatilla on the property and there was a conciere that was so warm welcoming and couldnt be more helpful. She seemed to understand what my husband and I wanted to do and what we wanted in a restaurant. We had such a fabulous trip because of her direction I returned 6 months later with my neice. She put together ahead of time our agenda and each day was better that the day prior. When you have someone that can tailor your trip ahead of time and be so bang on, it makes it. Thank you Carolyn White I will be returning because of you. Anne and Arch

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: carmel57
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Had a nice room with garden view. Went for happy hour specials in the restaurant bar, and drinks later in the main bar. Loved the grounds and pool area. Classier place than other resorts we have stayed at in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Check-In Pretty Much Ruined Trip”
Reviews.Author: Suzanidoo
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers and up until last year were Hilton Diamond members. We have recently stayed at some of the finest resorts in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area: Four Seasons, Royal Palms, Westin Kierland Villas, and Princess. We were expecting the service at the Arizona Biltmore to be on the same level as these resorts. It most definitely was not. Upon arrival, we valet parked our car. More on that later :( At check in, I inquired about upgrading our room. The woman at the front desk was completely clueless. My husband and I got the impression that she had never worked a front desk before and this was her first day working in the hotel industry. This is a WALDORF property! After about 15 minutes of her not understanding what I was asking for and my husband ready to completely lose his cool, I finally requested she find a manager. He was accommodating and found us an Ocatilla room, which we paid more money for. I don't understand how the resort's first foot forward could be someone so poorly trained and clueless. I talked my husband off the cliff and we headed to the room ready to put the past 30 minutes out of our mind and enjoy our vacation. Not so fast. We had asked the valet to get all of the bags out of the trunk and requested they be brought to the room. When they arrived, one of our bags was missing! Our bags had been sitting on a luggage cart the entire time we were hassling with the front desk and we were sent into panic mode as to where the bag could be. Murphy's law, it was the one bag that we absolutely could not lose. Eventually they found the bag (claimed it had never been taken out of the trunk) but WOW what a TERRIBLE start to this vacation! The rest of the stay was just okay. We got massages and facials in the spa and my husband said it was the worst massage he's ever had. Mine was pretty good. Our upgraded room in the Ocatilla section was about as far away from the main entrance as it could be and was a good 10 minutes walk. We're young and in good shape and it was a haul. I really can't see wanting to stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms ok......landscaping beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Sanderie
Reviews.Content: I am not too happy with the room, but the area around the resort is beautiful. Bathrooms need serious upgrades!

Reviews.Title: “Live Like a Princess”
Reviews.Author: Suzersnews
Reviews.Content: If you want a true gem of a vacation, please visit the Biltmore. My husband and I travel to Phoenix a lot and I am so glad I happened upon this little slice of heaven! From the impeccable customer service, to the mouthwatering Lobster at Wrights restaurant, you will find this resort fit for a King/Queen. Enjoy several locations of differing pools, quiet, secluded, hot tubs and don't forget the spa. The workout room is equipped with top-rate weight machines, and as a bonus after a hard work out, enjoy either dry or a wet steam room, and a quiet hot tub. Each lockeroom is like a princess suite - stocked with fresh water, suntan lotion, sweet smelling spa lotions, hairdryers and ambience that is far reaching. Don't forget your golf clubs! Putting greens dot the property, creating a homey and family feel to this gem. Enjoy the ringing of the bell as waiters pass by on bicycles reminiscent of yesteryear, racing to get warm porrage to the masses. Wake up each morning to a fresh cup of coffee, and a sweet treat at The Cafe within walking distance. The rooms are spacious and the beds very comfortable. And don't miss the ever-lit large fire pits within walking distance of everything. Roast marshmallows or ejoy a nice glass of wine while you warm your toes by the fire. Stop and smell the honeysuckle - as the perfection and carefully manicured botanical gardens adorn this property. Treat yourself to a fine dining experience at Wrights, and expect to be treated royally. The Coq A Vin should be a delicacy, and the Lobster was mouthwatering. Please visit...you will be glad you did! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons on the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: CharlieQ73
Reviews.Content: Pros - Grounds are very well kept and when you walk through from the parking area, the fragrance of all the flowers stay with you all the way to your room. Staff members are very friendly and take care of your every need. One time when walking toward our car, the room-keeper staff must have just received their assignments for the morning, so we stopped to let them by (must have been 30 or more). I’m sure that they were talking among themselves about their workload, but about one in 5 would smile, acknowledge our presence and said good morning. The Spa area and locker rooms with all the amenities were better than expected for an older establishment. We really enjoyed the fact that our area had its own pool & hot tub, which was much quieter and relaxing than the main pool with the slide & swim-up bar. Great view from the room on our balcony of the main lawn with fountain & view of various weddings/events, but still far enough away from the noise. The bed was very comfortable & liked the work table with side chairs. WIFI was good and easy to log in. Cons – The room was older and there was a note above the thermostat from maintenance (probably meant for the prior guests) about the heater being fixed for them. Well, the temperatures outside were already plenty warm (we are from Denver), so we were hoping that the older building system had the ability to cool things off. Not so much. Unfortunately our room faced south and since cleaning was done after noontime, we were gone until the early evening and unable to close the heavier blinds to block the afternoon sun and its heat. So, we would keep our sliding door open in the evening to allow the room to cool down for the night - it was tolerable. Overall – good experience. For those who play tennis or golf, it would be an ideal location. For those who follow Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives – you are within 15 minute drive of 3 really good-ones in the greater Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds better service”
Reviews.Author: Josh M
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out we knew this was a great place to stay. We stayed at the villas district of the biltmore and that was absoulutly wonderful each we of villas having there own pool and a main pool for all guests. The rooms were kept cleen and the grounds kept beautiful with a bunch of facility's from mini golf to croquet to many different bars and grills and restaurants to eat at overall it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: Miloman10
Reviews.Content: My 8 yr. old daughter and I spent spring break week at the Biltmore, March 19th week. The resort is absolutely beautiful and the grounds are immaculate. I was surprised at how friendly everyone was, from the front desk to the gardeners. No request was too small and we were even upgraded to a bigger room with a walkout patio. The pools are heated and were plenty warm to swim comfortably. There were multiple family groups and the lawn chess and croquet were a big hit with the kids. If I had a criticism it would be the food and drink prices. $4 is a bit much for an iced tea. The breakfast buffet at $10 for kids and $16 for adults was well worth the price. I would highly recommend the hotel and look forward to returning for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “AZ Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: Cindy C
Reviews.Content: Love the history of the property and the architecture. Pools were great and offered both family fun and quiet relaxation. Ate at the Adobe Grille and it was wonderful. This was our 2nd trip to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin F
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 2 nights at the Arizona Biltmore in Phoenix during our spring break week (late March). I wasn't sure what to expect from this historic hotel, but both my son and I were delighted in every way. A class act,Biltmore offers the best service I have ever had at any hotel, incluing those on this level. FYI there is a handy Cafe where you can get coffee, tea, espresso drinks and bakery goods. Then there's the fun for kids ... we weren't there long enough to take advantage of all the hotel had to offer in their kids program, but we had fun at the main pool area with restaurant/pool bar. There is one slide which isn't huge, but big & fast enough for adults to enjoy it too. There were plenty of wait staff to make getting food & drinks easy & quick all day. There are 3 pools in this complex, then there are 5 other simple rectangular pools scattered throughout the villas. I was sorry to have missed an aqua aerobics class. If you go, be sure to check the Recreation Center (a little hard to find - adjacent to the salon) for a schedule at the beginning of your visit. There's also yoga & other classes, plus bike rental, tennis, basketball, etc. The grounds at this hotel are stunning, and I really enjoyed walking around taking pictures of the Frank Lloyd Wright architecture. You really feel like you're experiencing history in this hotel originally built in 1929 which has hosted every President since. Currently there is a great b/w photo gallery on FLW & his photographer Pedro Guerrero in a hallway off the lobby. I thought our room was great - very comfortable bed, bathroom was elegant ... and we were just in the standard room with a view of the main pool complex. There is a mini bar fridge, which we used to store our water bottles, fruit, etc. when we arrived. One of the most convenient aspects of this hotel was the straight shot down 24th street to the airport - couldn't have been easier. And they use a great car service, Execucar (part of the Super Shuttle company), if you don't have a rental. Also, the free Wi-Fi was nice. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historical Property, but...”
Reviews.Author: SFtravelsoftern
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Biltmore. As much as I really wanted to love it, my overall feeling as I left this morning was that the place is overrated and overdeveloped. There are some beautiful areas at the Biltmore. Most notably are the original hotel building, cottages, and surrounding grounds which date back to the late 20's/early 30's. The Frank Lloyd Wright architecture is timeless and stunning. I especially enjoyed the 90 minute walking tour offered by the hotel where you can learn about its history. Unfortunately, thats where my love affair with the Biltmore ends. We were upgraded to a Golf Course Villa upon arrival. My initial excitement was replaced with disappointment when I opened the door. The 1 bedroom Villa was spacious. However, the decor was at least 20 years old. Formica counters, vinyl tub and shower enclosure, stale smell, dirty carpet, 27 inch tube tv's...not what I expected for a room that goes for $700 per night on their website. Didn't expect the ants either, but I guess that is common in Arizona. Also, the Golf Course Villas are on the far end of the property and I felt completely removed from the resort. There are a signficant number of these Villas on the property, and it gives the property the feel of a subdivision rather than a luxury resort. They are built to "resemble" the original architecture, but they don't. Its really quite a shame. Resort fee was $28 plus tax per day, self parking is $12 more, or you can Valet for another $28. I know this is the norm in AZ, but when paying upwards of $500 per night, I find it insulting to pile on the fees. Overall, the service was good and the staff were friendly. The gym was also nice. I just can't get over how old and shabby the Villa was.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: j d
Reviews.Content: no need to say anything else. We felt like we were in luxury...but you pay for it. I loved the property, but the staff was a bit snooty.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with great service...”
Reviews.Author: Eventprincess
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Biltmore for a special girls weekend trip. We had one of the older rooms in the Terrace building. The room was good size and very clean. The beds were comfortable and although it was old - nothing looked worn out. We took a look at the newer rooms and they are definitely in better shape. However, everything else was great about this resort. The grounds are stunning - the history of the place is fascinating - the food was good and overall, the staff were very attentive. We especially loved Victoria and Marie in the restaurant. They were the best wait staff people I have have seen in years! Both accomodating and friendly - yet never overbearing. I wish I could bring them along to every hotel which I visit. The front desk staff were not very friendly - but still accomodating. They should be more energetic and gregarious but that is so small in the scheme of things. We had the best package with daily meal vouchers and spa discounts. It was perfect. The thing about this resort is that it is old and historical. If you are looking for chic, posh and a spot for the fabulously nipped, tucked and star struck - you need to go elsewhere. The Biltmore is comfortable and kitchey - and that makes it a great place to go. I never felt under dressed or out classed like in many top resorts. I felt like I belonged there and that the hotel was thrilled to accomodate every request. The door staff - was great. The tour of the property had a wonderful guide. All in all a nice get-away!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Resort, Excellent Service, Fantastic Restaurant, # 1 Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Frankie13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ocatilla Club Wing of the resort and enjoyed our stay tremendously. Check in was prompt and very friendly. The walk to the Ocatilla Wing is visually stunning and the I loved the chairs gathered around firepits overlooking the huge center lawn. The king room was very spacious with a super comfy bed, huge closets, a bath set up for pampering and spotless. We went to check out the club lounge for the happy hour, Carolyn is a delight and helpful. They offered a diverse selection of appetizers, wine, beer and lots of other snacks. This upgrade is well worth the extra $$. We had dinner reservations at Wrights. From start to finish our waiter William made excellent suggestions. We ordered the escargot, which had a twist on the typical dish, I believe it had peas and risotto, delish! Hubby had the scallops which he said fantastic and I ordered the lobster Thermidor, all paired with great wines by the glass. Do yourself a favor and order the Grand Marnier Souffle for dessert, worth every calorie. We travel extensively and would love the opportunity to return for a longer stay, I highly recommend the Biltmore for an all around great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort and Staff”
Reviews.Author: melinaMissouri
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Arizona Biltmore and it was beautiful. The room was nice and spacious. The hotel grounds were immaculate, the pools were also very clean and well kept. There is so much history in this hotel that I felt as though at any minute I would see a past US president come walking through the lobby. we had a few lunches poolside and the were very good. My husband and I were staying there because of a business trip so many of our meals were already planned. We were particularly pleased with our concierge Kevin , we asked him for a few suggestions and he immediatley referred us to the area we needed and his suggestions on dining out were fabulous . All staff was extremely courteous and friendly . We will definitely go back and stay at this fabulous resort .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah C
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore was a great stay! The building is historic, the grounds gorgeous, the poolside bar fun and the room service delivered by bicycle was adorable! There are boutiques to visit and the restaurant was delicious - especially the Sunday sampler eaten fireside after the meal! 15 minutes to Zinc Bistro- a must! And 15 minutes to Old Town Scottsdale. Room was a bit dark, but spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort- Don't Miss It!”
Reviews.Author: arlyhill
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days in Phoenix and am thrilled we stayed at the Arizona Biltmore. It's historic, gorgeous and very, very well run. We heard so many rave reviews about the Ocatilla wing that we stayed there and are delighted we did. The continental breakfast with all the expresso, capuccinos, lattes you could ever want [throughout the day as well] and evening hors d'oeuvres [very good!] with wine, beer, champagne, desserts, etc., were delightful along with the staff especially Carolyn, the Ocatilla concierge who was fantastic in every way [gracious, helpful, caring, informative] and Nathan Anseth [a world-class gentleman] all helped make out stay wonderful. The pools are terrific, Frank and Albert's was delicious and well priced and the room we had was beautiful. The only complaint we had was the parking...it's inadequate and you must pay for it to boot. All in all, though, Do NOT miss this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful common areas with lovely architecture”
Reviews.Author: PinaColada02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for a work conference and found the resort grounds to be very beautiful. I didn't get a chance to really enjoy the resort's amenities due to the conference activities however I did see the pool area, which looked really nice, and the outdoor lounge areas were gorgeous. Lots of chairs and outdoor fireplaces which were great spots for reading and relaxing outside. I used the resort's fitness center and it was very nice. Lots of space with two separate rooms: one for lots of machines and the other with nautilus machines and room for one to do free weights, floor work,etc. I ate at Frank & Albert's restaurant in the resort. Once for dinner and once for breakfast and both were quite good. The dinner was especially good. The conference was in the resort so we also got to experience their conference facilities which were good. Standard amenities and the food was average for a conference. In terms of the rooms, the room was large and spacious with a nice little balcony. The decor is not my taste but I guess it was in keeping with the overall resort's look, although the common areas seemed to be a lot nicer than the room. The bathroom was very large but the resort's age was apparent in the water system. The water pressure in both the shower and toilets was quite low -- like it was running on an older plumbing system. Had they upgraded the bathrooms to more modern fixtures and functionality I think they could have kept the "old world" charm while still offering a more contemporary experience. I stayed in the Paradise wing of rooms and the elevators in that wing were awful. Again, another example of the resort's age. This wing had 4 floors and the elevator routinely stopped on every floor even if you did not press that floor and each time when the door opened to that floor, no one was there so it appears the elevator just stopped on that floor without being called. I was on the 4th floor, of course, so I had to suffer through stopping at every floor on nearly every elevator ride which was annoying by day 2. Overall I can see how this would be a lovely place to come with your family or friends for a relaxing vacation as the property seemed to have everything one would need for that experience in a nicely designed and furnished resort. For my work conference, it was an overall good experience despite the minor inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “gardens are amazing in the desert”
Reviews.Author: Ken G
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a business event. hotel service was A+. from the moment we arrived things were organized even from the check in process to the luggage arriving at the room. grounds are very well maintained. we used the heated pool in the back corner for lap swimming twice during our stay, as it was empty in the early morning hours. main pool could get crowded so get there early if you want to get the tanning hours Catered dining was very good. housekeeping was stellar

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bearcatgirl08
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautifully maintained and the pools were wonderful. The fitness center was nice, but small. There were a lot of people there, so you don't get your choice of the machines. Our room (one of the villas) was very spacious, but it was a little worn. We were there for a business trip, but I would have been disappointed if I had shelled out all my hard earned money for one of these rooms. It's not what you expect for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Frank's One the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Nora L
Reviews.Content: What can you say about this historic hotel in Phoenix Az designed by the famous world architect Frank LLoyd Wright!! You can feel the history of the place by just coming in the main entry parking area. The design still fresh and new, well placed in the heart of Phoenix with great views and easy access for me to go places and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Visited Spa for the day- expensive and in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: MMBINNJ
Reviews.Content: Spent a day at the Biltmore Hotel and specifically the Spa- purchasing a package that was very expensive. Never have I seen a spa of their supposed caliber that was more in need of a renovation. The waiting area had ripped up, out dated magazines- petty? Maybe- but it was dreary. Their relaxation area had insufficient seating (coed) while waiting, no real snacks, lockers were nice, showers seemed old. Billing was beyond confusing. Massage was just so-so, which was surprising in that my therapist said he had worked there for 20 years. Facial was nice- no hard sell on products. Ate lunch at pool- 1 drink each, fish tacos and $70 bucks later seemed high. Lots of little kids running around. I don't know if I would make a special trip again as my friend and I did. We were staying at the Ritz- so be aware if searching for a spa- use the Red Door across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: zimmer4488
Reviews.Content: What a gem! We had visited the grounds years ago for cocktails during a business meeting, but this was our first opportunity to stay on the property. It was wonderful! The room was phenomenal, all of the wait staff was exceptional and the grounds were breathtaking. Unfortunately, we missed a tour of the property – the tours are not conducted daily. One note, your room may be FAR from the front desk due to the various buildings on the Biltmore property. Be prepared to wheel your luggage. Also, those “extra” fees add up. Self parking is $12 per night and the resort fee is $28 (I totally missed those in my excitement to book our rooms!)

Reviews.Title: “Concierge teams needs a lesson in customer service!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganBigMoo
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore did not live up to our expectations. Everything was squeezed together. Every pool had 30%-40% more seating then necessary. The outside bar was packed with chairs and allowed NO privacy to talk. Parking was terrible! The biggest disappointment was the concierge group. No help, no service, did not care. The grounds were well kept and very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, rooms not so muck”
Reviews.Author: jimjr264
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful grounds I have ever seen at resort. Unfortunately, the room was very tired, looking more like a tired Day’s Inn with furniture that had varnish that was pealing. I suppose it was still real wood, which would not be the case with a Day's Inn (in my experience), but you get the picture. We also were maybe in one of the few remaining rooms that needed to be renovated, but I heard complaints from other guests about the same thing. Still, I was not there for the room, and it was, but the way, bigger than any single room i have ever stayed at at any property. The resort has great pools, excellent dining, but a small work out facility (though packed with equipment). My kids were with us and did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: oxybill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore for four days, for a business event. Hands down--the grounds are simply stunning. The flowers, the meticulous landscaping--it is simply beautiful. And the staff--especially at the restaurants--couldn't be friendlier or more accommodating. Our room was nice, but nothing outstanding. It always seemed dark. While I understand that this has more to do where the room was located than anything else, it still didn't have the "wow" factor. Really--Arizona in March...coming from Cleveland...I wanted lots of light and brightness! We both liked the bathroom--very roomy with lots of room to spread our stuff out. And good closet space. We had a wonderful stay, and would return to the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: Simone B
Reviews.Content: Great Place to visit for Wedding Anniversary. Great Views from rooms, Great Staff. Best place to dine is Frank & Alberts. Had a Great Server named David H. he showed us Great Service and Great Food. A+.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: mtngirlnv
Reviews.Content: I love the history of this place. The restoration makes it very comfortable, the staff is great and the rooms are clean and spacious. BUT....no coffee maker in the room?? I really have to pay $5 for a cup of coffee?? For what the average guest pays per night here, I would think they would include it. Also, what's with only having two restaurants on property? With a property this size, I would expect at least four options for sit down dining. Overall, a nice stay, but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Food allergy accommodations were excellent!”
Reviews.Author: JenS185
Reviews.Content: We recently attended an event at the Biltmore Hotel with over 1200 people. They had over 50 special dietary requests, including our son's very severe, multiple food allergies (dairy, peanuts, tree nuts, sesame seed, flax seed and pomegranate). I called the head chef in advance and he patiently worked through the menu with me. They were so extremely organized and each staff member with whom we worked could not have been nicer. My son's plate was labeled and his area at the table indicated to the waiter that his would be a special meal. The chef prepared special items that were similar to the items everyone else was eating--just without the allergen (hummus without sesame/tahini) and my son LOVED his meal. He even LOVED the vegetables, which usually he could take or leave. Thank you, Todd and your staff for making our night so enjoyable and stress-free!

Reviews.Title: “The Biltmore Is My "Home Away from Home" When I'm In The Phoenix Area”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: Anytime that I am in the Phoenix area overnight, I stay at the Biltmore. The only exception is when they’re sold out. (During the high season, I’ve found out the hard way that I need to make reservations about a month in advance.) Without exception I’ve had very pleasant visits. I like the atmosphere, the décor, and certainly the service. The restaurants are good and the food excellent. (Try the sea salt salmon, you’ll like it.) In fact, the real purpose of my review is to complement my server at Frank & Alberts on February 9, 2012. She was courteous, knowledgeable of the menu, and very attentive to my service. I was fortunate to have her again on my next visit the 23-26 of February. Again, she was superb. So, when you visit Frank & Alberts, ask for Nataly, you won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: lujacque
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Biltmore for a wedding shower weekend. We regularly travel with my husband, my mother, my baby and myself so we are always looking for great 2 bedroom suites to have separate bedrooms and a common area. I also look for fabulous grounds for my family to play on and have the run of the place. The Biltmore far exceeded our needs and expectations. We had a rocky start when we checked in. I spend a great amount of time researching where we stay, reading reviews, getting the best deal and confirming my reservations. In this case I had another criteria which was to be able to check-in as early as possible and check-out as late as possible because we flew in on a 6 a.m. flight and would fly out on a 6 p.m. flight. I ended up booking through AMEX Platinum Concierge. I booked a 2 bedroom villa suite. It was a few dollars more than booking it through the hotel but it allowed for the late check out and came with 2 breakfasts per day and a resort credit. The requested an early check in but all the Villas were occupied so they were unable to honor the request. My only regret was that when we called the hotel after landing at the airport they did not inform us that we could rent a cabana by the pool that had its own kitchen and bathroom. It would have been a nice way to relax after getting up at 3 a.m. with a baby. We learned this the next day. We were told to go to the hotel to pre-register to get the earliest possible room which we did. When my husband checked in they told him it was just a one bedroom villa suite. I went inside myself to find out what was going on. They told me the same thing. I assured them that I had booked a two bedroom and that it was one of the main reasons we were staying there. They said they did not have any available. I then told them that I had booked one and what the price was per night on my confirmation. This immediately got their attention because the price on my reservation was for a 2 bedroom. They spent at least 20 minutes making a way. They told me that they would take care of it and gave us a time frame the room might be ready by. I appreciated the effort they made to make it right. I was actually thinking if it didn't work out it would be ok and I would go stay at the Holiday Inn and save a bunch of money. Fortunately, that did not happen because the resort was fabulous. The grounds were gorgeous but not arrogant. There were all types, classes, races and ages of people. They never frowned on kids running on their perfectly manicured green lawn. They actually had life size chess and checkers game on the lawn. The cafe served great Starbucks coffee and drinks. It closed a little too early on the weekend. The gym was great. The pools were fun. Unfortunately, unlike most 5 star hotels the service by the pool was lacking. There was one server trying to cover the whole pool and the area became covered in nasty wet towels quickly. The tennis courts were great. We were able to rent equipment and have a great time. We stayed in a Villa that was furthest away from the main resort but it was great. Also, each set of condos has their own pool. This meant we had a heated pool right outside our back door. Fortunately their was a gated area between the door and the pool because we have a one year old. The grounds are huge so be sure to bring your stroller. We actually bought one and don't know what we would have done without it. We ate the hotel restaurant, Frank and Alberts for breakfast everyday and had dinner there one night. They have a great breakfast menu and a great buffet. We enjoyed both. We sat outside for every meal. They have fire places and heaters and it was a great time. There is a wonderful business center with color printers. Unfortunately, they never refilled our mini bar beverages and snacks for some reason. We also had a hot water problem. During the first shower, after a simple shampoo, the water would turn cold. The happened on the king suite side and on the adjoining double bedroom side. Very strange. It was very nice but the kitchen and shower weren't as modern with appliances and tile and such as most upscale hotels we stay in but it was very nice and very clean. It was also great for putting a baby to bed and being able to stay up without disturbing his sleep. The curtains and drapes were great for room darkening although there was an art to closing them just right. The hotel grounds staff was also noisy as they roll their carts and towel bins up and down the street outside of the hotel and they would just congregate in the street outside our room and talk. The best I could tell a great number of them came to work at 5:30-6 every morning because that is when the baby would wake up abruptly and then we would hear them outside. I would absolutely stay here with my family again. I would be interested in reserving one of the cottages on the other side of the property. There is great shopping and dining a very short distance from the property but not really walking distance. The pools are heated but could be a little warmer in the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: HomebodyTraveller
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed here for two nights in the Ocatilla Club. We do not usually stay at this level of resort; we're pretty down-to-earth, which is a nice way of saying I'm super tight with my wallet when it comes to hotels. This place was exceptional for us, and for the first few minutes after check-in I wondered if we belonged. But I quickly relaxed and noticed that the Biltmore attracts a varied clientele--not just the beautiful people in resort wear, but also families, casual dressers, retirees, etc. The resort is beautiful but not stuffy. We settled right in, and in the end we found it very hard to leave! I think staying at Ocatilla Club was key to how much we loved this place. The Ocatilla rooms are in their own building and have their own exclusive lounge with concierge. That lounge was such a great benefit. Cold water, Tea, lemonade, and soda are available all day. Every morning there is a nice continental breakfast available, with good pastries, tons of appealing fresh fruit, bagels, yogurt, and excellent granola. Each evening there are appetizers and wine & beer before dinner, and dessert every night. All complimentary. There is ample seating and a lovely patio area including a fire which is great for s'mores (they have a kit for kids). The lounge features a wonderful concierge staff who are truly engaged and helpful, and very kind to families. We really appreciated Leo, but her fellow staffers were equally great. Unfortunately our interactions with other staff were more hit-and-miss. One concierge at the main building told us the wrong opening time for the putting range; at Frank & Albert's (one of the restaurants) we inquired around a vegetarian substitution for the burger and our server replied "You mean like a turkey burger?" That said, on a subsequent visit I heard a different server offer another guest a helpful list dishes on the menu that could be adjusted to become vegetarian, so our server may have just been an exception. We certainly liked our two meals at Frank & Albert's. Thanks to the Ocatilla lounge we didn't end up dining in any of the other restaurants or lounges. Be aware that the resort is large; it has numerous pools, tennis courts, conference facilities, and other amenities; it is surrounded by a gold course and other related residential properties so you are a long way from anything. It makes the atmosphere idyllic, but a quick jaunt out to get something isn't really possible. We ventured out for one great tour of Taliesin but otherwise we stayed on the property relaxing and enjoying the stunning grounds. If we were doing a lot of coming-and-going this might not have been such a great fit. It's really nice to wander the grounds and see the architecture (borrowing heavily from FLW, although he merely consulted on the project), the period furniture, and the historic photos everywhere. The grounds are well-kept and a treat for the eyes. Lovely place; two nights was not enough; I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciation for personalized attention received from Vladimir Sokolov”
Reviews.Author: Dragana D
Reviews.Content: During my recent business trip I was very pleased with Vladimir Sokolov (employee of Arizona Biltmore) who provided personalized attention to me since I am gluten sensitive person. Sokolov anticipated my needs and was very helpful to serve gluten free food to me during an event that did not have gluten free food. Sokolov's excellent service made my overall event experience much better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: jessejean
Reviews.Content: Sadly, we only were able to spend one night at the Arizona Biltmore. The grounds are lovely, and fun to walk around. The staff is incredibly friendly. We spent our first day walking through the gardens, then enjoying a few cocktails by the fire pits. The second we spent at the cabana pool. Lovely setting and great way to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Desert Resort”
Reviews.Author: dlyerly
Reviews.Content: We've been to Phoenix/Scottsdale many times over the years. We'd never stayed at the Biltmore and decided there was no better time than Valentine's Day. Don't think we'll stay anywyere else after our week-long visit. The historic property is something to behold. The tasty and artfully prepared dishes in restaurants were excellent. Wait staff was attentive but did not hover over you so you could enjoy conversation while savoring quisine. Thanks to Rosen and Sharon who were helpful. Kudos to Rob Razavi who is the Lobby Host/Historian and made us feel welcome and never failed to say hello and asked what we had planned for the day and could he assist with arrangements. The gardens are lovely and painstakingly cared for by staff. Pools, spas and other facilities are open 24 hours daily and spotless. All in all, a very restful and enjoyable stay. Also, located close to shopping center with major anchor stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chicag0traveler_11
Reviews.Content: This was a great property! Loved all the pools and they stay open all night. Rooms were clean and large. Staff was very helpful and nice. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Some Quirks”
Reviews.Author: vhoeven
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business meeting that was held at the Biltmore. We upgraded to the Ocatillo, which in my opnion is worth the extra if you actually use the lounge. Here is what's included in the lounge: - Cont. Breakfast (mainly pastries, wonderful fresh fruit and yogurts). My only compaint was there was no real protein in the mornings. But excellent coffee. - Apps / light dinner: quite amazing food, really. Included things like mini quiches, wings, fresh veggies, mini cheeseburgers (yum) and plenty of nuts/snakcs - Desserts: fair assortment of rich but bite size goodies - Free wine/beer: this is bar far the best part. If you drink in the bars at the Biltmore, prepare to spend $12 - $15 / drink! They are amazing, but really? SO to grab a couple glasses of wine each night here really made more sense. The room we got was an ADA one (which I always seem to get). It was quite possibly the largest room (square foot size) i have ever been in. The walk-in closet could sleep 2 people alone! But they were missing a couple things: no floor length mirror anywhere; the bathroom light switch was outside the bathroom itself; very poor lighting in a large room. Good things included a nice shared patio that looks out onto the pool. A note about the pool: the bar here was never staffed. If you wanted service, you needed to go to the main pool or call room service. If staying at the Biltmore be prepared to walk a ways. The grounds are spread out but lovely! Also, I really enjoyed the yoga and highly recommend taking a class if you have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: Lynn H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous! From the amazing architecture and history, to the landscaping and amenities, we were very happy with our choice as we booked this hotel as a package with Southwest Vacations. If you would like a coffee maker in your room, just request one on check-in. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury~ for a price”
Reviews.Author: Joan9101
Reviews.Content: Luxury ~ for a price My husband and I attended a conference at the Arizona Biltmore. The setting is beautiful, full of history, and well maintained. Here are a few things I would like to have known before checking in: 1. Self parking- $12 a day. Other fees amounted to more than $60 a day above the room rate. 2. No coffee maker in the rooms, however, if you ask, they will provide a coffee service (tip from another review) 3. Tours of the resort are only conducted Tues, Thurs and Sat. at 10 am. Well worth the time! 4. We only ate at Frank & Albert’s while at the resort. We chose to eat outside near the fireplace. The food was delicious, priced just right, great service (Mike), and the setting was wonderful. 5. We had a great room in the Garden Wing. It was very large, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small. The heating/AC unit works very well. 6. There is a free shuttle to the Biltmore Shopping outdoor mall- leaves on the hour, with return trips about 10-15 minutes past the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and pretty grounds.”
Reviews.Author: Honoluluchick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ocatilla Club. Rooms are nice. Ocatilla club offers continental breakfast but ends too early ...9:30am on weekdays and 10:00am on weekends. When I'm on vacation I don't want to rush in the mornings. Plus the food selection is a bit sparse. This is why I have rated breakfast as poor. I didn't have breakfast at the other restaurants except for brunch at 'Wright's.' Beautiful landscaping. Grounds and hotel are well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Architecture”
Reviews.Author: SlickWilliam
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for four nights in the Ocatilla club wing of the resort and had a great time. The resort is aesthetically appealing and the grounds are very nice. The only drawback had to do with the timing and availability of dining options at the resort. In the Ocatilla club, continental breakfast is offered only until 9:30 am during the weekday and until 10:00 am on weekends. Given that many people come here to relax and unwind, I thought it was odd that we missed out on the complimentary breakfast since we arrived at 9:35 am on our first morning. It would seem more reasonable to extend the times by at least a half hour for those who like to sleep in a little. We also tried to order light snacks at Wrights bar at 10 pm and were told that the bar restaurant was closed. Fortunately, we were able to order off the room service menu. A similar situation occurred when we wanted to get a snack for our daughter at 3:00 in the afternoon and we were told that we would need to go to their "Frank and Albert's" restaurant. The food there was fine, but I thought it was a little odd that the lobby bar had limited kitchen hours for light snacks. Otherwise, the property was very nice and well maintained. I will submit reviews of their restaurants separately.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great service”
Reviews.Author: jogar1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Biltmore. We got an air / hotel pkg through West Jet. The 4th night was free and the resort fee was waved. The resort is huge, 39 acres. They have every type of room imaginable. We were in a very nice cottage. It had a mini fridge, bar, patio, large bathroom & great bed. Service everywhere in the resort was top notch. Our room was upgraded because we had never been there. We asked for a coffee maker and it was delivered in 10 minutes. Frank & Alberts restaurant was very tasty and great service. Grounds are beautiful, there is a putting green you can use for free, pools everywhere, tennis courts, beautiful fountains. It is a busy resort, conferences, meetings, weddings and more. The Biltmore puts on high class events to regular business meetings. It is very large, so it is never crowded. It has alot of history, and the buildings and architectural features are amazing. A must see.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovations at the Arizona Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: ldugon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my annual visit to the Arizona Biltmore (annual conference for work). The first night I was in a room in the main building which was quite large and beautiful but the echoes from outside made it nearly unbearable to sleep before midnight or after 4 am when they were moving furniture around outside. So they moved me to the Ocatilla Wing. Great renovations to those rooms. The bathrooms in particular were very nice. The greatest improvement at the hotel was the wifi available in the rooms! It is always a beautiful place to stay with a great gym and spa. Just avoid getting a room on the 4th floor of the main building if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovations- likely not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: cjc04
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at the Biltmore considering that it is a historic hotel which Frank Lloyd Wright helped design. The property is very art deco cool. The common areas are great and good for lounging, but the rooms are not so good. Actually, they are in dire need of a renovation and very "motel-ish". They are relatively spacious, but the bathrooms are really outdated and beat up and the furniture is in need of an update, particularly for the price charged. I stayed on the top floor of the Valley building. I would recommend staying on the top floor of a building and close to the main pool. Apparently, the lower levels have a lot of noise and you can hear the people above you. I also had a huge balcony which was nice. I think it is cool how each guest is assigned to a different building...it reminded me of a college campus in a good way. The main pool area is great, and I recommend getting a cabana. The food at the pool is by far the best food I experienced in the hotel (which isn't saying much). The spa is pretty good (likely not updated since the 90's), and I had an amazing massage there. If the hotel updated the rooms, spa, offered better food, and overall made it a bit more luxurious, I would definitely stay here again. However, as it stands now, I recommend getting a bargain price for this property. One more note- it's a bit of a trek from a lot of things in Phoenix, and make sure to take the town cars and NOT the cabs!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: jscottjoplin
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a night at the Arizona Biltmore because we were going to a charity gala there. The public areas are worth the visit - - really beautiful. Check in was great; the room was large and quiet; room service was punctual; and the bed was great. Only complaint is that for the rates that the hotel charges, we were surprised that there was not any turn down service. Also, a resort fee is added to your bill even if you do not use any of the hotel facilities. A newspaper was supposed to be included in the resort fee, but we never received one. Nonetheless, we would stay at the Biltmore again. However, next time I would call for turn down service before we go out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: daddio1960
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in February. Tha place is simply spectacular. My visit did not start so well as my reservation for a king bed was not met. Because of this I was upgraded to a larger room with two queen beds. The following day the hotel called to tell me a king bed was available but we were already settled and satisfied. A fruit and wine basket was sent to my room from the hotel to appea any hard feelings. The grounds and location are stunning. Flowers every where, Camelback Mountain is always in view and nothing ever seemed to be out of place. I don't think I walked past any staff or employee of any type that did not offer a smile and warm greeting. That is unusual in my travels I only ate in one restaurant and the food there was good. Due to schedule, I never ate in any of the other facilities This place is very expensive but we felt that we got what we paid for in terms of service, staff and accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marissa88
Reviews.Content: We hosted our Winter Convention at this property in February. The grounds were beautiful. Everything was clean, the staff was very nice and accomodating. There was one main pool (with a water slide) and several smaller pools through out the property. There is a free shuttle that runs about every hour and takes you to the little Biltmore strip mall. There are several restaurants as well as shops. Macy's and Sak's were also in the strip mall. The two restaurants on property were nice. The property itself is a bit pricey but I would reccomend this Hotel to any family traveling in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5 - great service and food the entire trip”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: We took our family to AZ and stayed at the Biltmore in Sept 2011. We have a 16,14, and 9 year old All loved it. Nice Suprise at check in, they gave us $45 a day of food coupons for the kids to eat. Great time to book there, rates were resonable. We stayed in the Ocatilla section of the hotel which offered , water, soda and snacks during the day and a light breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Frank and Alberts great food as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great resort”
Reviews.Author: okatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore for a conference and it was really fantastic. I have to say if I had been paying the rates we paid with my own money I might have thought it was pretty pricey but all in all it was a very cool place. It was our second time there in the past 10 years and it is worth multiple visits. Fantastic grounds, pool, spa, golf course, tennis. Great areas for walks, bike rides, runs, etc. Location was good and overall a nice place. Try to stay outside the Inn part out on the grounds. Rooms were really just average but if you can get a patio to sit on you will be fine! Too nice to be inside anyway (at least in the winter months).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort grounds with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bloomsbury2001k
Reviews.Content: A comfortable stay in a King room facing the pool, we enjoyed the quiet environment in this resort-like setting. The bathroom was nicely designed with granite countertops, marble floors -- very clean throughout. Food service was good, and prompt. We were there Christmastime, and Christmas eve they served tasty hot cocoa and Christmas cookies in the lobby, which was a wonderful. We did have to open the window to cool off the room, as the thermostat did not seem to go cooler than 70 degrees. Also, the television would revert back to the "welcome" channel every 15 minutes. I asked the front desk for someone to repair this, but no one ever came during our 4 night stay. So engineering service was poor, if at all present. Or they never got the message from the front desk. The concierge admitted that there was nothing to see in Phoenix, and I would have to agree. But my relatives live here, so oh well. Overall, a nice stay, and I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular grounds”
Reviews.Author: mv92691
Reviews.Content: Poolside service - superb. Frank &Alberts restaurant - delicious. Rooms - well appointed. Comfy beds, good bath products. Loved the spa and the ladies locker room - well stocked I just wish they had a shuttle service or better negotiated rates to the main shopping area nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: 55Fordlady
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a trip for his birthday. The Biltmore was excellent. Everything from the accommodations,service, food and grounds were excellent. 100% satisfied

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, RUDE BELL CAPTAIN”
Reviews.Author: Heatherc1125
Reviews.Content: I was on visit recently to the Arizona Biltmore for buisness..overall great hotel, great location, and great service! Only one negative thing was dealing with one of the bell captains(Chris). I came down to the bellstand for some help and was dealing with Chris. The way he talk to me was very discourteous and demenor was very unfriendly. I Just don't understand how a Waldorf-Astoria property has a employee that acts like this, very unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Easter? Please know this...”
Reviews.Author: BCparent
Reviews.Content: I delayed by close to a year, my review of the Arizona Biltmore, because my observations are seriously based on the Easter week/weekend. I am going to tell you what the hotel did NOT tell me, that they should have: An enormous group books almost the entire property for a "Passover VIP" event (apparently many many years running). The issue for any innocent individual family is the following: 100% of the cabanas are booked by this group. So, during your entire stya, even if you wanted to spring the $200 plus (we did) for a cabana, it is not an option; the stunning main grounds on the interior of the property are set up for this group. So, if you want to have a drink, you won't be overlooking the gardens and walkways, you will be overlooking a group that is probably close to 800 people. The group I had no issue with: families enjoying their time as a group. But the "full and fair" use of the Biltmore I have a huge issue with. We didn't get to use many many of the amenities because of such a large group. A small (honestly maybe 10-15 families) group of us just sat shell-shocked by the pool because the resort was clearly scrambling to deal with their biggest paying customer of the weekend. Fair enough. But when we made the reservation, I can't imagine why they wouldn't have said "Full disclosure...we have an enormous group here Easter weekend every year. No cabanas will be available during your stay, and most of the chairs by the main pool will be reserved (in advance) by this group. The tiny upside: this group ate all of their meals in the various banquet facilites, so all the restaurants (except for by the pool) were very serene. We probably won't return (and certainly not at Easter). Just a friendly heads-up that you won't get from the resort itself.

Reviews.Title: “Launch pad”
Reviews.Author: drneideffer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night - just before we left for a three-week trip to Greece. Nice place to stay just before a long flight. Lovely hotel and grounds. Helpful staff and decent restaurants and bar. Drinks a bit pricey, but it goes with the territory I suppose. Would gladly stay here again. Its a one time must hotel if you've never stayed here before. A Phoenix icon, and if you dig Frank Wright's architecture, you'll like it even more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Escape”
Reviews.Author: Rgmugo
Reviews.Content: We escaped for Xmas weekend 2011. Nice rooms, and very elegant property overall. As you might expect everything is very expensive on site (.ie Starbucks coffe is about 80% more than in real world). Loved the golf courses (2). Not desert courses - more like a nice "Munies" with forgiving fairways. Links course wraps around the entire property. Pool area is first class with separate pool for kids with giant water slide. Not too busy given it was Xmas and a bit chilly. Close to massive shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: indydiver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights at the Arizona Biltomore where he was attending a conference. Our room was spacious and newly renovated. We had a king-sized bed, large TV and 2 sinks in the bathroom. We had a patio that overlooked one of the pools. The linens were lovely and the bed was comfortable, although a bit too soft for my liking. There was a clock radio that was also an iPod docking station which was nice. The room had a typical mini bar with overpriced items, but that was to be expected. Instead of a coffee maker there was a hot pot and French press. The food and service were good. Drinks were overpriced we thought. There were many places where groups could sit and chat, inside and out. A few areas had large gas fire pits which were nice during the cool evenings. This facility felt more like a business conference center than a resort hotel. There were two or three conferences going on most of the guests seemed to be involved in one of those. The pools were fairly deserted, I never saw anyone playing tennis and there were very few children. I rented a bike for an hour one day and rode along the canal. All I saw were the backs of some very uninteresting houses. There didn't seem to be any interesting places nearby to ride to. My husband loves this place -- probably because he usually has meetings in office buldings or boring conference centers. For him it was a real treat to spend three days in such a lovely setting. I think everyone in his group felt the same way because they all decided to hold their conference there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property and well maintained.”
Reviews.Author: sftraveling1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel; it’s like a piece of art. The grounds are well maintained, the rooms are spacious and there’s plenty to see and do. There’s golf, spa treatments, tennis, hiking, you name it they have it. I had a car service take me to the hotel, Phoenix is hard to get used to their surface streets. There’s an Enterprise rent a car on the property which is way more convenient than trying to get to and from the airport. Ok the only thing that was strange to me is there’s no coffee maker in the room. I mean they thought of everything here except coffee. I found out this morning that, they could bring me a coffee maker, there’s a café and free coffee at the spa. It would have been really nice to know this say 8 hours ago! Otherwise this or the Phoenician and maybe the JW Marriott are the only places to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ChefJoshua
Reviews.Content: No water first night...construction/renovation in room adjacent to mine next day. This hotel reminds me of Undercover Boss, but in this episode the employees try their hardest, and managment can't get out of their way. The construction next to me was an all-day buzz so - management feigned not being aware of the (ongoing) construction project. Excellent restaurants, excellent front line staff, but management leaving magazines in every room in which Conrad Hilton declares that the Biltmore is a five-star experience do not make it a five-star experience. Would not stay here again, but would dine here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and historic-but the rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: purplehotgirl
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is gorgeous and the gardens were lovely. There's a lot of history and they showcase it, which was nice to see. I loved that they had a shuttle to the mall that is close by. I ordered soup at their "cafe", flavorless.....I tossed it. I was going to buy a banana, but not for $2.50! The maid did a good job, but there was no plug for the I-pod-clock, I saw a huge dust bunny and the filter for the air that was in the ceiling was so black, it had to be over a year old. The mini-bar was fully snacked, if you wanted to spend $13 for a bag of nuts! All of the staff was very friendly. I'd return for a business conference, but not personally

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in all phases”
Reviews.Author: namedeplume
Reviews.Content: Three day stay as part of a business trip. Stay was five start in all respects. Particularly memorable was reception outdoors. Food was fantastic - service to match.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Bezaire
Reviews.Content: What a magical place of history, beauty and comfort, Great location to get around. Golf walking distance, Every President since 1932 has stayed here. Marilyn Monroe enjoyed this place too. Gardens and grounds in wonderful shape. Orange trees, grapefruit trees, lemon trees, putting area, pools, spa, exercise room, great restaurants, out door fire pits, hot tubs, Too beautiful to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best there is”
Reviews.Author: ptolemy8
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in the world, and it shows. Beautiful grounds, wonderful rooms, excellent food and staff. We stayed several days while on business in Phoenix and it became very hard to want to leave the hotel grounds. The staff is exactly what you want: always available, never intrusive. The food at Wright's is outstanding. In a word of deteriorating service and dull food, it is a true delight. The Frank Lloyd Wright connection is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Retro, Relaxing Feel”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore for two nights, as part of a business event. My room was spacious, and gracious, in a very retro way. The bathroom was a woman's dream, spacious, with all sorts of space to spread out. The grounds of the resort are well tended, and the service everywhere was very gracious, without being cloying. All is all, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, nice ambience made my stay a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveller99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Biltmore this week as part of a leadership retreat for work. I found the hotel staff to be the best part of the stay - in every interaction, they were attentive, curteous and genuinely seemed to care that my need was addressed. The hotel itself is pretty cool too - lots of history (president's stay there, though apparently Obama has not yet, AND he was in AZ this past week - I feared a lock down.. thank goodness he took a pass). Parts of the hotel were designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and that gives the hotel a very unique feel. My room was large, bedding was "Westin-esque" (Excellent) and all amenities were there. I most enjoyed the atmosphere on the patio, sitting by the fire pit in the evening with my team mates meeting people from all over the world. Great stay, thanks Biltmore!

Reviews.Title: “typical resort hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: cantravnut
Reviews.Content: I was booked here for a conference and was quite excited about the Frank Lloyd Wright architecture and history. There are old photos all around the hotel and the lobby is interesting, but overall it was a disappointment. I don't think the modern iteration with its 8 pools and condos all over the place likely matches Frank's vision. My room had a vaguely "mission" decor but the furniture was not even real wood and the veneer was chipping off - quite a disgrace given that this style is all about function, honest materials, etc. My room was absolutely tiny with a small window, a dirty skylight and worn carpet. I had to have the service people in to repair the broken safe and the heat that didn't work (service was very responsive however, and problems were fixed promptly). It's a sprawling resort with gym, spa, tennis, golf, 2 restaurants, etc, but everything is pay as you go, and it is not close to anything, so once you are here, you are trapped and forced to pay outrageous prices (they have a small cafe with starbucks coffee at more than twice starbucks prices!). The restaurants had average decor, average food and slow service. If you have a rental car and are here mainly for the golf, it may be OK, but otherwise I'd skip it.
