It was Friday and it was packed. So took a little time to get served, but the server was very good, just very busy. Then the next evening we had a terrific dinner in Wright's for my wife's birthday. The food was plentiful and delicious and the service was superb. They unexpectedly comped us a great souffle for the birthday. Very nice! Our room had only wired internet service, so we could not use wi-fi on our iPhones. However Verizon's 3G worked throughout the property. This was our third visit there over the years. We may try another hotel for our next visit, but will probably return to Wright's for at least one dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Liars, Tramps and Thieves.”
Reviews.Author: onetwoko
Reviews.Content: Awful...just awful. I stayed here for a week at the end of July. A MAID STOLE MY COMPUTER, IPHONE, AND DOCUMENTS FROM MY ROOM!!! After meeting with the manager and security I was assured I would be reimbursed by their insurance company and have a night deducted from my folio. When the bill came not only did they charge me for the 'free' night, they also charged me for my free AmEx platinum night. Then the insurance company declined to pay for ANYTHING. I should've filed a police report right then and there, but i (mistakenly) chose to believe their employees. Stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, but slips on some of the details”
Reviews.Author: sfaaron12345
Reviews.Content: I recently shared the following feedback with the manager of the hotel, however I've not heard back from him. ----------------- Dear Manager, I wanted to share some feedback from a recent stay at your resort. I was in room 6143 in the Ocatilla building. It was a delight to spend a couple of nights at such a lovely property. The room and grounds were immaculate. I do have some specific things to bring to your attention. Here they are, in no particular order. I * Hair dryer didn't work; had to request replacement when I was already running late. * Outlet in bathroom didn't work * Glass light in one headboard could not be turned off via switch * Wireless Internet access did not work * Outlet next to bed did not work * Phone line was crossed with another room, received calls from adjacent room (6141) * Sliding plantation shutter door stuck * Front door latch loose * Small item- maid left cleaning rag on back of chair This is a list of small items, but there are so many issues it makes me wonder what kind of inspections are done to ensure things are well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mrscherry2000
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is a great resort with beautiful buildings. The hotel is designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and is the oldest resort in Phoenix but does not have that worn down look I have experienced at most other historic resorts. I stayed in the Paradise Wing next to the pools and the room was a nice size and a very comfortable bed. The lounge area outside the main lobby is a great place to have drinks after dinner. They have fire pits set up to take the chill off. The location is great as there is shopping and an amazing choose of great restaurants a short ride away. For exercisers, there is a two mile loop for running and walking and the fitness center is about average size for a resort this large. During a large conference, I can imagine the machines would fill up in the morning if you didn't get there early enough. My biggest complaint was the internet. It kept cutting out and was rather slow.

Reviews.Title: “Biltmore Phoenix Arizona”
Reviews.Author: EdnaG4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I truely enjoyed the experience of staying at such a famous hotel. The nostalgic charm was great. My only complaint was that the pool was always luke warm at best. Shopping and restaurants in the area were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: HapTrav12345
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful property! If you’re history buff, this is a great hotel to stay in and take the historical tour. The property was just stunning. I stayed in the Ocatilla building, which has a complimentary lounge which serves breakfast and food and drinks throughout the day. There is a lot of walking to get from building to building, which is not very pleasant in the heat of Arizona during the middle of the day. I don’t think I would have minded had I been on vacation rather than dressed for business. The setting is beautiful and the views were amazing. The pools looked beautiful, though I didn’t get a chance to enjoy them. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service and food wonderful but the room was shabby”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler9000
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in a cottage room and while the food, service and grounds are lovely and wonderful, the room was in dire need of an update. Bugs in the overhead light fixtures, ripped and broken lamp shade as well as the headboard was very worn and scatched. The desk area was small and the internet, albeit free, was extremely slow. Not worth the $275 plus I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Price - Four Star Service”
Reviews.Author: dreamdestinations
Reviews.Content: This was our third year of staying at the Biltmore. The first two years we enjoyed very much even though the stay is quite pricey. This year we found the service was slow and not as top notch as in the past. It's a beautiful resort and great venue for our conference each year. There are a number of meeting rooms for business meetings or special occasions and the grounds are perfect locations for outdoor gatherings. Sunset is especially beautiful with fire pits and large outside seating areas for food or drinks or admiring the mountain views. The 2 bars are great places for socializing and are easily located off the lobby. The property has 39 acres with a variety of lodgings. From cottages (small but cozy)scattered about the spacious grounds (some with jacuzzi and private grassy areas that would be perfect for large family reunions), to small rooms located inside the main buliding, or larger rooms located in outer bulidings (many of the outer bulidings have separate swimming pools), or the larger villas. There is a terrific spa with a very well equipped gym and about 7 or more tennis courts. The property was built in the 1920's in the Frank Lloyd Wright style with art deco furnishings in the accomodations as well as the puplic areas of the resort which are all very well maintained! There is a lot of hisory behind the walls of the Biltmore from it's beginnings to it's famous guests list. We have stayed in the Terrace Rooms (with a small quiet pool for guests) which have either ground floor private patios or private balconies on the upper floors. We always request mountain views which are magnificant at sunset. The rooms/bathroom are separated and large. The furnishings are in soft tones. We have never found the rooms to be less than clean and comfortable.....I'm very fussy about the condition of my room and have never had a complaint. We have also stayed in the newly renovated Ocatilla building that's considered a "hotel within a hotel" because of the concierge service and a separate room that serves complimentary snacks and drinks at certain times of the day along with other amenities that are only offered to guests in that building. These rooms are very spacious with an abundance of light from the french balcony on the upper floors (floor to ceiling sliding door) or the patios on the ground floor. The Ocatilla building has it's own fountain & large pool which much more tranqil than the main pool (the main pool has a large water slide, cabanas, and a Cabana Club Restaurant - great for families). The bathrooms, in the Ocatilla rooms, are tiled and very nice with a separate toilet room (very very small - 2 1/2 foot by 5 foot - too small for a large person), double sinks, large shower stall and good size bath tub. The iced water dispensers around the pool areas are a real plus especially when the weather in Phoenix can be very HOT!!!! The children's play area is very well equiped and the resort has a children's day care with supervised activities for all ages. The shops are extremely over prices - better to go to the mall down the road. The cafe is a great place for light food and Starbuck's coffee. The Frank & Albert's restaurant and the Wright's at the Biltmore have wonderful food. My husband is a foody and we found the restaurants' chefs had put together a yummy variety of dishes. Even though the service was a bit slow, we really enjoyed eating at both restaurants. A private town car from the airport was $35 one way. Overall, this is a lovely place to visit.....at least once. Try to find out what conferences are taking place. If it is a very large conference - try to schedule another time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover”
Reviews.Author: MrsNCFC
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night after flying in to Phoenix before our grand tour of Arizona, Nevada & California. After 20+ hrs traveling this was a welcome retreat. Great location & lovely building. We have stayed at a Waldorf Astoria hotel before so knew to expect a slightly aging property but with great bed, toiletries and food. It did not disappoint. Bed was amazing, great shower pressure and food in the bar was not gigantic American portions so we could actually eat it all! As ever it is always a pleasant surprise for free soft drink refills. Great service. Only thing we would do differently is valet parking. We self parked & with temperatures over 110 degrees this was a bit daft! Let the great staff park your car & take your things to your room- the tip is worth it. If you are traveling by car there is a Safeway within 1 mile to pick up essentials (and not so essentials!) for the journey. Make sure you pick up plenty of water and a cool bag which you can fill with ice at each stop.

Reviews.Title: “Jeckyl and Hyde experience!”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this iconic hotel for four nights at the end of August. The hotel is beautiful and the communal areas are maintained to a very high standard as of course are the rooms. My only moan is because it is the hotels low season that over the weekend of my visit the hotel was absolutely packed with families and groups there for the weekender special deal. As a consequence the pool areas were packed to the rafters and any sense one had that they were staying at an exclusive beautiful hotel quickly evaporated. It was more like staying at Butlins). This sense was further underlined when a significant delegation of tattooists arrived to commence their conference. Lol.

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Sportsinfo101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time this last week for a business conference. My stay was enjoyable. This hotel is not what I would call a typical traditional hotel. There is a sprawl of rooms set out over a large area but the grounds, rooms and general meetings areas were all clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: alliecat1014
Reviews.Content: Had a convention here and everything was wonderful! My only complaint is no coffee in the rooms. But great food, great atmosphere, beautiful grounds, and A/C galore. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ellen J
Reviews.Content: Came here with my daughters for a weekend getaway. Had an amazing time, everyone we passed was extremely friendly and knowledgable, we got lost a couple of times and every one we asked for directions was more than helpful and got us exactly where we wanted to be. The food was wonderful, had breakfast and lunch at the Cafe, the breakfast pastries were delicious as well as the Gelatos they offered. The rooms were a little outdated, but that is to be expected when a hotel is as old as the Biltmore. But the rich history more than makes up for the outdated-ness. my daughters and I definitely plan on another getaway here

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend-wedding venue”
Reviews.Author: SebastianDallas
Reviews.Content: We have a large family wedding at the Arizona Biltmore. It was wonderful for everyone to be in one place for all the activites; old folks, young folks, everyone was happy. The food and service was great. Summer rates were deeply discounted.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every regard”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkinExile
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is beautiful, relaxing, and exceptional in every regard. While the architect of record is Albert Chase McArthur, the environment displays the extraordinary talent of Frank Lloyd Wright, a "consultant". There is a visual and visceral tranquility unprecedented in the contemporary "top this" resort scene. Seven pools from kid friendly to book friendly. Foods option from the elegant "Wright Room" to "relaxed but excellent "Albert and Franks", to take out Starbucks Cafe. Great tip: last year we went the week before Christmas for low rates, a chiefs gingerbread competition, stunning Christmas decorations, and relaxing by fire-pits sipping tea and enjoying the Craftsmen's lanterns, Wright "Sprite" sculptures, garden and mountain views.

Reviews.Title: “Style, character and space”
Reviews.Author: Alinta B
Reviews.Content: - summary - This is a good hotel with a great feel. It is spacious, stylish and has character. - purpose - We attended for a conference and it suited that purpose very well. - buildings - It consists of historic parts and newer parts - we preferred and stayed in the main building. Some of this looks a bit tired, (80s or 90s tired rather than 30s tired). It is an historic building (Frank Lloyd Wright and all) - as evidenced by its reputation and by the framed newspaper cuttings. Unfortunately the history is often hidden, with an explanatory tour of the hotel for guests only occurring once a week. - location - It is not particularly close to anything because it was originally built to be out of town. Since then the town has caught up with it so where once (in the 30s) guests would have been surrounded by orchards or desert, it is now surrounded by suburbs (and a golf course). It still has a spacious desert feel. facilities - the facilities are good - the restaurants are excellent particularly breakfast. The staff are generally friendly and pleasant. The grounds are well kept so that this has a definite 'oasis' feel with lots of space.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic pools and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Clawbakes
Reviews.Content: Came for a conference, arriving a day early to have a mini vacation. Pools are amazing and very well maintained. Cabana bar offers up delicious food and drink, perfect for relaxing with a book by the pool. Rooms are very large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Overall just an average experience”
Reviews.Author: ftoader
Reviews.Content: Been to a conference here so I was pretty busy most of the time without enjoying the bar, restaurants or pools. They look pretty nice. However, I stayed in the Valley wing where the everything seems pretty old and tired. Doors still have the key knob, carpets are very used looking, same with bathrooms. There is no coffee maker and the snacks are extremely expensive. A small bottle of water (not even cold) is $8. A/C unit is noisy and has only ON/OFF manual controls. There was a lot of noise coming from the bathroom walls every time someone in the adjacent rooms was flushing or running water, or maybe their A/C units - God knows what some of those noises were. There is a resort fee of $28 per day that includes Wi-Fi in room. However, it was not working and after many tries I called the front desk to find out it was not working in the entire building. The cable was however working after calling the help desk again to figure it how to make it really work. The architecture of the resort is nice (Frank Lloyd design) but it is overrated and over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pools & Layout”
Reviews.Author: kris1914
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Biltmore. The pools are gorgeous and the layout of the villas and the way the hotel is set up is very apartment/campus like but in a very upscale way. The grounds had a ton of space to have a picnic, play games and eat outdoors. The rooms could have been laid out much better but the overall it was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa!”
Reviews.Author: sydni b
Reviews.Content: I am an Arizona Resident who lives near the resort and happen to LOVE their spa! Each time you enter the Spa you are greeted with a friendly smile. They are very accommodating to any requests you may have. It is very quiet, soothing and peaceful. The locker rooms are nothing too fancy with, but have everything one may need. There are two of the BEST attendants in the women's locker room, Sylvia and Lisa. If you need anything at all they will happily accommodate the request! HANDS DOWN two of the nicest women I have encountered at a Spa! The treatments are always great! Spa Week is a great value. I would recommend a visit to their spa to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Kid's Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thePrettysDoTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the AZ Biltmore with my family in 2000 and I can only imagine it has improved since then. But when we were there, it was a wonderful place. There are plentiful options for swimming and the grounds are extensive, so there is much to explore. The one downside was the lack of restaurants and the expense of those that were on-site. We bought food from the grocery store for breakfast, and travelled off-site for the rest of our meals. That being only a slight inconvenience, the rest of the trip was just perfect.The weather and surroundings are hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly HOT”
Reviews.Author: LynnandSam
Reviews.Content: Beautiful pools helped alleviate the temps. Food was good service was good hotel is beautiful and interesting. Our suite was large and had a little balcony, however, it was overdue for a renovation. The room was dated and there was no wireless access except in public areas. We were there for a meeting and even though it was a large group of various ages everything appeared to run smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: ualsdguy
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Biltmore every year and love it! Each time we've been there the staff are friendly, helpful and seem genuinely caring and concerned that our stay exceeds our expectations. We have stayed in a few different wings of the hotel (our favorite being the Ocatilla wing). The Ocatilla rooms are newer than the classic rooms, but every room we have been in has been extremely spaceous, with nice amenities and always spotless. Beds are very comfortable with feather pillows and down blankets. The architecture is amazing and the grounds are beautiful, staff waves and say hello when passing by. The water slide at the main pool is great fun! This is one of our favorite resorts to have our yearly "chill out" vacation. Everything you would ever need is at the resort and you would never have to leave if you didn't want to. Food choices and restaurants are wonderful albeit a bit pricey but to be expected at a resort. There are activities for kids as well as adults throughout the day and evening such as salsa making at the main pool, marshmallow roasting some evenings and more. We will continue to go back to the Biltmore and would not even consider another resort in Phoenix. The place is just amazing in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families and friends”
Reviews.Author: oregongrrl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Biltmore - the room was large, clean, and had a private patio where we enjoyed the late evenings. The grounds were beautiful and my mom and sister, who accompanied me on a four-day business trip, spent an entire day walking through the gardens and trying out the different pools (eight of them!). It's away from the central business district, but still close to shopping and some good restaurants, although you'll need a car since there is little within walking distance. Warning: a venti cup of morning Starbucks coffee at the Cafe will set you back $4.25 instead of the $2 you'd pay elsewhere but you can drink it on a patio overlooking an impossibly green lawn for a desert climate. Beds were comfortable, bath was adequate, and overall we had a great time here and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “OMG...Thought I was in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Sara C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous and provides top service and amenities. The layout is exquisite, as it is the only hotel designed by Frank Lloyd Wright. You are transported to a beautiful place of architectural details, lovely landscaping, and exquisite pool, lounging, and relaxation areas. The restaurants are exceptional with great food and very engaging and accomodating wait staff. I didn't want to leave but had to and will definitly go back for a real vacation!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay for an architect lover - particularly FL Wright”
Reviews.Author: acodymass
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay at this historic, upscale hotel and resort was wonderful. The rooms have all the amenities one would expect from such a prestigious establishment. The entire staff was helpful and friendly. There are many spots on the grounds to sit and relax - to enjoy the Wright influenced architecture. The lobby reflects many of the man's best design principles.There are a golf course, shops, bars and restaurants on site. Pools are on various spots throughout the property. The only slight negative - the shower drained slowly and gradually filled. A call to service was not answered with attention to the problem by the next morning when showering in a puddle was repeated. But this was the only negative about an otherwise enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stop the smoking at the Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Americanbrazilian
Reviews.Content: We go annually to spend a week at the Biltmore in conjunction with business. The grounds are fantastic with kids, so much room to roam and a beautiful setting, however, last year the pool was overrun by conference attendees who hoarded around the shallow are of the main pool and the steps from the pool that has the water slide for kids and smoked incessantly. There was literally no place to move where you could be close to the shallow entrance with your kids and not be overcome by smoke. They really need to either make the entire pool are no smoking or at a minimum confine smokers to the other pool away from the shallow are where most kids play and can easily get in and out. You would think adults could figure this out on their own, but they did not and it made the late afternoons at the pool pretty unpleasant for those who have children. The spa/gym closes too early, but some of the locker room attendees were particularly pleasant and helpful. Otherwise we love going to this place. The rooms outside of the main hotel are big enough to accommodate families with kids and you cannot beat the weather and location.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning resort hotel with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: NatureGoddess
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference, and was really impressed by the service and the facilities. The grounds and buildings are lovely, the pools are clean, the bar and restaurant service is good. A very nice place to spend a week or a few days.

Reviews.Title: “August in the heat!”
Reviews.Author: Daweb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a quick weekend get-a-way here in order to skip out on the Hurricane that hit the East Coast. :-) The weekend started off a bit rough as I had booked my stay via American Express Travel and when I went to check in, the hotel assured me that I had cancelled our reservation. I had trouble getting through to American Express travel as they were dealing with a lot of issues from the hurricane as well. I rebooked my room directly with the hotel and once I contacted Amex they took complete care of getting everything worked out. They were (as usual) the best! I will say that the staff I dealt with concerning the reservation were extremely courteous and were only interested in how to get me checked in and taken care of. I appreciated their attitude as it was hot and I was a bit tired. They certainly took good care of us. The room was a very nice size with plenty of room and the AC was both quiet and effective. We walked the grounds a bit and the resort is a beautiful place, with plenty to keep buys and cool. We had lunch at the restaurant as well as at the cafe on different days and were well cared for in both instances. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in the Phoenix area. We worked with the concierge in the Executive Lounge in the club room building to find and arrange a desert tour in a Humvee that was excellent. Kim provided excellent options and advice concerning our options.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: vacationx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the 4th of July. It as a great time. The staff we very friendly, and gave us some great recommendations for restaurants. The architecture of the hotel was grand and kept perfectly, The grounds were kept quite well, and were nice to walk around. The room was nice and kept clean. Parking was very limited near the hotel, so if you don't mind walking, there is plenty in the garage. The pool area was cramped, and not kept very clean. Cups, dishes, and trash was left and often not cleaned will the next day. The included breakfast was amazing. Red velvet pancakes are impressive and will keep you going all day. We rented a car a drove ourselves all over to see the sights. It was totally worth it. We knew it was going to be hot, so we planned accordingly with our activates. The gem was the restaurant 'the Barrio' the concierge recommended- great margaritas and excellent happy hour tacos. That alone was worth the trip. The spa had some nice areas and always had ice water and space in the lounge. The staff was very pleasant and always accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “The Arizona Biltmore has the IT factor...”
Reviews.Author: kaluss
Reviews.Content: I just love this place...have stayed here 2x before and for me, there is just something about it that puts me in a very relaxed frame of mind. The grounds are beautiful, there is nice scenery, good places to take walks, the staff is very nice and I have decided it just has that certain something that some places don't have....the intangible. And that's what makes it special. If you're going through reviews wondering if you should make a reservation here....do it, you will not be disappointed. This place is great and they know how to run a resort. Have only come here with solo or with my wife so not sure if it would be a hit with the kiddies...

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: osodoro
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful. The Ocotilla Club is wonderful. Rooms are very well appointed. Our meals were good, not great. Service poolside was awful. It took 1.5 hours to get our meal. We were there the same weekend as a large college-aged conference. Ruined our stay. They were very noisy and partied until the wee hours. They also turned the pool area into a frat party. The golf was good but not great. Spa was OK but small. With all of the top-flight resort option available in the Phoenix-Scottsdale area the Biltmore seems to be relying on its past to make up for its present short-comings. Try the Boulders, Four Seasons, Phoenician, Hyatt Gainey Ranch, Camelback Inn, or even the Wigwam instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, wrong time to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrdbake
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is a fantastic property. Unfortunately, they catered to families with small children this summer. It wasn't too bad. But it did take it's toll on some of the staff and we noticed it. I really liked this resort. The grounds are maintained immaculately. The service was excellent. The bellmen worked their butts off and did great. The hotel offered various activities like a salsa making demonstration and a local cigar maker stopped by to show how he rolls cigars. The restaurant was good but over priced. The room was spacious and very clean. I would love to stay here again when there are less children. There were just too many of them. The running up and down the halls screaming was very jarring. We paid extra for the Ocatilla experience which is kind of an exclusive part of the hotel that offers a private lounge, pool and personal Concierge. The intimacy was spoiled with all the noise. This would have been an excellent experience if we stayed a little later in the year. I would definitely recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: kbshoop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a relaxing weekend and it delivered. The Ocotillo section of the hotel has great rooms and gives you access the lounge for food and drinks. The concierge in the lounge, Leo, was excellent and really helped us enjoy the weekend. There was always something to do on the property, the food was good and the staff was overly friendly everywhere we went. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Sbaz040
Reviews.Content: Good: nice looking hotel and good location. Bad: sinks pumped up yellow liquid with black flakes and didnt drain. I called the front desk and had them send someone up in 1 hour since i had guests till then, he arived 10 minutes later, i was embarressed. We made plans for an engineer to stop by at 3 pm, he got there at 6 pm, again when we had guests, after 3 days it still hasent be fixed. The front desk offered to downgrade me to a different room. Every 15 minutes the TV goes to channel 00, kind of annoying when your trying to watch football.

Reviews.Title: “Still a jewel of the desert”
Reviews.Author: maelpielUsa
Reviews.Content: We ended our soccer trip with our teens staying one night at the Arizona Biltmore. It was a pleasant surprise to find the hotel so well maintained, and we got a great price due to the low season. Great pool. Definitely worth a visit even if you are not staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: Honestreviewer056
Reviews.Content: This is a big place, so if walking is an issue be sure to let them know for a good location. Has it all-- wonderful staff, superb rooms, gorgeous grounds, great spa with the locker room by itself containing sauna, steam, and whirlpool. Frank Lloyd Wright inspired architecture is incredible..just can't say enough good things.

Reviews.Title: “Great summer rates - I will be back, despite unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: whosaidso8
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is a historic hotel/resort with lots of character. You walk into a time-machine because of decor and the feel of the place. While historic, it does have a nice spa, fabulous swimming pools (I think three on site), and current amenities, including flat screen TVs. I enjoyed my stay, overall, but I was very disappointed with the front desk staff. They were unfriendly! The bell staff, and the spa staff were great, but the front desk staff left much to be desired. Tips: - If you want a new, contemporary decor, this may not be the place. - The resort charges upwards of $25 a night resort fee. I associated this with the use of (wired) internet service. It would be nice if it were wireless. - The resort is near the Biltmore shopping area and restaurants. We had a nice meal at True Food - good food, mediocre service.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad & the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Pastorkenaz
Reviews.Content: The good... world class service throughout the resort... from bellmen to wait staff and pool bar to front desk everyone was helpful and went out of their way to make us feel special. When the bell staff found out it was our anniversary they sent chocolate covered strawberries and champagne to the room. Thodor, Bellman; was AWESOME! The first room we were sent to was nothing like described on the Biltmore's website. It smelled of mold and overall was dismal. Thodor got on the phone, called the manager and we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. The bad: For such a highly rated restaurant; Frank and Albert's food was mediocre. The pizza my wife ordered was bland and unimaginative. I've had better frozen pizzas. The Arizona cheese curds were a nice treat; at least the first third. After that the cup they were presented in was filled with grease. Even 3 napkins couldn't dry them enough to make them edible. The website is so outdated it should be taken down. They're advertising a fabulous Sunday brunch at Wrights restaurant; which by the way has been closed for renovation for some time. The ugly: No pride in their property. Where do I begin? The suite: The carpet was filthy. I'm not talking about a little dirt or a few spots. The carpet behind the door and along room edges was off white, nice and clean while the traffic areas were dark and grimy. The sheer curtains dark and dirty at the bottom edges. The spots ranged from black to yellow and red (I'm still trying to figure out what the red and yellow might be)....Crumbs were found in my coffee cup at Frank and Albert's. The plate was dirty - yes, this can happen from time-to-time at Denny's, but at a 5 star resort, really? Along the pathway plastic bottle of water was there for more than a day. Saturday evening a pair of black socks were added and remained well into Monday morning. Still not sure they've ever been picked up. Question: Has money gotten so tight at the Arizona Biltmore they can now pinch a penny and make 6 feet of copper wire? If you're looking for great service; this is the place. If you're looking for a property that matches the service; I'd look somewhere else. Overall - I'd give it a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds and pool, however parking, food prices, and room noise from air conditioner ruined the pleasant atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: toughone
Reviews.Content: We rented a pool side cabana with a friend, it had it's own bathroom and refrigerator. Outside food was not allowed, so we indulged on free chips and salsa that is available on Sat. Afternoon by the pool. A bucket of 6 beer ran us $32 a bucket and an appetizer was $17.50 (yikes). The parking was the worst, even if you use valet. The rooms looked great, until you were woken up every 45min by the air conditioning noise. It sounded like a cement drill. Last but not least, no coffee pot in room, and a sm coffee ran you $4. , an appetizer was

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Service Surrounded by Beauty!”
Reviews.Author: JustGetGoing
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, spacious rooms and impeccable service. From the front desk to the event planners, everyone made sure that my needs were met. I did not hear the word "no"! Breakfast and lunch at Frank & Albert's was fantastic every time! The Sunday brunch was excellent with an omelet bar, fresh fruit, hot and cold items, etc. (Just watch out for the birds--do not leave your food unattended even for a second!) Lunch was delicious each time I ate there--Fish Tacos and the Chicken & Goat Cheese Flats were my favorites. For room service, the Portabello "Burger" was the best! The spa was perfect and workout area adequate. Several pools on the grounds. I recommend getting a room in the Ocatilla Building and adding the "Club Level" to have access to "free" breakfast, snacks throughout the day, and wine and beer in the evenings as well as sweets at night. This will actually save you money on the breakfast alone. The grounds and buildings are absolutely beautiful--lots of outdoor seating, fire pits, misters for keeping cool in the hot weather, etc. Rooms have flat screen t.v.s, nice seating areas, internet connections with good work space. The bathrooms have granite counter tops, tubs and showers. Double sinks, drawer space, separate toilet area, etc. I hope to return one day soon! I spent 9 nights and 10 days here and almost didn't want to leave even though I was on business!

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion rocked @ The Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: VacationSidMeister
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion for about 100 members of our family at the Arizona Biltmore over a 3 day weekend last December. Needless to say, the resort grounds were breathtaking, and very relaxing! We absolutely loved the outdoors. We all had rooms in the Ocotillo wing. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The Ocotillo lounge with breakfast and all day coffee and tea service was a start attraction for our family:) We did not eat at the hotel's restaurants so can't review them. But all that we experienced was very nice. The one problem we had was that when we initially approached the hotel to book our reunion, we made clear to them that we have lots of kids - and they assured us they 'love families and kids'. But during our 3 day stay, we got the evil eye from other guests over our let's call it the kids' enthusiasm and inability to whisper 24/7. That put a damper on the mood at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: fasiVirginia
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Arizona Biltmore. We were taking our daughter to Arizona State University. The service is incredible and the grounds are beautiful. The location was perfect. Very easy to go back and forth to ASU and very close to a very nice mall with great shopping and great restaurants. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa - it was very spacious, beds were very comfortable, but it was a little dated. However, I would stay there again. The food at the resort was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise. The view of Piestewa Peak from the courtyard was amazing.”
Reviews.Author: lcworth
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, lodging was very comfortable. Pool was amazing. Sitting around the courtyard at night with a bottle of wine was my favorite part.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Txgourmetgal
Reviews.Content: We were here for a convention and had a few banquets at their conference center. Food was just okay, but grounds and hotel lobby area are just beautiful. Nice restoration of that area and we were given a history tour, but our room needed some updating. There are newer lodging areas that looked nicer. Be prepared for lots of walking. The place is huge and rooms are spread out over the property. Very hot in August, but there are three pools to cool you off.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DarrylBElkRiver_MN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Arizona Biltmore Hotel and were very disappointed. We were looking forward to spending time in a luxury hotel and chose this hotel because of its star rating. The quality of our room and professionalism of staff were not what we expected. Desk clerks were very unfriendly and rude when additional questions were asked regarding our reservation. Directions to our room were poor and the map provided was vague (it is a very large hotel). Our cottage room was small, old and smelled extremely musty. Previous to our stay at the AZ Biltmore we spent five nights at the Radisson and were very pleased with our experience at half the price of this hotel. There are so many other beautiful hotels in the Phoenix area within the same price range as the AZ Biltmore and I would suggest you go there...The Phoenician knows how to treat their guests like royalty! It would be a much better choice (we went there 2 years ago and loved it). Don't make the same mistake as us:(

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to bring the puppies.”
Reviews.Author: MissEileen
Reviews.Content: We live local in the Phoenix area. So on a 105 degree day when our a/c decided to go out, my husband and I decided it would be resort day. But we also had our two dogs with us. Being a Sunday, we started to check out "pet friendly resorts". We were thrilled to find that the Biltmore was one of them. We called, made the reservation, and spoke with them about their pet policy. We arrived at the hotel, puppies and kennel in tow and were very warmly greeted. Well, actually the dogs got the warmest greeting, from EVERYONE!!!! We had a wonderful room, in their "cottages". We were able to have plenty of room for the dogs and their kennels in the room. What was really wonderful about the cottage area is that they placed us in the back and there was a wonderful paddock for the dogs to run in that was enclosed with a gate. Being it August in Phoenix, the resort was not at capacity so we were able to walk the dogs and play with them on the lawns. They loved it and so did we. They also had a room service selection for the pets. I did not want to divert from their diet, so our dogs didn't get it, but I am sure it was fantastic. The puppies sure did love resort day and because they did, we were able to.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: lkhes03
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion at The Az Biltmore over Memorial Day weekend. My family of 6 had 2 rooms for 5 nights. I am from Phx and stay at the hotel often as my Dad lives within walking distance to the hotel. This is the second year in a row that a large conference has taken over the hotel when we were there. This year it was the recovered cocaine addicts. The cigarette smoke haze permeated the pool and public areas- and the noise was unceasing. When I complained to management they acted like "oh really we hadn't noticed, well they will be gone soon" The management of the Waldorf Astoria group would never have their family stay in such conditions. Unfortunately we will stay elsewhere next year.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Retreat”
Reviews.Author: agolfpro2
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore Resort & Spa is an island in the city. It is a retreat, and the fact that it's a Waldorf-Astoria property really says it all. This resort promises a lot and it delivers a lot. There are no short cuts. Of course, expect to pay for what you get. We rented a one room "cottage", which was small, but well-appointed, comfortable, bright and clean. Although it is a large property and somewhat busy, it was very quiet. The gardens and grounds are beautiful; in fact, the entire property is pleasing and easy on the eye. The architecture is rather Art Deco; the furniture Mission style. Generally speaking, things seem to be exactly where they should be. There is an artistic balance throughout that stresses less is more. The staff is professional and pleasing--helpful in every way. Room service is available, as well as fine dining and secluded areas for a cocktail or two. The Arizona Biltmore is indeed a Grand Dame of resorts and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “One of the prettiest resorts I've been to.”
Reviews.Author: PlanninPaula
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, manicured property. Guest rooms were updated, and luxurious. Big comfortable beds. Staff was professional, and on point. Even though we did not frequent them all, there were several pools on site. We were there for the All Star Game, and really made the experience memorable all around. We received 5 Star treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel, be prepared to pay!”
Reviews.Author: 918fortravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore August 1-6th. Even though we live in Arizona, this was our first time to the Biltmore. It is a beautiful, historic hotel and resort that is tucked away quietly in the middle of a busy city. We were there for a conference and were lucky to be able to secure a very good rate for the room. I was very excited to be staying there for the first time! The grounds are beautiful and it was amazing to see the photos on the wall of the resort in its prime! There were so many very cool people who have stayed there and this resort is certainly part of our heritage in our beautiful state. The staff was very friendly upon check-in. When I went to my room, I was under-whelmed to say the least. It did have a very nice view of the golf course, but was extremely dated and very worn. I checked out a friends room, only three doors down and was interested to learn that he had a nicely renovated room. Since I was planning on having a young visitor I asked the front desk if I could have a new room. They were very helpful and showed me a few rooms until I found one that was more suitable for my needs. I got help from a nice bellman and got all my stuff to a new room. I thought I was in heaven until I saw that there was no soap in my room and there were used towels in the bathroom. I tried to find a member of the cleaning staff who could understand my desire to have the room cleaned and finally found someone who understood what I was trying to say. I then left for awhile to go to class. When I returned to the room I thought it was hot, so turned down the A/C. Nothing, still very, very hot in the room. I then went rinse something out in the sink and the plunger broke, not allowing the water to drain. I called the front desk and the sent someone immediately to fix the stuff. He quickly fixed the sink and said he thought it may take awhile for the room to cool down. A short while later I got a call from the front desk to ensure that everything had been fixed. I told them that the sink got fixed, but the room was still very hot! The immediately offered to give me another room. So, once again, I packed back up and moved to a very close room. This one had working A/C and was heaven! That night I went to bed and hear the toilet running constantly. I was embarrassed to call the front desk and complain again, so I left a note for the maid. When I came back to my room the toilet was fixed. However, one flush and it broke again. Again, I was tired of complaining, so I took the lid off the tank to see what the problem was. The toilet needed a new flushing mechanism. I ended up leaving the lid off the tank the entire time and literally lifting the chain to manually flush the toilet. We ate several times at the Frank and Albert's restaurant. The food was fantastic each time, but holy cow the prices! $4 for a soda.....really? If you go to this restaurant, please ask for VICTORIA! She was one of the best servers we have had anywhere. Very helpful and friendly. She helped us entertain our young daughter and went out of her way to ensure we were happy. I guess that people who are fortunate enough to stay there and pay the normal rate don't blink an eye at a $50 breakfast, but for us it was a bit steep. The food, like I said was great, but a bit much for our budget. I will come back for special occasions for sure though! All in all it was a really fun stay. It was great to stay in a hotel with so much history and the architecture was beautiful. I am a huge Frank Lloyd Wright fan, so big thrill to stay here. There are some really great restaurants nearby, check out DELUX and REVOburrito for sure!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame with Excellent Manners”
Reviews.Author: CCKlyman
Reviews.Content: The decor is standard 1980's high end resort, but the rooms are huge, the bathrooms luxurious and the service impeccable. Our room was in a nondescript building a short walk from the main edifice, but the view form the large window was magnificent. We had our own, very private pool, and overall the experience was lovely. We felt very pampered. There is a shopping mall nearby, but most of the good shopping is a hike. You definitely need to rent a car. I would recommend this venue for the business traveler and older vacationers who want comfortable, familiar surroundings. It might be a little stuffy for children.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Excellence”
Reviews.Author: rspeters7
Reviews.Content: As a business trip there was nothing that I wanted for. The staff was incredible! The chef's at Frank & Albert's were wonderful! I can't wait to go back with the wife for vacation!

Reviews.Title: “I'm Going Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: suekapec
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to visit our son in Arizona and thought we'd spend one night at the Biltmore before seeing him. We called the hotel the day we arrived to say we missed our flight and would be arriving later. We wanted to stay in the oldest section of the hotel and have a fabulous meal at the Wright's restaurant. We were very disappointed when we arrived because the oldest section of the hotel and restaurant were closed for renovation just two days earlier....They automatically upgraded our room and sent us chocolates (which were delicious) with a handwritten note. Telling the wonderful young woman who was our waitress at Frank and Albert's restaurant (forgot her name) about our disappointments, she introduced us to one of the waiters from Wrights, who introduced us to Jason, the Sous Chef who made us a special appetizer that we would have experienced if Wright's was open! I want to thank everyone at the Biltmore for their personal attention and care. Thank you to Tim who somehow always bumped into us and made us feel loved. Thank you to Becky for a fabulous tour. I'd recommend this hotel to everyone. We will return again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great historical resort”
Reviews.Author: funreviewing
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a modern, new resort, this is not the place. This resort has a long history of high class, resort level experience. All but one president has stayed here since the opening in the 20s. Our rooms were fair and older but very clean and comfortable. Big TVs and great beds and a patio next to the pool. Great for the kids. The grounds are immaculate. Clean. Service throughout was awesome with exception of the little cafe. These girls were all fairly rude and short with customers. Most people didn't seem to care as they wanted quick and accurate service. Elsewhere, Biltmore service is true RESORT service. The place is beautiful and really enjoyed the history throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: jtallman23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed some rest and relaxation from the daily grind. Summer rates at swanky hotels like the AZ Biltmore are remarkable. So we took advantage and stayed at the Biltmore. The distinct Frank Lloyd Wright architecture sets the atmosphere apart from any other place immediately giving you a sense that you are somewhere special. The hotel benefits from some rich history (if you are interested of course) as well as immaculate grounds and great services. Room service is provided by gentlemen on old-fashioned bicycles. But you should really get out of the room at some point and enjoy the lush pool area, to notch spa, and tasteful Frank & Albert's. If you are in the mood for drinks and a romantic walk with your significant other you need not go far a Wright Bar provides the libations. And the beautiful grounds will do the rest. The AZ Biltmore is still luxurious, still romantic, and still a top destination for out of towners and in-towners alike.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juans50
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is more than a hotel. It is an experience. It is in the perfect location, near great shopping, good restaurants, great pool and pool service, and beautiful homes. Even though it has all those great attractions near it, when you are at the Biltmore you feel like you are miles from all of those attractions. Bring snacks, water, food... the hotel is VERY pricey for these things. Glad I was their for business and on an expense account.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms as we were in town for my graduation ceremony at the University of Phoenix. The staff was extremely friendly and congratulated me on every chance they got. We valeted our vehicle and the team our front could not have been more prompt and helpful. The front desk never missed a beat even though we had a couple special requests. It was a pleasure to speak to staff as they knew how to treat their guests. The room we had was very spacious. Bathroom equipped with walk in shower and large bathtub, 2 sinks, and vanity area. Air conditioning worked so well that we were cold and had to turn it down. Free wired internet in the rooms, wifi in the lobby. Even the balcony was a nice size. Our favorite part of the resort was the pool area. You can rent cabanas. There's a full bar and waitresses will serve you when you are in the pool. Almost like a mini Las Vegas style pool club. We had fun just hanging out by the pool. The rest of the resort gardens are well cared for. Just walking around makes you feel like you are in another place. Some of the architecture takes you back to the 1920s as it keeps its historic charm. I think we will definitely try to make it back here on our next trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “I am back!!!”
Reviews.Author: JULESVERNE66
Reviews.Content: WOW! Just when I thought things could not get any better at the Biltmore, they did! I was there during the all star game with all the high dollar players around and the hotel was definitively at DEFCOM 5. It was great! I had a terrific room great service but most of all Frank and Albert's was the biggest surprise. That restaurant is so accommodating!! They were packed and I asked the waiter if I could get a special dish on the side. No problem chef made it to order. He actually came out to ask me if that was how I liked it and wanted to know if there was anything he could do to make it better! I told him it was so Delicious and thanked him. Guess what? Since I ate it all, he went back into the kitchen and made more! YOU cant go wrong eating or staying here! Infact, I am staying there this whole week! I LOVE the Biltmore and its staff!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and amenities to match the architecture”
Reviews.Author: SBAvanti63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from six fabulous days at the Arizona Biltmore. Although I had to leave most days for our Elks convention meetings, my wife was able to enjoy the facilities to the fullest. Our accomodations were very comfortable and luxurious - making us feel quite at home, but with the amenities you expect from an outstanding resort. The many staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and attentive to serving us as guests. The grounds are beautiful and well-maintained. You cannot help but be taken in by the look and architectural style of the property. There were many other members of the Elks staying there and not once did I hear a word of discontent. Our thanks to everyone at the Arizona Biltmore for making our week so spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Ronda at Wright's made the trip extra special!”
Reviews.Author: u894014
Reviews.Content: The hotel is elegant, the pools are beautiful and the staff is courteous and friendly. The best part was enjoying Wrights, with Ronda as our waitress. Her friendliness and service was so great the first night - we requested to sit in her section again. She is definately a jewel in the Biltmore crown! Marcia L. Minneapolis, Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: kccare
Reviews.Content: I havent been back to the Biltmore in a few years. The renovations they have done to the resort are great! Loved Frank and Alberts and if you are going to try the spa I reccommend the sugar scrub. I have always loved this resort and it seems to get better each year.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting 50s Hollywood feel.”
Reviews.Author: NazanYar
Reviews.Content: The biltmore is a nice hotel in metropolitan Phoenix. Easy access to anything in the area, which is a plus. Even though we came in the summer, conventions were going on, so I can understand several of the previous posts- be prepared at peak times. The rooms are pretty standard for an upscale hotel. The setting is nice, but in June it's a little hot to wander around. I thought the scheduled activities were interesting and well-planned. Note that in summer the pool is bath water hot.

Reviews.Title: “Cheff Todd is amazing”
Reviews.Author: tomguza
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of joining a group of friends for a special dinner in the banquet kitchen. What an incredible experience! Chef Todd and his staff took excellent care of us. The food was amazing - catered to our tastes. The wine accompaniments were excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a second class citizen.”
Reviews.Author: andy68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family during the all-star game because I thought it would be fun. It was a horrible experience. If you weren't a baseball they treated you like dirt. Many of the hotel guests bonded over the rude treatment by staff. The rooms were okay but dated and the pools at some of the other local resorts like the Phoenecian and Princess are far nicer. Food was mediocre at best, and overpriced as expected. I'm still not sure what I got for my $26 resort fee, as they even ran out of towels by the pool by midday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place--Will Be Back Despite a Few Small Kinks”
Reviews.Author: Grmpmbl
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is an outstanding hotel with an outstanding staff. The "kinks" that I mention in my title have to do with some troublesome, minor details, but ones that the management might want to consider. I'd been advised by friends who had been there many times to ask for a room in one of the "Cottages." Despite my having been assured that I was connected to the hotel desk when I called, the person I spoke with had no knowledge whatsoever of the cottages--and in fact, she thought I meant the Villas, which are very expensive and very different from cottages. When my husband and I arrived and made our way from the parking garage, we passed through--guess what?--many buildings labeled "cottages." The front desk was puzzled by this gaffe, and we will try again the next time we visit. Although we had a lovely and large room in the Valley wing (and I agree with the person bemoaning the lack of in-room coffee), there is as of this writing no wireless at the hotel, a problem if you have a laptop such as a Macbook Air with no ethernet port. This was very surprising, and a clerk agreed: she said, "This is 2011, right?" When my husband turned on the water to take a shower (fortunately, he turned on the water from outside the tub), the entire shower head--one of those large "rain" shower head--flew off the connection and into the tub and then into the bathroom. Had he been in the shower at the time, well..... The staff members were eager to make things right when we brought things to their attention. (We hadn't mentioned the shower...) Our keys demagnetized four times--no exaggeration, despite our keeping them away from cell phones, coins, etc.--and when we went to the clerk yet again to have them fixed, the clerk said that such problems were not acceptable and, to our surprise, gave us a small but appreciated credit on our bill. SO...while there were glitches, we'd still go back. The staff members were eager to please, and the place is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Mary's were yummy....”
Reviews.Author: mckmetal8
Reviews.Content: Girls Road trip to Phoenix... our girl friend recently bought a house in Phoenix and so we came to celebrate, decorate, play in her new town.. The AZ Biltmore is listed as one of the 1,000 places to see before you die so we HAD to go.. It was about 102 and we were thirsty.. so we ducked in, the architecture is amazing, decor and BLOODY's just hit the spot. great lounge chairs AC blasting.. and MOLLY at the bar was great. loved Molly's glasses....so check it out, check it off the list of historical sites and knock one back in the heat..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with fantastic grounds and giant rooms”
Reviews.Author: Janey-Sue26
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay in Arizona Biltmore for 3 days - room was spacious and beds small but comfortable. Got a great rate through my travel agent. Didn't like the wildness at the pool in the afternoons - screaming teenagers and empty plastic drink cups did not match the lovely settings. HUNDREDS of soiled beach towels further wasted the atmosphere and the ability to gain a sunbed - why not charge a nominal deposit, say $10, that might encourage people to tidy up? All in all a lovely hotel, a bit let down by it's rowdy guests. Would stay there again, possibly during the week when it will be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 'Staycation'!”
Reviews.Author: indianatraveller
Reviews.Content: My family and I were not able to travel long distance over the 4th of July holiday, so we opted for a "Staycation" at a local hotel. The Biltmore was offering a nice package, the "All-Inclusive" that offered an upgraded room with 2 Queen beds plus Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner vouchers, PLUS the resort fee they typically charge. For $259- includes taxes, we had a fantastic room in the Ocatilla building (including the Executive Lounge) and our meals 'almost' entirely paid for. The Ocatilla building is an upgraded 'hotel within a hotel' building. The building has alot of historic pictures of famous vistors, is very quiet and our room was VERY comfortable. The Ocatilla also has an executive lounge on the 1st floor that had tea/lemonade provided all day; a continental breakfast that included fresh fruit,juices, coffee, granola and muffins. (Full breakfast is available in one of the restaurants). In the evening, the lounge provided a variety of small plates, chicken quesidilla, cheese/crackers, veggies and dip, sodas, and wine. Ocatilla also has it's own pool as well. For dinner our first night, our all inclusive voucher completely covered our meal at Frank & Albert's and my husband had a HUGE prime rib, broccoli and a baked potato; I had a chicken/goat cheese flatbread- included mandarin oranges and was very yummy; and our daughter had the kids "burger sliders" with a salad and fries and a scoop of ice cream for dessert. We also each had 1 glass of wine; again, was completely covered by our all inclusive voucher. We then visited the huge "Paradise Pool" to watch the movie of the night, "The Incredibles". All the kids were in the pool on floats; this is a free event and was quite fun! For breakfast, we ate at Frank & Albert's again. My husband and I ordered custom omelette's and our daughter had the kids waffle. Our voucher completely covered breakfast, including tip. Lunch, we were just $11 short on the voucher; my husband had the Fish Tacos (which he said was "the best fish tacos he's had in his life"; I had a cobb salad and our daughter ordered the slider again; we both also had wine for lunch. Note on the Paradise Pool; there is a fantastic "water slide" for the kids, but it is only open from 11a to 5p this time of year; so we had to work around our swim time since our daughter REALLY wanted to spend time on the slide. Towels were plentiful and there were chairs available in the shady areas (it was 117 this weekend!) The pool had cabanas available for rent that appeared to have bathrooms, enclosed cool areas and misters avaialble; but we did not check on pricing. There were quite a few activities happening; including a kids club (my daughter didn't want to visit this time); cooking demonstrations, wine tastings, etc., so seemed a very busy place with plenty to do if you want. Also, take a moment to go to the 2nd floor of the main building. There are many little 'living rooms' around to visit and listen to the amazing piano player in the lounge downstairs. The Frank Lloyd Wright details are amazing- especially if you appreciate architecture. Wonderful history here. Lastly, my husband enjoys golf, and played the Adobe Course for just $27! (Resident rate and a special for the 4th of July). Free high speed is part of the 'resort' fee. Valet parking (with in/out priviledges) was $27 per day. You can also self park for free; but in the hot arizona sun, we appreciated someone else going and getting the car. All in all, fantastic service, fantastic room and we had a GREAT time!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place to stay this summer!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry_T_2011
Reviews.Content: The service was OVER THE TOP! The staff made our anniversary celebration perfect!! The room was luxurious! We stayed in the Ocotillo area with a room overlooking the pool. The all-inclusive plan included meals, so we celebrated our anniversary dinner at Frank & Albert's. It was fabulous! David was our server and was very friendly. We ordered lunch poolside at the Cabana, and once again, the food was fabulous! The Ocotillo accomodations allowed us to enter the lounge any time of the day for refreshments, a great getaway in the middle of the day (or night!). We will DEFINITELY come back, and we will DEFINITELY spread the word!!! It was a memorable celebration! THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, Accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: taves7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore in the Valley Terrace (or whatever) building. I enjoyed my stay here. The grounds and main building are beautiful and the pools are nice and well-kept. The main pool area has a bar and waitresses. I did notice that toward the end of the day towels would not be cleaned up and new guests arriving to the pool would have difficulties getting a fresh towel. I was at the Biltmore for a conference and the conference areas were more than adequate. The food was good and the waiters were very polite and attentive. I also managed to take a walking tour of the grounds led by Travis and it was an amazing tour! I would stay here again for leisure if I could provided there was no big conference scheduled. My conference took over the hotel. Regular guests were probably overwhelmed. One last thing--I went to the cafe and gift shop often to buy breakfast/drinks. OVERPRICED. $3.50 for an 8 oz. water is not a good deal. And $5 for a croissant is highway robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Love this historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruffwriter
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel -- the architecture is fabulous and grounds are beautiful. Love the bar areas and the food is very good in the restaurant. The staff is very friendly and does a great job. My only complaint is no in-room coffee. That would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Serenity!!”
Reviews.Author: akaminski45
Reviews.Content: We went to celebrate my birthday and this hotel is where I fell in love with my "now husband"!! The grounds are beautiful. The accomodations are lovely as well. Make sure you book a room with a view of the mountains! The staff is friendly and knowledgable of local activites and restuarants. When visiting Arizona the Biltmore is a must!!

Reviews.Title: “A specatacular treat for the jaded business traveler”
Reviews.Author: SixthSister
Reviews.Content: My travels take me to cities all over the US and I'm usually booked into chains ranging from Sleep Inn to Marriott and Hilton. So a conference at the Biltmore was a true treat for me. From surprisingly excellent service - I was able to check in to my room at 8:30am! - to the serene environment both indoors and out, this was the most peaceful, relaxed business stay I've ever had. Every staff member I met in passing made eye contact and greeted me. Food choices throughout the resort were delicious. Reclining under the awnings and people-watching was fabulous. Rooms were decorated with real wood furnishings and live plants. My windows opened and overlooked one of eight pool areas. I didn't see a motor vehicle on the grounds during my entire stay. The architecture and history were intriguing. Conference catering and special events was outstanding. I can't say enough good things about this establishment and their well-trained staff who obviously enjoy their jobs. Normally when I'm away on business I long to be home, but this time I wished my visit was longer (2 days wasn't enough) and I hope to return one day when I can truly enjoy all the splendid Arizona Biltmore has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: christianne60
Reviews.Content: Very dated, dirty carpet and drapes. Unfriendly staff. It must have been a beautiful hotel at one time. It is run down and extremely dated. I'm shocked that they can't even touch up the paint or replace the carpet. Don't waste your money staying here. We arrived at 10 PM with 2 starving children and were told the restaurant just closed and there is nothing we can feed you? I was told there is no free breakfast for Hilton Gold members because this is a resort not a Homewood Suites. Not a classy place, like I expected the Waldorf Astoria to be.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, but Better for On Property Events/Meetings”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: As loyal HHonors member, I was excited to stay at the Arizona Biltmore given its prominence as a hotel in the Waldorf Astoria Collection. I had not stayed at the hotel prior, and was unsure of what to expect of the resort, particularly considering that I was not attending any events at the hotel (I was simply using the resort as a business hotel). The major take away for me is that the property is beautiful, but unless I was coming back for an event on property, I likely would not go back because as a resort it isn't really designed for a typical business traveler (e.g., a lot of walking to get to your car, parking is far away, resort fee). If I was traveling for pleasure, I would check to see if there were any large meetings and avoid those dates to ensure a calm, quiet stay. The hotel is lovely and particularly beautiful at night. The lobby is lit up well, and can be a very comfortable work/social area. Valet parking is easiest, but at about $27/night I chose to self-park. There are limited spaces in front down a long row that I managed to use for a few days, but otherwise I had to park in a garage which is a good 10-minute walk from the entrance. The property has several restaurants and bars, and in the middle of the resort there is a decent amount of outdoor space that offers seating with fire pits for a relaxing evening. There is a coffee shop/Starbucks on property which was nice when needing something quick in the morning, but like everything else on the property the prices were on the high side -- I think my coffee and bagel was $10. I found the service overall to be about average. I didn't find that anybody was going out of their way to provide a memorable experience. When I checked-in I was not recognized as a Gold member nor were any benefits offered (I had to ask). After asking, as a Gold member I received a room upgrade (to the Terrace area) and 2 alcoholic drinks in the bar (up to $14 each). I also was given 2 free waters from the mini-bar. The room was very large and comfortable, but very traditional. I think the room could benefit from a facelift, bringing a few more modern elements to the room. Nonetheless it was quiet and I slept very well on the typical Hilton bed. It had a nice patio, a huge bathroom with separate make-up area, shower, and large closet. There were multiple pools and whirlpools on property.

Reviews.Title: “Great AZ classic, friendly staff, pretty setting”
Reviews.Author: CEO_AZ
Reviews.Content: 1 night staycation. We are Hilton Honors members and were upgraded to a Catalina Suite Villa. The decor in the room was very dated (80's?) but the room was large and the location wonderful. We were able to step right out to our patio onto the Catalina pool. It was very classic looking and much more quite than the main pool. A wonderful place to spend the afternoon relaxing. We enjoyed massages in the Spa and also went out for a nice dinner in one of the many Biltmore area restaurants. We loved walking around the beautiful grounds of the Biltmore. In every corner there is something interesting! Lush landscaping, beautiful flowers, tons of small quite areas with fountains. We have stayed at several 4 & 5 star resorts in the valley but this one had more character than any others. The staff were all so friendly, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “historical hotel with beautiful gardens”
Reviews.Author: Cath050
Reviews.Content: wonderful place to relax, have stayed there several time, in cottages, or simple room by main pool. got this time a huge appartment with a terrace looking onto the golf course, amazing ! the hotel is like a village, you can walk around so many places and gardens !

Reviews.Title: “What a cool place-I'll go back”
Reviews.Author: Garyedwbrown
Reviews.Content: I was here for five nights attending a class and an annual trade association meeting. This resort is first class and has a lot of interesting history. I really enjoyed everything about my stay and have no trouble recommending this resort highly.

Reviews.Title: “A truly exquisite architectural design, absolutely stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Chaswb
Reviews.Content: An almost regal setting, truly a desert beauty. Shuttle service is also excellent to shopping destinations. Fun putting green holes and clubs provided. Food (restaurant) and beverage service excellent. Very comfortable environment. Stunning architecture.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: LiJo4145
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member and have been for several years. We travel to Phoenix four to five times a year. Last week, my husband and I spent 5 days at the Arizona Biltmore, and we had an absolutely 5 star experience. We were pleased that we had upgraded to the Ocatilla building because we were continuously impressed with the friendliness and efficiency of the staff. The staff in the executive lounge was extremely helpful, personable, and cheerful. This is the best executive lounge that we’ve ever encountered in a Hilton property anywhere in the USA or Europe. The breakfast foods as well as the evening hor d’oeurves, wine and desserts were outstanding. The grounds were well maintained and offered a peaceful setting where we could sit, read, and relax at various times of the day. The Frank Lloyd Wright influence is apparent throughout the property. The history tour of the property, given by Laura, offered many interesting stories about the Biltmore and its clients over the last 80+ years, and this provided us with a greater understanding and appreciation for the hotel. We enjoyed several of the pools, especially the Catalina Pool, and the fitness center while we were there. Dinner at the Wright Restaurant was unforgettable. The food was delicious and the wine was exquisite. We ate at one of the poolside cafes on two occasions, and both times the food and drink and service were very good. Service everywhere on the property was superb. We were pleased with both the car service and the car rental service that the hotel offered. This is a first-class hotel with first-class employees that offers a first-class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way, we hope to return yearly”
Reviews.Author: tamca
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on a Frank Lloyd Wright Pilgrimage years ago. He isn't the "official" architect, but his influence is apparent (he was "consulting" arch). We vowed to come stay here. I brought my husband here for his birthday and it was perfect, he had come here as a child for Christmas and never forgot it. I can see why. The architecture is magnificent as was the service. Okay, they upgraded us to a Villa, I think partially because we were celebrating a birthday, which took everything over the top. The grounds are top notch and pleasant to walk around. The food at the restaurants was incredible. I could hang in the main building all day, it really is magnificent (I'd better come up with another adjective). Go upstairs and check out the Biltmore History room and just marvel at all the nooks and places to sit and enjoy another vantage point. This resort does take you to another time and place - you definitely get out of the main stream and settle into another world, which makes it a great vacation spot. We got a great deal - search the web site for specials and packages, it is well worth it. We had 3 meals thrown into our rate, and since the resort was the destination we took advantage of it, which made this wildly affordable. Here is what we liked: The Spa area was fantastic: a full gym and locker room facilities for every guest which include steam, sauna, whirlpool, outdoor quiet jacuzzi, classes and tennis courts. I had a message and it was lovely. Our package included 30% off spa treatments, which was a good incentive. All the restaurants had very good food. Frank and Albert's, might have been our favorite. Lots of organic, fresh tasting food at very reasonable prices. Indoor and outdoor seating. We also ate at Wright's which was gorgeous and also very good. We thought the prices were not bad for the quality of the food and the ambiance. It was my husband's birthday so we splurged (our deal included $100 toward dinner and that paid for most of it, like I said, it was an unbelievable package). They even gave us a free souffle for dessert! The Villa was unbelievable, 1200 sf, 2 patios. We had reserved a premier king room with a balcony and view. I won't be able to afford a villa on my own ($1200/night) but it was so nice of them to upgrade us without us even asking. Shows the care of the staff in general. We just seemed to get stuff without asking, like they wanted us to have the best stay ever. There is a fantastic main pool with a FLW inspired slide. There are also other pools on the property. You have croquet and a large lawn chess set. There is lots of patio seating around the resort, a nice bar, a casual cafe, a pool bar and cafe. It is just a great place to sit and unwind. We wished we could have stayed another day. There also have plays and concerts. We had just missed Randy Newman and the night we were there they had productions of both Midsummer's Night Dream (outside) and The Importance of Being Ernest (inside). There was s'mores making for kids on Friday night and lots of activities to keep you happy, if that is your thing. We got the deal we did because their slow time is end of May through the summer when Phoenix gets hot. It was going up to 100 degrees when we were there, but it wasn't unpleasant and with the beautiful rooms to hang in, the pool to cool down in, and all this resort has to offer as far as service and design - it is all good. Phoenix was never on my radar (I don't like the desert heat), but we vowed to come back more often. It is our new getaway destination (we live in L.A. and it is only a 6 hour drive).

Reviews.Title: “Check conference schedule carefully before going”
Reviews.Author: SoCal17
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Biltmore for the Memorial Day weekend. We were very surprised that what seemed to be about half of the guests were there attending a conference for recovering drug addicts. Not exactly the crowd we anticipated at a four star hotel and, at the risk of being a snob, most of them clearly did not belong there in terms of behavior and basic manners. We were informed by a staff member that at other times of the year it is worse (such as a huge tattoo convention in August called Hell City). Why a four star hotel would want to scare off its regular customers in return for some convention business is something I don't understand. I didn't see any pictures on the Biltmore web site of the guests covered in tattoos, smoking, and swearing. Some parts of the hotel are well maintained (lobby) but others have been pretty neglected (including pool areas). There used to be a smore roast for the kids which everyone seemed to love but the hotel now only provides marshmallows. Seems like a prety cheap way to save a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: quicktraveler91
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds and restaurant were very good and in great condition. The stay included the Ocatilla building.
