This building location is a problem since there is not an easy way to get to it from any automobile location. It is also hard to find from the signage on site. It offers an area for a continental breakfast, snacks, beer and wine with afternoon hors d'oeuvres and some dessert at 8 to 9. The quality of this is not the greatest and it may not be worth the value unless you partake on the beer/wine. The only major issue is the lack of maid service on a reasonable basis. Turn down was ignored, next day room make up not happened, even after calling it in. This is not a tolerable situation for a hotel that is supposed to be an elite facility. The restaurant is very good and may make up for this issue, maybe. There are better resorts out there- especially the Royal Palms, which is exceptionable for the same fees.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: cvcalcouple
Reviews.Content: One of the best places we have ever stayed. We are Hilton honors club members but not high up. Upon check in we were told we were upgraded to the Ocatilla wing. Concierge rooms. Excellent. Concierge service was wonderful. All staff at resort were wonderful. One of us played golf and the other used the spa. Great experiences for both. We paid full price for the room (no internet rates or anything) but it was worth it! Th e room was great and the staff members at all levels were wonderful. We got lost on the way from the parking garage and an off duty staff member called us a cart to take us to our room. That was above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Frank&Albert's Restaurant/Lounge/Bar at the AZ Biltmore Resort - PHX”
Reviews.Author: MeinPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Celebrating a birthday and enjoying Happy Hour: We 7 girls have never seen anything like this royal treatment we got here!!! And believe me, we know a lot about HH in PHX. Sharon (our waitress and "entertainment advisor") was just fabulous, we would have liked her as our guest. She was fast, knowledgeable and still lots of fun...and with all the important connections to the staff for their special contribution & congratulations to our birthday girl. Not even to mention the extraordinary setting at the Biltmore! All appetizers came in good portions so we all could try them, (calamari !!, goat cheese), the sampler plates were an eye candy and a delicious treat. And then came dessert: All of it! The smores-plater, warm cookies and all kind's of icecream - we were in heaven! And the bill was almost unbelievably low...as I said: Happy Hour! We'll make that a "Birthday Tradition" from now on until we all turn 100!! ..and that can take a while. If you want to relax here or celebrate a special occasion: It doesn't get any better then this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience- will come back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: cupcakesonfire
Reviews.Content: I traveled recently with my family (consisting of a 11 year old and 8 year old) to Phoenix. When we got to the hotel, the staff was friendly and polite. The manager actually upgraded our room to a room near the pool (a huge plus). Our room was clean, and you could see the water slide out the window. We spent most of our time at the pool. However, when we wanted to see the Grand Canyon and other attratctions, the concierge actuall helped us accomodate, and gave us many suggestions. For food, there was a poolside restaurant, a regular cafe, a grill, and a fancier place. We loved the poolside restaurant, since it was right near our room. Also, there was an outside mall right next to the property, which gave us somewhere to go if we wanted to. All in all, we loved the Arizona Biltmore and will come back whenever we go to Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Wrights for Brunch”
Reviews.Author: PHXeater
Reviews.Content: I am a Phoenix resident who recently went to Wrights at the Biltmore for sunday brunch. I was expecting very high quality and good food, but frankly, I was blown away. The buffet items were good - some very tasty, some pretty meh, the kinds of standard brunch buffet things you would expect. But the hot food that you get (which then comes with the buffet) was excellent. I had the prawns, my wife had the banana french toast, and I kept saying "wow!" about the prawn dish. Smoky, with curry, very flavorful and really great. And the french toast was very tasty, too. it wasn't cheap, but quality brunch never is, is it? But the food, the food was what brought me here to comment, because it really was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good for conventions, not great for anything else”
Reviews.Author: pcinbk
Reviews.Content: With a great history, good location, and excellent reputation, I had expected much more from the hotel. The rooms were just alright, as was the food. The biggest problem, though, is the presence of conventions and large groups: the hotel becomes completely inhospitable to anyone else and truthfully should not be available for booking in such instances. After this particular convention left, service, common spaces and the general atmosphere improved markedly. I would not again take the risk that my stay would be disrupted by a large group, which I understand is quite common at the hotel (then again, with the convention business having crashed in Phoenix perhaps it is not so much of a risk.)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby & grounds - rooms need work!”
Reviews.Author: teelerfan
Reviews.Content: Day two of a four day stay. Staff is friendly and responsive, hotel grounds and common areas are lovely. Dining is good but if you want a quick breakfast, "The Cafe" menu is limited, mostly carbs in the form of pastries. The lunch options looked more promising. The room is definately in need of a face lift. We have broken tile and peeling ceiling paint in an awarkdly designed bathroom. While the hotel room isn't dirty, it isn't sparkling clean. I think this is due to how old the furnishings seem. All in all, it is a fine place to stay but has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Frank Lloyd Wright on steroids”
Reviews.Author: JoanE_chinook
Reviews.Content: This is an absolute MUST for anyone who admires the architecture of Frank Lloyd Wright. Although we learned there is some dispute as to who actually did the final design for the hotel and the many out buildings on the property, the architecture, lighting, furniture, landscape design are all clearly heavily influenced by Wright. We spent 3 days on the property leaving only to take a tour of Taliesin West (Wright's home and current architectural school less than 20 miles away) and we were constantly discovering new wonderful aspects of the hotel. In addition to the main building, there are 8 pools (have to go back to swim in the rest of them!) 2 full service restaurants (don't miss the lobster bisque and souffle) and a cafe, an enormous spa, tennis courts, I could go on. Tours of the hotel are offered 3 times a week - don't miss if you can work it in to your schedule. The grounds are so extensive that despite the fact we were there on a very busy, booked weekend, it was easy to wander the grounds without seeing another person. Both restaurants were excellent, bartenders imaginative - it was the perfect, pampered weekend. I went with a girlfriend I needed to catch up with and we had a blast, but I'm planning to go back with my husband as this is also a very romantic getaway. Not inexpensive - but I'm guessing it's possible to find good deals with a bit of planning.

Reviews.Title: “About as good as it gets!!!”
Reviews.Author: NorrisDN
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned travelor, I always enjoy the opportunity to stay at a 5 star resort type propertly. The Arizona Biltmore certainly lives up to this reputation. I found the accomodations, service, and amenities to be all top notch. In fact it is one of the all around best properties I have ever stayed at. Just about the only negative I can think of is that the pool chairs by the main pool get saved (with towels) early in the morning sometimes, so sometimes you may have to find your way to one of the other 8 pools on the property. In addition to the great service, accomodations, and the breathtaking property itself, it boasts some of the best food in all of Phoenix. To sum it all up I would say that this resort is "About as Good as it Gets!!"

Reviews.Title: “Great Site for Our Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Megan14L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I held our wedding at the Arizona Biltmore on April 2nd, 2011. The catering staff was amazing, and everything was provided to us to our satisfaction. We stayed in one of the villas for our wedding night and the room was absolutely amazing. They had chilled champagne and chocolates waiting for us when we arrived, and the whirlpool tub was absolutely what we needed after a very long day. We ordered room service in the morning and it was excellent. Great hotel, beautiful property, and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a drink at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: jerrysmithson
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month I attended a large business luncheon event at the Arizona Biltmore. As it turned out there were also 3 other huge luncheon events at the Arizona Biltmore on that day. Needless to say, the traffic and the parking was a bit challenging so when our event ended I decided to take my partner for a glass of wine on the terrace and wait out the exiting crowds. We proceeded to the terrace, took a couple of very comfortable chairs and, while admiring the garden and fountain views, waited for our server. None came. After a bit I got up and went back into the hotel in search of a server. I found a young lady and asked if she could help me get a couple of drinks on the terrace. She informed me that the bar was closed so perhaps I could collect my partner and go to another "open" bar somewhere else in the hotel's interior. I was dismayed. The day was glorious and the very comfortable outdoor seating and views on the terrace are an imeasurably more "luxurious" experience than sitting in a dark interior bar. Bummer, I thought.... Another server happened to overhear us and turned to me and asked me what I wished. I responded "two glasses of wine on the terrace". To this he responded, "I can make that happen!" "Really?", I asked. "Absolutely," he said and told me he would meet me and my partner back at the terrace. No sooner than I had taken my seat than he arrived and, after some dialogue and recommendations regarding the merits of various posssible wine selections, he took our order and disappeared back into the hotel. Soon we were sipping our wine and it was then that I noticed his name badge. "Kevin," I asked, "what is that pin you're wearing?" Well, it turned out to be an "Emplyee of the Month" award. I asked Kevin if he could comment on its interesting design and he said it symbolizes the 16 Biltmore values -- which include his favorite value: Empowerment. "This," he said, "means I can take any action which I believe will enhance a guest's visit and I do not have to go through 5 layers of supervision do that. So, I can walk a few steps to bring you your drinks on the terrace". Well, I was most impressed. Kevin could see that this customer could either acquiesce to the suggestion from the first server (and probably neither have nor remember an Arizona Biltmore "experience") or be granted my wish to enjoy with my partner a glass of wine on the terrace and celebrate the outdoor garden views on a beautiful Spring day. God bless Kevin (Doyle) and the Arizona Biltmore values! Kevin turned a potentially unhappy experience into a beautiful memory...

Reviews.Title: “It's not any just another place...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The charm and architecture aside from it's location are only made better by the staff. This review goes out proudly to Christian, from in room dining that saw to my morning coffee promptly arriving at 5:30 am every morning. His courteous evening greeting assuring me of prompt service should not be overlooked or taken for granted. Thank you to you and your staff!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel that needs some work”
Reviews.Author: 3DTurkey
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. There are some things that are really good and some things that are really bad. Good: The grounds are beautiful and kept up wonderfully. Just walking around the hotel you felt like you were escaping to a tropical garden. It was really amazing. The staff was always very friendly and helpful and we always felt welcome. This hotel has a lot of history and there are photos all over the walls of days gone by and famous people who have visited over the years. It was fun to check it out. The pools are great and the waterslide was a blast (even for adults). Bad: Our room was very small and in disrepair. I've posted photos so you can decide for yourself. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the furniture was beat up, there was mold all over the shower. In addition, the door that separated our room from our neighbors had a one inch gap underneath so you could hear just about everything in their room and I'm sure the same went for our neighbors. In other words, no privacy. Our room was right next to the main courtyard so lot's of traffic and noise at all hours. You were charged to self park your car which seemed a bit petty. Also, the service at the pool was very slow. We'd often order a drink and wait 15-20 minutes for it to arrive. They are either very short staffed or poorly managed in this department. When you are paying this kind of money for a room and for drinks this type of service is unacceptable. And finally, I left my phone in my golf cart after a round of golf at the Biltmore and when I went back to find my phone the indifference of the staff was insulting. I'm still perplexed at their response and lack of assistance. It was strange and extremely irritating. Overall, I'm glad we went to experience this little piece of history but I would not return. I would probably recommend visiting this place for a night just to check it out but beware of all the pitfalls and don't expect too much from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible property”
Reviews.Author: Queeniefromthezoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days for a conference with my husband. Wow!! Very nice resort. Has different room options, great dining on the property but close to other great restaurants and shopping. Conference facilities were top notch too. Staff is knowledgeable and friendly. A must stay destination.

Reviews.Title: “The Arizona Biltmore is the best resort in the world!”
Reviews.Author: DurbMorrison
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The Arizona Biltmore dozens of times, I always look forward to the exceptional treatment and relaxing elegance that the resort and it's staff exudes. The entire staff is more than accommodating to our needs and they make sure that our stay is luxurious in every way. I will always stay at the Arizona Biltmore when I'm in Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room; beautiful outside”
Reviews.Author: 40somethingsplus1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent two nights. I spent two days in the the conference center and he spent time enjoying the outdoor amenities. The room (a Villa) was tired and out-dated: wallpaper peeling in the bathroom. Wooden TV stand falling apart. Small standard TV, and the hardest bed I've ever slept on. The Villa we stayed in adjoined a larger villa via a suite door. I could hear the entire conversation from the adjoining room. Room Service was excellent, and the breakfast was incredibly delicious. My husband found the steam room to be one of the best. In general, the grounds were beautiful, but the room we stayed in needs some serious updating. I would not stay here again. There are better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Ocitilla at the Biltmore One of the Best Romantic Getaways”
Reviews.Author: m2maverick
Reviews.Content: Ocitillia is a wonderful experience for couples! The exclusive setting has a private fire pit, good size pool with spa - very quiet - away from the family area ( Paradise pool with small water slide) Access to the Executive Lounge comes with an Ocitilla room and includes continental breakfast, afternoon snacks, free happy hour with good selection of wine and beer, chef's appetizers and delicious evening desserts! Lounge also includes personal concierge service and small business center with access to the internet. Well worth the price of the room! Check-in was a nightmare - so be prepared if you arrive early! Nick, our concierge at the Ocitilla, was wonderful and gave us great ideas on how to spend our time! Lots of secluded areas for couples and the grounds are beautiful! Weekend evenings had roasted marshmellows over wood fire pit and afternoon tea with Kevin was the BEST!!!! We loved it! Aside from our check-in experience, we really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “lovely property, grounds are impeccably maintained, superior service”
Reviews.Author: moliveto
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back to the AZ Biltmore again and again, it's a great place to stay for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “You never have to leave the hotel for your vacation!”
Reviews.Author: klee25
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience staying here. The rooms, pools, restaurants were all A+. We loved the variety of outdoor seating/lounging, especially around the fire pits since the evenings get a little chilly. There were quite a few families there with school aged children.

Reviews.Title: “a decent hotel, but way overhyped”
Reviews.Author: Clyde_Betts
Reviews.Content: OK, so to preface this, I live in Arizona, I travel all over the globe for work and have stayed at many many hotels worldwide. The Az Biltmore just does not impress me. The Hotel itself just seems dated. and not dated in a classic kind of way. I think it just feels old. The rooms, (in which I have stayed in at least 7-10 different ones in the last three years) all seem tired and rundown. The cleaning staff does a great job with what they have but the rooms seem like they have not been renovated in ages. It is a great place for conventions though, they have a ton of great meeting space. Stacy Shapiro (one of the convention managers) is one of the best in the valley, if you have a choice ask for her, some of her colleagues do not have a clue about their job, but she is amazing. Do I recommend this hotel, well the history of it is amazing, the architecture is very cool, it just seems overpriced to me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Property With Not So Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MimiStarr
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently attended a conference at The Arizona Biltmore. The location, grounds and history associated with this hotel was lovely and interesting. The photos displayed throughout, the historical tour provided (you have to sign up for this) and the literature to read are steeped in the elegant history of this hotel. We enjoyed the grandeur of the grounds, pools, shops and restaurants. The service was good, but not great, as one might expect from a hotel of this caliber. There certainly was effort, however, this hotel greatly needs the expertise of someone like Steven Freund to overhaul the hotel's customer service and attention to detail. Steven was the former Manager of Reynold's Plantation/Ritz Carlton in Georgia and brought it to a 5 star rating worldwide. Every area could use his touch! Most surprising to us was our room. We were placed in the original part of the hotel in a room that was comparable to a Holiday Inn. Very disappointing. We will likely visit Phoenix again, but will likely return to the Royal Palms where the entire experience is generally top notch. Be aware of the surprise additional charges to your bill reflected below in "tips". We had, unfortunately, already left a daily tip for the maid and paid the valet and bellman, only to find these additional charges had been added to our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great beautiful property and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sedona2003
Reviews.Content: I recently took a position and relocated to Miami Beach. I had to come back and oversee the move to Florida. After the movers packed and moved our stuff we needed a place to stay for 2 Days before we left for Florida. I have always wanted to stay at the Biltmore and this was the perfect time. The grounds were very beautiful and everywhere I went I felt like people knew me and I seemed like I was home. The service was second to none and the room was great. When I come back I would defiantly stay again at the Arizona Biltmore. I had 2 small puppies and they had treats in the room upon arrival. The food in all the restaurants was spot on and great. We sat by the fire pits at night and had a great time. Great hotel and kudos to the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to find its identity”
Reviews.Author: travel JR
Reviews.Content: We have visited here before and are seeing the transformation of this old time classic into a somewhat more contemporary hotel, but seems to be still struggling with going from a playground of the wealthy ("every American Prez and royalty has stayed here.") to a conference center. Overall the staff was young & very friendly, the restaurant is greatly improved (Frank & Alberts is #1 on Tripadvisor). Beware of taxes & fees...about $90.00 per day on a $385 room)...including resort fee, parking fee for self-parking a long distance from rooms, a daily housekeeping...enough already...as bad as airlines.) Also, roo, has free wired Internet, but wireless only in main building.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: SonjaWitt
Reviews.Content: Very elegant but not stuffy. Historic Hotel. Beautiful grounds. Wonderful staff, rooms and food. Ate at Frank & Alberts for breakfast. Delicious. Generous portions. Enjoyed massage at Spa. Wonderful facility and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Facility, Service & Food”
Reviews.Author: LeppFrog
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is an experience of extravagant living in an historical museum that is living. The structure, service, food and grounds are amazing. There is an ambiance reminiscent of days gone past with the sophistication of the present. Everyone should experience the Biltmore. Bret W. Leppo

Reviews.Title: “Good for sleeping, but not for eating”
Reviews.Author: CKMD16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Valentines weekend and the hotel and grounds were exquisite. For convenience sake, we decided to eat at Frank & Alberts for dinner one night and breakfast the next morning. Dinner choices were abysmal. They were so busy with making their menu fancy that I wasn't interested in most of what they offered. Overkill. On top of that, the service was poor. The waitstaff were nice, but poor service regardless. Service on Valentine's night was better at the Wright Room. The waiter was a bit put off when I asked to move tables because the a/c was blowing right in my face. I'd already, unhappily, sat through breakfast with a draft and knew I didn't want to do it again. We were moved us to a different table with another server. It didn't make our original waiter any too happy that he lost a customer/tip. As I went to get out of the chair, a nail was sticking out of the chair and I jabbed my leg and ran my stockings (a thing of the past, I know). The hotel manager bought us a round of drinks to compensate us, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Susana114
Reviews.Content: This property is absolutely amazing. The setting, gardens and grounds are beautiful, and the original architecture and historic touches are beyond compare. I've always loved FL Wright, and to see his designs and legacy come to life in this property is a remarkable experience. I stayed in the Ocatilla wing, with a modern, large room that repeats the Biltmore Block in the headboard and bathroom tile. I liked having a large patio door that opened to a view of the mountains. I also loved the large bath with soaking tub - it even comes with a candle and bath salts. Overall, my stay has been an enjoyable experience. The Biltmore provides great service and has maintained and modernized this lovely Arizona gem in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the Staff at the Biltmore- awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: Czaplewski
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were guests in January 2011 at the Arizona Biltmore and stayed in the Ocatilla - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay - everything was top knotch. We especially wanted to acknowledge and thank Nick Douglas, Conceirge in the Ocatilla. He went above and beyond to provide excellent service to us. He is a wonderful representative for the Biltmore's high standards and qualities. We also want to say "great job" to the others that work with Nick in the Ocatilla...They work diligently to keep things flowing there - stocked and looking perfect!...Rajith de Soyza, Kim and Scott Hutch. We had such a nice time. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant property - not so elegant rooms.”
Reviews.Author: timminn
Reviews.Content: This is a historic resort with wonderful ambiance, well-staffed with plenty of friendly people who are eager to welcome you and make your stay special. From the front desk to the bar & restaurant, cleaning & ground staff, the kind of positive attitude is projected that lets you know they take a lot of pride in serving their guests well. The property was a little too spread out to be efficient but the grounds are beautiful, interior spaces were more than adequate and the meetings, meals, receptions, etc. were very well handled by the hotel. The weak part of the experience for me was the room. Mine was rather spartan and quite dark with very inadequate lighting, even a light fixture by my bed that didn't always work. The desk and other cabinet tops have bubbling veneers that reflect the tiredness of the decor. The air handling system is noisy and woke me every night audibly clicking on and off. When the temperature dropped into the '30's outside and I arrived back at my room chilled, I couldn't get the heat in the room cranked up and had to take a hot shower instead. It may be that other parts of the property have been renovated and are in better shape. Overall, if you want a 5-Star resort experience you'll have to find it somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Every meal was exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: jse7
Reviews.Content: From the breakfast buffet to a fabulous dinner at Wright's, this hotel does it right. Consistenly. The service was as good as the food...pleasant, professional, prompt. There is no reason to leave the property to have an outstanding dinner with great wine. Wrights was spot on! We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “I will return if I ever get back to Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: sfimporter
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Arizona Biltmore while in Phoenix for a business trip. Originally planned to stay at the Arizona Grand resort, which was much more affordable, but not nearly as luxurious. The Arizona Grand would have been great for a family on a budget, but the Biltmore was perfect for adults and business. Such a large resort, such beauty all around. So many pools! I imagine when it gets really hot, those pools get packed, but since there are several of them spread out amongst the resort, I imagine there's always room at one of them. Ate and Frank & Albert's several times. Great for breakfast - not bad for dinner, but not amazing. The staff was all great. We were placed in the main building on the 4th floor above the lobby. Couldn't imagine it gets any better. See my pic for the amazing view out of our window. The room was large and spacious, although I might have preferred wireless access over the one wired port in the room. Plenty of electrical outlets. Depending on what was going on, we could actually get a wireless signal from the lobby - but it wasn't always reliable. I found the Starbucks on the premises to be a little expensive ($5 for a croissant?!) but with Hilton Silver Honors, you get a free large coffee each day of your stay. I think I could have stayed there a week, and I imagine it only gets better when the weather really heats up. Self parking was the only minor hassle. It was a bit of a ways away, but still a pleasant walk. Not much around the resort itself. A shopping mall isn't too far away, but you'd need to drive anywhere. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of holes to be filled.”
Reviews.Author: JaquesN
Reviews.Content: This historic property has an incredible setting and lovely architecture. Too bad the room I had was more tired than I was having traveled across country to attend a conference at a different hotel and was adjusting to the time change. Dark and in need of a face llift. The high light of my stay was that the staff was professional, courteous and helpful. The wait staff at the various dining venues on the property were friendly and even fun. No complaints there. BUT, although advertised as providing free Internet, be sure you have an old laptop with a port for it. I travel with a Mac Book Air. And, I didn't bring my Sprint Wireless Card. Wireless is available in the lobby which is cozy but does not have good work space. No coffee maker in the room, though I learned you can get one on request - when I was checking out - my bad for not asking sooner. As is the case with most all-in-one resort properties, everything was over-priced. I paid $10.00 for a domestic light beer in the mini-bar. A glass of house wine is $16.00. Would I go there again? Probably not on a business trip- an frankly, that's not what it's there for. It was, however, a stunning property, the grounds are lovely and they have full amenities. Compared to a few other resorts I've stayed at in the Scottsdale area, this one gets an average rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Luxury, Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DCMcG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights here at the start of our honeymoon. It was by far our best hotel of the trip, and was a wonderful way to start our vacation. When we arrived to Phoenix we rented a car and drove from the airport. The hotel is easy to find, and parking is abundant. We did get lost after we checked in because the front desk agent told us to park in a garage that was closer to our room, but something must have gotten lost in translation of the directions because after we parked we walked all the way back across the resort to find our room. We moved our car and the rest of the stay we parked right outside of our room! The first room we were given was under maintenance. After a long flight, and the aforementioned trek across the resort carrying all our luggage we were disappointed to be given a room that was out of service. The bathroom smelled of fumes, was being painted, and the bathroom was being caulked. We called the front desk and explained the issue. They brought a golf cart and took us to a new room, which was amazing! The room we ended up staying in was a one bedroom apartment style room with a full kitchen, living room, large bathroom with jet tub, and a porch. We loved having so much space to spread out and relax in. The place was perfect for a lounging couple! We used the main pool a few times (it was a little chilly out, so we didn't spend much time poolside), and we used the gym equipment each day. I got a massage at the spa, which was wonderful. The service at each place was top notch. The resort is conveniently located to just about anywhere you'd like to go in the Phoenix area. We spent time hiking, dining in Scottsdale, and gambling one night. It's not walkable to anything outside of the resort, but is driver friendly. I have very fond memories from our first nights as a married couple, and would definitely recommend staying at the Biltmore for a special occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Time of my LIFE!”
Reviews.Author: Love2flyual
Reviews.Content: We came to Phoenix to cheer Auburn to victory. It was so much more than that. The Biltmore has a wonderful concierge at the Ocatilla by the name of Kim Syverson. She was like a magic genie in that we let our wishes be known, and "POOF" we were on our way! She was excellent! We so enjoyed the firepits at cocktail hour and the hospitality. Anything we needed, Kim directed us..."Kim, we need directions"...."Kim, what would be a fun place to have a drink and a bite before the Suns game"...."Kim, do you have a spa menu? Dinner reservations/suggestions? Where do we rent a car? How about tee time"....she was EXCEPTIONAL! We loved Dave at the restaurant as well as others who said they liked the Auburn people because they were polite and fun and they liked to hear our Southern accents. The spa was to die for! Lana spoiled me rotten with a stone massage hydrating pedicure. It was the most relaxing treat ever! I would highly recommend this establishment!

Reviews.Title: “So much more than just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventurers02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore for 10 days between Christmas and New Years into January. We have 2 boys aged 8 and 12. I had always heard about the Biltmore from work associates and clients but you have to stay there to experience why people like it. It goes without saying that the grounds, pools and buildings are beautiful. The main hotel has an elegance which most hotels simply do not have these days. It was the social aspect of the hotel which we enjoyed. People inlcuding the staff are very friendly. Having a drink in the lobby bar is something you need to experience for yourself. Everyone chats like they are old friends and you meet lots of guests. We stayed in a building beside the Octilla which was very nice. On the second part of our stay (we went to Sedona for 2 days) the hotel was full so we were given a room on the far east side of the grounds, opposite the main interior courtyard. Not as good, this building needs some cosmetic maintenace. I have to say the second room was much larger and nicer, however the common area (lobby) was not as nice and also not as convenient to the common areas. The kids loved the pool, pool slide, smores by the fire, chess and golf. The concierge arranged tickets to hockey games, Fiesta Bowl, Dude Ranch, restaurants and anything else we needed, they were great. For the days we did not have a rental car we used the hotel car service which I would highly recommend. Very professional and it's like having your own private limousine. It was one of our best family vacations and I would recommend the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Convention hotel with good quality and high prices”
Reviews.Author: UTAustin
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is a nice convention type hotel with a few stand-out amenities and some drawbacks as well. The room I stayed in was in the Ocatilla. This basically was a new building where you were charged an extra hundred bucks for a bit more space, a bit nicer bathroom, and free cokes and snacks in a club area. Whether that's worth the expense is up for debate. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. There was a decent work area and a view of the pool. There was an attempt at an outdoor patio / seating area but the execution was weak. It was basically two patio chairs looking at a pool fence. The bathroom had a large tub and a stand alone shower. The commode was in a separate, but very small, room. I'm not sure it would be great for a person who gets claustrophobic. The towels were clean and plentiful. The hotel itself had decent service. The valets were effective though didn't seem terribly efficient. The front desk staff was friendly but the place still had the feel of a convention center hotel. The gym area was nice and had lots of equipment. However, it closed early. Around 9 or 10. It's amazing how a Hilton Garden Inn can have a 24 hour workout space but a Hilton Waldorf Astoria Collection hotel has to boot you off the treadmill before the 10 o'clock news comes on. The spa was adequate but nothing to write home about. There were lots of parts that sorely needed maintenance. If you have a convention here, it's a great place to stay. If you like Frank Lloyd Wright influenced architecture (he wasn't the primary architect) it's also a nice place to be. However, I'm not sure this is a must-see.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but ruined it upon checkout...”
Reviews.Author: Canehdianman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore with a large group for a wedding. The hotel is gorgeous, the amenities are fantastic and the staff were friendly. Our room had a gorgeous wrap-around balcony that overlooked a fantastic garden. You could pick lemons from it! The wedding was amazing and everyone had a blast. At the hotel, the only thing that annoyed me was not having wi-fi in all of the buildings (only the lobby as near as I could tell) Everything was quite good...until it came time to check out. We had a large group and organized a group rate. It was to be a flat rate of $169 per room, including everything. First off, I had to ask for an itemized bill to be printed so I could see how the charges. They had charged us a $25 resort fee, $12 parking fee, $12 porter fee and a $3 housekeeping gratuity (How is a mandatory charge a gratuity?) each day. In spite of the fact that our account had a note saying it was supposed to be an all-inclusive price of $169 AND the fact that we didn't have a car AND the fact that we didn't use any porters, it was a fight to get the clerk to remove the extra fees. She said "this is the agreement that the bride and groom signed with the hotel, so you have to pay it". Maybe I'm a cheap jerk, but I'm not paying for services I didn't use. In the end, she relented and took the charge down to the proper amount. However, it soured me on an otherwise fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “You need to experience the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: WayneSouthDakota
Reviews.Content: I had desired to stay at the Biltmore for quite some time. My wife and I took a few days off from winter and stayed at the Biltmore. It is just like I had imagined it would be. I felt like I have turned back the clock to the 1950's, and it was wonderful. Quiet, sirene, slow-paced, just a great place to unwind and escape the real world. My wife's only comment was, "How did you know this place existed?" A great place to find yourself, to reacquaint yourself with a spouse, and in our case a great way to face the bittr cold Northern winters.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and ambience”
Reviews.Author: NinaK10025
Reviews.Content: We went for a three-day weekend including New Year's Eve. First, this hotel is justly famous for its beautiful design. We stayed in the Ocatilla wing. The Ocatilla rooms were beautifully renovated and spacious. The service in the Ocatilla executive lounge was outstanding, and they offered a terrific selection for breakfast and evening snacks every day. We especially enjoyed a cooking class offered by the hotel chefs. The food in the restaurants is also excellent. Really nice gym, salon, spa and pools.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: rosaritaknows
Reviews.Content: On 12/31/2010, we had a room at the Arizona Biltmore, when we arrived the room was extremely cold, after trying at least four times to fix the problem, the hotel upgraded us to a villa! This is how you tread guests, what a great experience! THANK YOU AZ BILTMORE

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience..Hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: atltravelergw
Reviews.Content: We were escaping the torrential rains in Southern California and drove to Phoenix as a last minute option. We booked two adjoining rooms for our family of four and couldn't have been happier with the entire experience. The rooms were spacious, beds and pillows extremely comfortable, grounds spectacular and service in every department was top notch. The historic tour of the hotel is well worth it (and no charge). The fitness center and pools were great, dining at Frank and Alberts was convenient and tasty, and the staff was helpful in every way. The hotel offers shuttle service to the nearby mall, where we did holiday shopping and had a nice lunch. We took a trip to Scottdale to see the Frank Lloyd Wright home/museum and that was well worth it too. I would love to return for a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Brett21
Reviews.Content: You will find an attentive and friendly hotel employee in every area of this hotel. Pablo at the pool, Nicholas waitering at Frank and Alberts, Micah at the front desk, Kim in the Ocitilla Executive Suite and Sylvester in the Men's Spa Locker Room. I love it here and my kids love it even more. The pool and waterfall is their favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort too bad the staff isn't so great”
Reviews.Author: karen4352
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip 3 days after our wedding so I started our honeymoon here. We stayed in a Villa which was great. The room was HUGE. The resort is beautiful but the staff isn't. We ate dinner at the restaurant twice and the food wasn't good either time. The wait staff was not attentive. We would have to waive them down to get water or drink refills. I spend the days at the pool and the staff there is just as bad. The hotel concierge was the worst. I asked for them to arrange for a taxi to bring us to the airport the following day and he said he would see what he could do. The next morning come to find out they never called for a cab but wanted us to use their private car service.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to get disconnected and relax, this is the place.”
Reviews.Author: UKWildcat22
Reviews.Content: My wife, her sister and her husband went to the Biltmore. The objective was to disconnect. It was fabulous. The property is laden with history and nostalgia. The service is incredible, the rooms were great and the restaurants were second to none. There is a fabulous spa the girls frequented. The workout facility was great. There are two quality golf courses. My brother in law is a runner. He said the running trail was awesome. There are 8 swimming pools, all with character. At night we sat around one of the many fire pits after dinner and enjoyed an evening cocktail. This property has moved up toward the top of the resorts I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful property full of history, class and excellence.”
Reviews.Author: Cielaklvr
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful, relaxing weekend at the Arizona Biltmore. We booked several months in advance and were able to take advantage of an excellent promo that offered the room with breakfast, lunch and dinner and also offered a 30% discount on spa services. It was so nice to relax and not have to worry about leaving the property. We unwound with a couple of massages at the spa and spent our time enjoying the beautiful grounds and soaking in the sun by one of the gorgeous pools. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly check in agent who upgraded our room and explained the meal package to us. Our room was very large with French doors that led out to our private patio. The bathroom was big with a double vanity, tub w/ shower and separate toilette area. The room was very clean and the housekeeping staff was friendly. We ate breakfast, lunch and dinner at Frank & Albert's restaurant. They have a nice selection of menu items with something to satisfy all appetites and the staff was excellent on each visit. One night we had dinner at Wrights restaurant. WOW! Our meal was fantastic and our server was so friendly, professional and knowledgeable. We really enjoyed that meal. Since it's December, the entire property is decorated for the holidays and it's just beautiful. We enjoyed sitting in the lobby bar in the evening, listening to the entertainment and enjoying all the Christmas lights and decorations. On Sunday morning we walked to the Cafe and had Starbucks coffee with muffins, juice and fruit bowls. It was all included with our meal package. What a deal! We had a great time and everyone at the Biltmore was professional, friendly and accommodating. We look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recomend”
Reviews.Author: TuesdayTraveler
Reviews.Content: Although the place is interesting and the room is large, the security of the place is suspect. Items from my room came up missing and the hotel refuses to take an liability. Their insurance agent also has failed to take any liability. II highly recommend leaving valuable things at home or in the room safe.

Reviews.Title: “my praise for regino alcon and advice for BIltmore AZ!”
Reviews.Author: hcarmich42
Reviews.Content: This is still a timeless and amazing property. You can almost still feel Jackie and JFK playing tennis, and Marilyn Monroe out by her favorite pool. If you are serious about top-notch customer service, however, just stay across the street at the Ritz. The service is very hit or miss at this hotel, which only makes me laud Regino in engineering all the more. Our door lock was defective... While I was waiting for someone from the front desk to bring new keys (which wouldn't have solved the problem), Regino saw me sitting forlornly by my door and walked 50 yards over to me to inquire if I needed anything. He didn't have to do that. It took some work, but he effiiciently and graciously fixed the problem. The lady at the coffee shop/cafe practically was growling at everyone this morning (am not a morning person either, but really??). Housekeeper too - wow on rude. I can forgive almost anyone becuase perhaps their mom is sick, dog died, etc. But it amazes me that ladies and gentlemen serving ladies and gentlemen doesn't seem to apply at this property -- except for the rare gems such as Regino (and James at the front desk). The great staff make it all worth the stay... the history and door locks are just a bonus. HC, NCSL Conference Attendee

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel and what great service”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore during the Thanksgiving Holiday. The service could not have been better from the front desk to the nice man (Regenio, I think) who came to help me fix the heater during an unexpected cold snap. I stayed in a lovely "cottage" that was quiet and had a great patio. I loved walking the beautiful grounds. Since I was in four hotels during that trip, I have a perspective on clean and cared for. The cottage was the cleanest of all the places I stayed. The bed was the best, not too soft or too hard. I do not usually use the shampoo and conditioner from a hotel, but I was intrigued by these and pleasantly surprised at how good they were; my hair needed the moisturizer after a trip up to Sedona and touring Indian sites in the wind. I did think the Hotel needed more entrance signage as it was a bit difficult to find at night. Once I drove right past it. I do like how hidden away it is, but signs on the main street or better ligts by the entrance would be good.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort. Super family destination”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are gorgeous. The architecture is simply spectacular. The rooms are well appointed in addition to being spotlessly clean. The pools are super special. This would be a great place with kids. Tons of activities and the pool area is really cool. The service is top notch. Everyone from the gardener to the waiter was friendly and helpful. No wireless internet, but they do offer wired internet and it's free (a welcome surprise in luxury hotels.) We were a couple without kids and this is a great romantic getaway as well. Our room was totally quiet despite having neighbors on both sides. (I only know they were there because I saw them. I never heard a peep, not even a shower) We ate at Frank and Albert's on the property. The ambiance was wonderful (ask for the backroom with the fireplace). The price wasn't cheap, but was definitely reasonable given the quality, ambiance and location. If you want to go out, Camelback Road is moments away and the options are endless. We were really surprised that this was both a great couples and and family destination. The combination is hard to come by, but this resort pulls it off wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: “great travel location”
Reviews.Author: tristatetraveled
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore was great, from the time we arrived to the time we left it was nothing but class. We were met at the front desk with some of the most professional clerks I've ever encountered, and they were very informative of the area. The Resort ended up sending us to an amazing steakhouse, and comped us a limo. The views are amazing and the grounds are beautiful. Price is a facor, but worth it in the long run.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: MaraleeTucson
Reviews.Content: Our visit started with Sarah Goodell helping us with check in. So helpful. We played golf and Clark Hobbs in the pro shop assisted us with our choices. Again, very helpful. We had a problem with the heating in the room and Regeno Alcan from Engineering solved our problem immediately. We will recommend the Biltmore to our friends and we will return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother unless you're rich or on expense account”
Reviews.Author: BillStickers_7
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful, historic estate. Lots of picture of presidents and whatnot who stayed there in past. Striking distance to some decent hiking trails. Big, clean, quiet well appointed rooms. Cottages don't have wireless internet, but ethernet cable long enough to work in patio area. Campus-like setting with fresh air, plants, humming birds. Cottages very quaint - nice switch of standard hotel experience. Reasonable ($25) taxi fare from air port. Polite staff at reception, concierge, bell desk and elsewhere. Cons. Isolated. Rent car to get most anywhere in town. On-site shops, cafe and bars gouge you because of hotel's isolation - $14 for socks, $16 for latte and muffin, $17 for glass of wine at bar. Much of grounds devoted to apparently unused putting greens. Difficult to attract attention of restaurant and bar room wait staff. Moldy grout (yuk!), my in cottage at least. Surprisingly noisy grounds - always a leaf blower, tree trimmer, lawn mover, power generator or some other machine making stay less than tranquil. Surrounded on two sides by beautiful mountains (especially at sunrise/sunset), but buildings by and large block view of them.

Reviews.Title: “We Keep Going Back-- It's Like Home!”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob11
Reviews.Content: We've tried at a few Hotel/Spas in the Phoenix area and always end up going back to the Biltmore. We've taken our children and gone by ourselves. It's one of those places that can make both types of travelers happy. My favorite is the spa! I had a great deep tissue massage from Robert. But I also had the most relaxing massage that I have ever had in my entire life! I got an 80 minute hot stone massage from Christina-- it was amazing. There's also a great person in the salon-- Mi Lon. I got a mani/pedi and a fantastic blow out. The hotel and spa staff are always dedicated to making your stay a great one. The rooms: We've stayed in regular rooms and the villa rooms. All of the rooms we've stayed in needed updating but I hear they're doing it in stages. I believe they have already completed one wing. We love sitting outside by one of the big fires and having a drink. The inside bar is great as well. This is such a relaxing place to stay and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Shifting Sands of Time are Not Kind”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: I earlier reviewed the Phoenix Biltmore and expressed concern about the housekeeping. Today much has changed. A recent lenghy stay for business was interrupted by endless convention types. Loud, drunk, and anything but classy. Clearly the hotel has shifted to accommodating large convention groups and lost their focus on the business or leisure traveler. Over the week there were two enormous groups there. The beautiful grounds were cluttered with tents, bands, and lots of drunken young people. At 10pm one of the nights the hotel allowed a fireworks display. Yes, 10pm on a weekday everyone is awakened by fireworks. For those of us who were working it was not a party. No apologies or excuses. Business as normal. Additionally, the hotel grounds, pools, and sidewalks were littered with spilled drinks, vomit, and cigarette butts. Not the Biltmore I knew and liked. One last comment, the early morning front desk crew has to be the rudest and most indifferent I have encountered in a long time. We would leave at about 6am and never encountered anyone at the front desk who could even grunt out a good morning. For what you pay at the Biltmore I would head to one of the local resorts. At least there you know what you are getting in to. Shame on you Phoenix Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - rooms could do with a bit more TLC”
Reviews.Author: wilko51
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Biltmore and it remains my favourite hotel in Phoenix. It was built in the thirties and has a charm lacking in so many of the resort hotels in Phoenix. That being said the rooms are starting to look a little frayed around the edges. My room was a cottage near the main lawn. It was a good size but the bathroom felt a little tatty and the shower was also a little worse for wear. Normally I would not care but the Biltmore is at the top-end of the market so everything should be spot on. The general hotel environment is lovely - especially the fire-pit area where you can chill with a nice glass of wine. The Biltmore gym has been re-kitted out since my last stay with an excellent variety of cardio kit. Overall a very pleasant stay at the Biltmore but it is just one small step away from being a truely great experience. Also played golf at the resort. Have to say that the links course is much better than the other course (cannot remember its name).

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Debra1313
Reviews.Content: My husband had to attend a conference in downtown Phoenix so I decided to go along for some relaxtion time. We did not want to stay right downtown and decided on the Biltmore, after all I was looking forward to the Spa! Starting with check in, which went fine...that was until they gave us a very small map and pointed...turn here and here...needless to say we did get lost and had trouble finding the room. Why would such a nice place not have someone to take you to your room the first time? We had asked for a balcony room, however when we got to the room the balcony was "attached" to the room next door. With me being there so much by myself I did not want that. We contacted the front desk and had no problem getting the room changed to one with it's own balcony. Of course we had to go back and find the lobby and then find our second room. The room was very nice and had a great big bathroom. The Spa...it was fantastic! I had a massage and a facial. Both the treatments and the therapists were great. It is a wonderful Spa and I do recommend it. I took the "Biltmore" tour of the hotel which is free to guests, and it was really interesting. I would recommend it. You learn tons of interesting facts about the era and the hotel. We ate in both restaurants. Both were very good but extremely pricey. Now don't get me wrong we like a good dinner, but at Wrights it was $202.00 for the two of us! It was good but it was not that good. We eat at "Ruth's Chris Steakhouse" here at home and while it is expensive it would have been less than that and much better. I was really looking forward to the Biltmore, and it turned out to be nothing like I expected. I was very disappointed. I expected a relaxing resort environment. What I got was a "convention" site. There were multiple "conventions" every day. You can imagine very large groups of people talking loudly together, large "gatherings" in the middle of the grounds. It was really a bummer. I never felt like I was at a resort. They even turned regular rooms into meeting centers so no matter where you went you never felt you were in a "relaxing" environment. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quiet, romantic, relaxing vacation. I sure wish I had known that, then at least I could have made my decision with all the information. Going there for business? This would be a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a vacation but not for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler053
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is historic and beautiful, as a business traveler I was disappointed. I travel extensively on business and often stay at Hilton properties. In fact I am a Gold VIP member. This is the first Hilton property I have stayed at that does not offer WiFi in the rooms. Also, it may sound trivial, but I expect to find in room coffee (I later learned it was available but for an extra charge). Given the higher than average room rates I would expect such amenities would be provided. When I arrived at the airport I called and asked for a shuttle, only to be informed that the Biltmore does not provide such service. I took a taxi but was disappointed when I arrived at the hotel to find that, although there were several hotel employees standing around the entrance, they were apparently not there to help guests as they simply stared at me as I struggled to get my luggage out of the taxi and into the hotel. Once inside I looked for the HHonors registration desk which the Hilton website said was there. If so, I could not find it. Later on I found I needed some additional toiletries and asked the Concierge for help. I was informed that I could take a taxi to a drug store (according the Concierge it probably would cost me $25 - $30 each way). It was clear that the person at the Concierge desk was completely indifferent to my request since after telling me to go get a taxi he turned away and left. Frankly I expect better treatment than this from what is supposed to be a first class hotel. I might consider this property as a vacation destination but I will never stay here again on business and will make sure my colleagues are aware of my reasons!

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry to say that it was pretty terrible”
Reviews.Author: Alton C
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say that this was a pretty terrible experience. First, please know that the resort is stunning and the staff couldn't have been nicer. But, my room was so overwhelmingly bad that I cannot recommend this hotel to the average business traveler. I do not know what type of room you get when you pay full rack rate but the room that I got under my corporate rate was pretty bad. The area behind the sink was torn out due to construction, the air conditioning kind of worked and the room smelled pretty bad. Why the hotel put me in a room that was under construction is just a mystery. The construction work continued in my room (without my knowledge) while I was in meetings. I learned about this around 9:00 pm on the second night of my stay when the housekeeping staff called to tell me that they needed to bring me towels. Apparently, I had no towels because they needed to remove my towels when doing the repairs. It is unnerving to learn that people have been in your hotel room when you are not there. This is not a small resort. I am sure there were other rooms avaiable (that were not under repair) during my stay But, I am equally sure that the hotel was happy to leave me where I was since I did not complain or make an issue about the construction. Shame on the Waldorf. You do not treat customers who complain with respect. You treat everyone with respect. When I submitted my on-line evaluation form to the hotel, the general manager called and offered me a free weekend certificate to "make up" for my experience. I turned him down. Why would I return for free? If a hotel does treat me with respect when I am paying...why would it treat me with repect when it is footing the bill? I'll pass.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel; excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: AiredaleTraveler
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Biltmore, attending a conference in the hotel. My room was in the main building - average room - not luxurious - but, adequate for a short stay. The common areas were very nice - especially the main hall and dining areas. Our octagonal conference room was very unique and comfortable. Most notably, the food was very good - I ate 6 meals at the hotel and every one was consistently well prepared and well served. The staff throughout the hotel went out of their way to make our stay extraordinary. From the bartenders to the front desk employees, everyone was very friendly and accommodating. My first morning at the hotel, I noticed that both drains in the room were clogged - I reported the problem to the main desk and within 2 hours they sent up a maintenance guy who fixed the problem. And, they gave me a credit on my bill - a very nice touch. In sum, I would definitely stay here for a conference, family vacation or romantic get-away. Don't expect luxury at a Ritz or Four Seasons level - but, you will experience very helpful and friendly staff, good food and a very unique environment.

Reviews.Title: “Ocatilla higher end rooms total waste and disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Erik_and_Stephanie
Reviews.Content: This is my third time to the Biltmore. I come every year in October for business and pleasure. Let me begin with the positive. The grounds are always outstanding. The pools are comfortable and clean. The main restaurant is also pretty good. So that's the good stuff. I gather the Waldorf Astoria Company knows it is time to update the rooms at this property. Good chance they have not been since Marilynn Monroe was there as a regular. However, as a start they have created a boutique hotel within the hotel called "Ocatilla". It costs extra to stay there but you get updated rooms, continental breakfast and beer/wine in the afternoon. They also have a staff member within the building to help you. Sounds good, right? Well, it's not!! The rooms are nicely updated but lack more common amenities found in higher end properties. For example, TV in the bathroom, more than two towels in the bathroom, decent shampoo and conditioner. We actually ran out of shampoo and towels because they don't give you enough of either. The scale in the bathroom didn't work and neither did the TV remote in the bedroom. I mean, when you get right down to it, the room was about what you'd get at an average hotel... not high end "boutique" as they call it. But that's not the worst of it. They promote this higher end stay as having a free continental breakfast. It was about the worst I have seen. They had these tiny stale bagels that when toasted only got worse. The muffins were stale as well. The granola looked okay but they had no yogurt to mix it with... I guess just eating it dry is meant to match the dry Arizona weather. Kidding aside, I found the free breakfast just what you'd expect - you get what you pay for. But wait a minute, I thought I did pay for it with the mark up on the room. BTW, I did kindly complain to the staff person assigned to the Ocatilla and she promised to speak to her manager about at least providing yogurt but nothing changed while we were there. Anyway, we checked out on Friday and moved down the street to the Phoenician and for the same price I feel like we're in heaven. Much better. Waldorf Astoria... you really have allowed your reputation to be compromised.

Reviews.Title: “Great grounds but past its prime”
Reviews.Author: n_leibo
Reviews.Content: BIltmore is a very nice place, but its rooms could use a bit of freshening up, especially at the prices they charge. Staff is courteous and responsive. The nice thing is that they have so many pools you could choose to go to a quiet pool with mainly adults or to a pool that would be more appropriate for young children. The grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: marketpro44
Reviews.Content: the arizona biltmore is the best. Great service. the restaurants were terrific with great food.

Reviews.Title: “Old charm but needs upgrading.....”
Reviews.Author: erinpope23
Reviews.Content: I guess we staying in the "old section" of the Az Biltmore, as you can see many new and beautiful parts to the property. But we were int he Valley wing and it was very outdated. The carpets were probably original, very worn and faded. Block walls in the halls were dirty looking. The room was very large but looked strange because the bed was off in an alcove and then there were 2 chairs and ottoman off to one side, a desk over to another side and this huge room with nothing in the center. I am not kidding, you could hold a 10 person yoga class in the middle! Dresser was very old, not antique and quaint, just old. I would definitely ask to be put in the newer/upgraded rooms next time. The pool area was beautiful, the grounds lovely, and the staff was very nice, but definitely some refurbishment needed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: waldoinparis
Reviews.Content: We traveled to this hotel from the East Coast for a wedding with our 3-month-old. It was very comfortable and very clean. They gave us a crib to use that was also clean and safe. The setting is gorgeous and the restaurants are actually good. The pools and amenities including the golfing is great. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort is the priority”
Reviews.Author: Traveler32722
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this lovely property for a week.Every step of this glorious property is maintained. The old world charm is mixed well with current day service. Each employee makes every effort to make sure your stay is pleasurable. The beds have to be the most comfortable I have slept in. The coffee shop as they call it has some of the best food found any where in Phoenix, There truly is no reason to leave the property everything you need is available.

Reviews.Title: “WOLDERFULLY RELAXING”
Reviews.Author: happygals_03
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends were treated like royalty at the spa, we had 4 hours of relaxing massage, jacuzzi, sauna, steam room and just pure relaxation. The locker room attendant Silvia was so wonderfull she was always asking us if there was anything else we needed, if we did she was on it to get whatever we wanted or needed. She really made our day wonderfull. All of the staff including the therapist were very nice and friendly. I will definantly be going again and would recomend u go!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would come back”
Reviews.Author: AllClear
Reviews.Content: I came here for a business trip and was pleasantly surprised at the luxury of this location. It offers a variety of sleeping quarters from a traditional hotel room to cottages and villas. The resort was at approximately 70% capacity, but because it is large and spread out, you never felt crowded or overwhelmed with other travelers. There are several pool areas accommodating kids and adult relaxation. There is a nice fitness spa. Also, a nice walking trail and golf right on the property. The service of the housekeeping, bartending, and waitresses was great. There is not much of a night life activity except for the bar and the pool. No music or dancing on property. The food was good and reasonably priced. I would recommend this to my company for a meeting. And I would also come back for a vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Always impressed with the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: workhardplayhardguy
Reviews.Content: My family and i took advantage of a wonderful deal on the internet one weekend in August. It was a belated birthday getaway gift from the Mrs. We have stayed at the Biltmore before for a romantic getaway and wanted to experience it as a family. The Biltmore seems to be the standard by which we compare other hotels and resorts. Hands down, the Biltmore never fails to disappoint us and always seems to impress us. We live in Phoenix and visit the Biltmore on special occasions. The resort staff is always friendly and accommodating and the resort itself is an iconic location within the city. Our last trip to the Biltmore we left the property one night for dinner but this time we did not leave the resort for any meal. We took advantage of the restaurants within the resort and were most impressed with Frank & Albert's! Our waitrons made each meal there very pleasant and the food on the menu was perfect. We had the pleasure of meeting chef Bryan who capped off our already impressive score of the place and made it an A+. Our room was very nice and had a balcony which allowed the Mrs and I to enjoy some wine while our child slept. Taking in the views and enjoying the resort that made us feel like we were in an Oasis within a city! Our only disappointments were the main pool was a bit unkept and too crowded on Saturday and seemed overwhelming. It probably had something to do with our favorite pool being closed for remodeling- the Catalina. Overall our stay rec'd an A. The resort staff and within the Frank and Alberts restaurant made up for any imperfections we had at the pool or on the grounds. A must visit for anyone coming to Phoenix. We did not get to experience any of the spa services this trip and the trails on the property are always stunning, just remember to bring water on your journey.

Reviews.Title: “"$45 for Chips and Beer?!?" Yes but they were the best chips ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidFancher
Reviews.Content: You can't expect everything to be perfect, but when things go sideways how do they handle it? Well the staff at the Arizona Biltmore did a fantastic job! We were very uncomfortable in our initial room so we addressed this with the hotel staff. They were very accomodating and moved us without hesitation. I give them big kudos for that. Even with summer rates you will find it expesive here. We actually paid $45 for chips and 2 beers by the pool (pool side service). You will pay to park and pay a resort fee. There are plenty of activities here some free and some not. On Saturday they offered a s'mores station for the guests and live music. The grounds are fantastic and the pools are relaxing. The history of this place was awesome as well. Our stay was worth the money. Impressions... Romance: Yes very much so Night Life: Relaxed Resort activities: Abundant and fun Value: You can easily spend a lot of money. Some unexpected charges. Recomended traveler: People who love Historical Elegance and charm. Overall: Worth it Side note: this hotel is nearly 100 years old. If you stay in the summertime The main building was warm and stuffy, expecially during the monsoon season (July - August). 1st night we ate in one of the Restaurants and it was uncomfortable. The next night was Room Service. We paid $100 total for two steaks, a bottle of wine and AIR CONDITIONING. I highly recomend the room service at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Arizona Luxury”
Reviews.Author: jayster
Reviews.Content: Overall, my partner and I had a positive experience. We loved the displayed pictures of the original Biltmore -- on the outskirts of Phoenix at the time. The Frank Lloyd Wright architecture is still relevant and the hotel is kept up very well and the layout is excellent. The grounds are spectacular. Frank and Albert's has a killer happy hour seven days a week. Due to my credit card plan, we had a very generous dining credit and very late checkout. Staff, start to finish, was excellent. We brought our dog with us for a deposit of $100 ($50 refundable upon checkout). However, the personalized "pet amenity" the property and its agents boasted about was never given to us. The room was spacious. The decor was mostly nice, but there were some outdated elements like the wetbar and refrigerator. The bathroom was large, but the tub and bathmat were dingy. The main pool has a loud and rowdy crowd. But, if you seek quiet, get a property map. The resort features a number of pools and most are empty and peaceful. The resort fee of $28 is waaaaay too high for what is offered. That included entry to the spa and fitness room. The spa was an incredible disappointment. The whole area is small and dated. The showers are also small and the doors are dingy. There is a hot tub and the decking area appears worn down. The steam room and sauna are small. We did not get a treatment, so I cannot answer about that aspect. DO NOT go here for a spa vacation. The spa is absolutely pathetic. Also, the resort fee was supposed to include a newspaper. We never got one. Parking is a rip off. Self parking is $12/day. Yet, if you just park your car in the structure or the spaces around the property, there is no verification you are a guest. There are plenty of spaces, too. Just tell the front desk you took a cab! Also, beware, the staff does landscaping very early on weekend mornings. Our neighbors smoke alarm also went off in the very early morning hours. As a result of the newspaper and noise, we were given a $30 credit which seemed fair. Overall, we had a great stay. Whether we stay here again will depend on price. We will also think twice about the overly high resort fee. I would rather pay a higher room rate for a property I feel is not ripping me off.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: badlybitten13
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate experience of staying at the Arizona Biltmore Hotel over Labor Day weekend. The first night I was in the hotel room, I found a black beetle in my bed crawling all over me. The second night I started noticing red itchy bumps on my back, stomach, legs and ankles. I began to realize that these bumps were spreading as the weekend progressed. I notified the front desk about the bites and they sent security and the head of housekeeping to check my bed. They stated that they did not find "any substantial evidence" as to why I was getting bitten. They changed the sheets and gave me itch medicated pads but sure enough the next day I woke up with more bites. It is almost a week later and I still have these bites that appear to be getting worse. I am very disappointed in the experience I gained from the Biltmore Arizona. I never expected to feel miserable while being on vacation. I will never return to this hotel again and I will never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Check before you go ...too”
Reviews.Author: VA-Panache
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, Megstravel15 was accurate about the activities going on at the Arizona Biltmore this past weekend. We too arrived to the “carnival” atmosphere and raucous crowd. My husband and I decided after enduring the first nite that we needed to change hotels. I did speak with the manager; he was very apologetic and helpful. He and the Concierge arranged for us to relocate (Thank you!) We would like to give the Az Biltmore the benefit of the doubt and try again but we will absolutely ask about any groups that are booked at the time of our intended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing from the Get-go”
Reviews.Author: fleabitten_10
Reviews.Content: Arrived at noon from Boston, MA, and did not expect that the room would be ready but asked anyway. I was told it was being cleaned, and would get a call when it was ready. Checked back at 2pm, 3pm and still told not ready because the hotel was full. At 4:10pm I went to the desk again, was told that since I am guaranteed a room by 4pm, they may have to give me a different room. I asked them to call the housekeeper and the room was, in fact, ready. On making the reservation months ago, I had asked for a refrigerator since my mother is diabetic. I was told that would be no problem. When asking about this, I was told to take beer, etc., out of the wet-bar, put them in a drawer and replace them upon leaving. Others colleagues were told to do the same. The clincher was when I had to sit in the West Foyer for four hours to direct delegates to the auxiliary registration desk. After about an hour, my feet started severely itching. I looked down and had bug bites all over my feet up to where my slack line ended due to sitting down. Two days later I went to the Concierge to report this since my ankles were still red and swollen, and they notified Security. I met with Security who took a report and gave me some itch-medicated pads and told me that I could pursue this further. Once home, I sent a fax to the hotel, and the matter was eventually turned over to Security Risk Services in California who sent out questionnaires to some of my colleagues who were witnesses to the fact that I was bitten. I received a copy of one stating that there were either bugs in the upholstery or rugs and that the hotel is dirty and musty. In fact, the West Foyer smells like a sewer and the Main Foyer like a cow pasteur. I received a response similar to the person bitten by bedbugs that no evidence was found to substantiate my claim. In summary, with all the feral cats running around on the property, the hotel can continue to "brush things under the rug" but, eventually the truth/fleas will surface.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TedInWa55
Reviews.Content: Great stay while attending a wedding reception on site! The staff was attentive, exactly what you would expect for a luxury resort. The only negative (and we have to look far just to find the one!) was that it took quite a while to get the omelet made at Frank and Albert's buffet one morning, and it took them a while took restock. It was a great breakfast otherwise. Thanks Biltmore!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Arizona”
Reviews.Author: lariatlane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding in August. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. From the moment of check-in the service was impeccable. We were in an upgraded room in one of the newer buildings. The suite was wonderful. Large sitting area, comfortable bed, and AMAZING bathroom! The Biltmore is an example of Arizona at its best.

Reviews.Title: “A chance to stay at the Arizona Biltmore was worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: Traceyabbywhite
Reviews.Content: The grounds are impressive, the service second to none. While our room was one of the more economical ones, we had a balcony with a view of the gardens and more then ample room for the two of us. We savored the tasting menu in the Gold room. A delectable 4-course meal with wine pairings was well worth the price. We loved the Catalina pool boasting intricate lapis and yellow tile, and one can understand why it is said to have been Marilyn Monroe’s favorite. The putting course provides ample entertainment while one of us went to the spa! I would put this on your bucket list it you have not already done so.

Reviews.Title: “It's a lovely historic hotel with modern amenities in a good location and has a great staff.”
Reviews.Author: STinAZ
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Biltmore was all that I expected from a 5-star hotel: large rooms with plush bedding, recreation for all age groups, good location, beautiful setting, and an entire staff that was professional and looked after all requests promptly!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: The_W0rm
Reviews.Content: Lived in Phoenix all my life and have had "stay-cations" at other resorts around the valley, I Didn't realize this gem, I love the F.L.W. Architecture , The layout and grounds were beautiful. already planning to stay there in March and cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ThompsonCR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Biltmore in August. The staff was so helpful, and got us everything we needed. The property is gorgeous, the rooms are nice, and everyone is very courteous. I would highly recommend it for anyone for any occasion!
