Reviews.Title: “oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: ginaeber
Reviews.Content: Lovely manicured lush grounds, nice boutique shops. Great restaurants and staff. Very relaxing atmosphere. Fabulous lobby. Awesome pools.

Reviews.Title: “hidden extra fees”
Reviews.Author: robnkellie
Reviews.Content: price for room was affordable. we paid $125.00 a night. but watch out for extra fees. valet parking was $25.00 a night or self parking was $12.00 a night. also there was a resort fee of $28.00 a day. we stayed three nights and our check out bill was over $550.00 and we did not charge anything to room. We did not spend much time on the property, we were there to move our twin daughters into their dorm rooms at ASU. Maybe if we had more free time we would have enjoyed the grounds and amenities they provide. But overall the extra fees we paid, left a bad taste in our mouths.

Reviews.Title: “Tended to our needs beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: october080
Reviews.Content: My daughter was married in Phoenix and the entire family, friends, and wedding party stayed in the hotel and we all had a blast. The ages varied from kids to grandparents and all enjoyed themselves with plenty of shopping, swimming, spa activities, and biking. The restaurants were wonderful and the crowd loved gathering around the firepits at night with a full service bar and fine service. The bride and groom stayed on site therefore all the flowers were delivered to one area and the wedding party did not have to relocate for pictures. The grounds were impeccable and for our out of town guests........an enterprise on site was a life saver in dealing with a rental car agency. The staff at the Biltmore was very professional and we had glowing reports from our guests. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Valley of the Sun.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: HFC2010
Reviews.Content: The only place to stay! Amazing customer service, outstanding food, friendly staff! It was my birthday and the hostess wished me a happy birthday when we checked into Wrights before dinner. Then the waiter wished me a happy birthday also; both had smiles on their face and seemed very happy to be there! They made my fiance' and I feel very special, and the accomodations were perfect! We enjoyed the pool, the fantastic restaurants and the suite we stayed in was perfection: the most comfortable bed, great shower and tub, huge balcony overlooking the pool...everything you would want and never know you wanted! We will definetly return to the AZ Biltmore! Maybe even make it a yearly tradition!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: ShoeQ
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this resort to anyone! One of the many resort pools was located right outside our patio. What a great location! It was very convenient walking right out the patio doors and into the pool area. We were able to peruse the grounds pretty freely. We did comment to each other that the security is pretty lax though. The paradise pool is the biggest pool. Our room was big and very clean and the bathroom had two double sinks which was nice. The bed was very comfortable. Room service was prompt. It was a fun girls' weekend!! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing quite like it!”
Reviews.Author: Jorylu
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, we had a an experience that set the standard against which all other hotels will be measured. Its a large, resort with many buildings, so I'm sure not all the rooms are in the same condition, but ours (in the ocotilla wing) was lovely. Well appointed and spacious with a balcony view of Piestewa peak. The best part about the Ocotilla wing is that it has its own concierge and a lounge with complimentary snacks, drinks, and dessert. If you stay here I recommend the Ocotilla wing (though I am curious to see what the experience would be like at the Villas, the Cottages and the original building). The pools were all well maintained, though only the Paradise Pool had food, beverage and towel amenities. The grounds were meticulous. The fine dining restaurant (Wright's) and the casual restaurant (Frank and Albert's) each had great food, service and ambiance. We didn't use the spa, fitness center or golf course (which is apparently owned and operated by a different entity) so I cannot comment on those. Every employee we dealt with had a friendly demeanor, was eager to help us and often used our names - great personal service! We will definately return to experience the Arizona Biltmore in the winter months, even though the rates won't be such a bargain. We're willing to pay a little more for such an unforgettable time in a unique hotel steeped in history and luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property with intriguing history”
Reviews.Author: coerulea
Reviews.Content: Although I stayed at this hotel for business, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay... the grounds are attractive and surprisingly lush for the arid desert of Phoenix (I would hate to see their water consumption). The architecture is extremely interesting, as you would expect from a Frank Lloyd Wright design, the staff was exceptionally helpful, with the wake up call performed by an actual person who asked if I would like any breakfast, or for a second call in 15 minutes (a Human snooze button, haha). The hotel exudes an early hollywood glamour, and pictures on the walls show the Rockefellers, Carey Grant and the like staying there... The on site Restaurants are very good, ranging from a quick outdoor cafe serving pastries and coffee, a casual restaurant serving "Arizona Comfort Food" and a high end more formal dinner establishment, although I was surprised at the somewhat limited beer selection, this was more than made up for by the willingness of the wait/barstaff to research a drink not on the menu and make it according to my request. I was upgraded to the Ocatilla wing, which includes an executive lounge with even more stellar service staff, and complimentary refreshments. The wing also includes a private pool. The resort was very sparsely occupied as I stayed during the low season, and the rate I paid was shockingly low due to this. I would recommend this property to anyone traveling to Phoenix for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “A fine, historical, grand place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MissyMew
Reviews.Content: The history here is great, from all of the Presidents who have stayed here, to the artwork, to the original design by Frank Lloyd Wright and more. It's worth taking a tour! The putting course is lots of fun for all ages, and the pools are all nice. Although there is not a water ""park" like so many AZ hotels include, they have done a nice job adding a slide in one pool. They do arrange kids activities. Our ten year old was quite busy and happy. Our teenage son did not find as much to do, but did also enjoy the stay. It's truly an elegent hotel with first class service, (ie: no coffee in the room unless you order room service or visit the on-location Starbucks). Some hotels in Phoenix skimp on service during the summer, but not this one. The older rooms are larger than the newer additions, so it's worth double checking what type of room you'll be receiving. Well worth a summer time stay, when the rates are about 1/3 to 1/4 of what they are the rest of the year!

Reviews.Title: “Watch those sneaky fees”
Reviews.Author: el_justarino
Reviews.Content: I went there for a one night "stay- caytion" as I live here in the valley. I figured it would be a great way to check out this historic hotel. The resort itself is decent (Starwood seems better) but the main issue was I picked the Biltmore based around it's decent price at $119. When the stay was said and done the bill was $180 so there were approx $60 in taxes, resort fees, and parking fees. Taxes are taxes and the resort fee are understandable to an extent but to pay for parking seems a bit ridiculous. It seems that the rearranging of the fees are just a way to present a cheap room rate and then BAM your $100 room turns into a $200 room a the blink of an eye.

Reviews.Title: “OUT OF THIS WORLD!”
Reviews.Author: Aliwander
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed here for The Poisoned Pen conference in June and could not have been happier. The food was delicious at Frank & Albert's (try their fish tacos--best I've ever had in my life--gorgeous presentation!) and our accommodations were top-notch, top drawer with every amenity we could hope for. Total splurge and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Bilmore - Amazing Restuarant - Frank & Albert's”
Reviews.Author: Mdgtemp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with all our meals included in our package. We arrived at Noon & were told that check in was at 4pm. We proceeded to Frank & Alberts for an amazing Lunch - The chef Scott - even came out to our table to chat. The service was excellent & the quality of the food was superb! We ate there for all 6 meals & each meal exceeded our expectations! By 4 pm (check in time) we where told only one of our 2 rooms was ready. The second room was finally ready by 6pm. (But the bathroom was not very clean) The previous guest had been given a late check out and they clearly rushed the cleaning. The hotel itself is amazing. We took the historical tour - excellent. We rented a cabana by the pool and enjoyed a lazy day by the pool. We had our camera stolen from our cabana. I recommend you keep a close eye on your belongings. (But that applies to all hotels) Overall I truly enjoyed this hotel. Our teenage boys enjoyed the facilities as well. It was a great relaxing family trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: MLG50
Reviews.Content: Great Art Deco design and the service was outstanding. Friendly staff and very helpful. Spacious and comfortable rooms A nice surprise was Frank and Alberts restaurant. All our meals there were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax in beautiful surroundings with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: kuching_10
Reviews.Content: Though the map provided by the Biltmore omitted the key cross street of 24th Ave - everything else about our stay was outstanding!. This is a very service oriented hotel - from the valet parking, concierge, golf course/shop to the restaurants. We were reminded of the Regent in Singapore. The staff made us feel welcome and were extremely helpful in guiding us to various locations in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. Each time the valet brought around our car we were given cold bottled water - nice touch. The appetizers and meals at Frank & Albert's were fresh and tasty. We would highly recommend this hotel! Nancy & Wayne

Reviews.Title: “incredible stay”
Reviews.Author: TheDixie
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the Biltmore Arizona and I am not sure why it is ranked number 11 on trip advisor - this facility should be ranked number 1. We stayed 3 days at the Biltmore and we thought it was an incredible hotel. Stayed in the Octilla (sp?) section of the hotel in a junior suite. The first night we stayed we had a drink in the main building and my husband and I both commented on how this hotel made you feel like you were back in time - if that makes sense. With the pictures hanging around the resort you just felt the presence of the old movie stars and the presidents that have stayed at the resort over time. This was the ONLY good part of being in Phoenix in July. Phoenix is so very hot and you really can't spend alot of time outside without having a heat stroke. Anyway - i am a picky hotel guest and this resort met all my expectations of a Biltmore Resort. I would highly recommend this resort to any traveler going through Phoenix. They like to keep their guests entertained - examples: marshmallow roasts one night and the other night was how to roll a cigar - where you could roll your own cigar. cool I thought. My husband played golf on the links course and he seemed to have liked it. Not the best course he has played, but a challenging course. Anyway - enjoy your stay at the Biltmore - i know that i did!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility--but be prepared to be nickled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: BabyBunnies
Reviews.Content: The main lobby and large ballroom and conference rooms are amazing--classic architecture for the late 1920's. We had a fantastic and expensive dinner in the main dining room. We were only there one night and the 106 temps kept us from using the pools. Re: the pools--the large pool is far away from the two wings that house most of the Classic rooms-both wings built in the late 1970's. We had a view of a pool which was exclusive for the VIPs staying in the concierge building next to us. The Classic room is nothing to write home about--your basic southwest decor--a bit larger than normal and nice to have 2 sinks. However, we did not expect to be nickled and dimed. The room had no self-make coffee pot and the 3-cup small pot of coffee from room service was $9. They charge an additional $12 for parking which seems excessive since the hotel is on a large acreage. Between those two additional charges and tips for bell service, any savings we had from the summer rate were gobbled up. We expected to pay some extra for this classic luxury hotel now owned by Hilton Hotels. But the no coffee maker in the room, just seemed cheap. I would still recommend it to a friend, but not for a long stay, unless they are a high roller and money is no object.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the new Ocatilla Club”
Reviews.Author: SunnyWineBunny
Reviews.Content: Having high expectations, I sported the few extra dollars to stay in the new private Ocatilla Club. The extra dollars was well worth it. All of the rooms are brand new and spotless. A host of complimentary services are offered and you gain access to their Executive Club. In the morning there is a great continental style breakfast and in the evening there is a complimentary cocktail hour as well as a variety of lovely treats. The Biltmore is a sight to behold. Being a Frank Lloyd Wright fan, I could not stop taking pictures. My favorite meal of the trip was the Corned Beef Hash for breakfast in Frank & Alberts restaurant. Spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: damian17
Reviews.Content: When visiting Arizona, the only hotel we stay at is the Arizona Biltmore. The grounds, rooms and service are all impeccable. If it is in your budget to rent a villa, I highly recommend it. They are absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “The standard, by which, all other's should hope to attain.”
Reviews.Author: Mauishark
Reviews.Content: Aloha! I have traveled the world over, more times than should be allowed in one life time. I have stayed at many wonderful and comfortable hotels, but never with the overwhelming satisfaction that I have experienced at the Arizona Biltmore. If there was ever a standard by which all other hotels and staff are to be judged against, well, this takes the cake! From the very moment I arrived on the grounds to the moment I left, I can honestly say that I have never felt more welcome and appreciated as a guest at a hotel in my entire life. I was a Captain for American Airlines for 26 years. Trust me. I know service when I see it. I kid you not. The hotel itself is amazing! It is steeped in such rich history and memories, that you literally feel the presence of such guests as Ronald and Nancy Reagan, Frank Sinatra, Sammy Davis Jr., all US Presidents from Franklin Roosevelt to the Bushes. The movie "White Christmas" was written on the property. Not to mention the fact the the Hotel was designed under the influence of none other than Frank Lloyd Wright himself and his apprentice Albert. Which brings me to the real reason I have chosen to share my incredible experience with you. It is not really the hotel that I am writing about, but the incredible people who work there and make the Arizona Biltmore, not a mere hotel, but a home... Let me share some specifics. Ok, let's begin with Damien and Jason at "Frank and Albert's." For anyone who has traveled alone, you will completely get what I am about to share. From the very instant I sat down at the bar to order dinner, I felt as welcome and comfortable as I would at my own house. Damien is quite simply amazing! This guy will achieve greatness. Trust me! He is a sharp wit, incredibly professional, and treats you as if you were the first and last patron he will ever see! Damien makes you feel welcome. What more can one ask? Then there is John Watson. John is the F and B Manager for Wright's Bar. John has his act together. I hope he won't mind, but I over heard him comment on the significance of plastic cups and the impact upon a hotel's bottom line. I was very taken by this. A hotel is a business. I was struck by his obvious savvy, but perhaps even more impressed with his temperament and attitude. One evening I was having dinner at the hotel's fine dining restaurant: "Wright's." I was having dinner with the woman who is responsible for my coming to Phoenix in the first place. She is amazing!! But that is another story, and I'm presently allowing her to have the space necessary to figure her stuff out. Back to my glowing comments about John... So, two men were in the restaurant, and one of them was, shall we say: "over served." Not by the restaurant, but by his own accord. Yes, we have all been there, and the movie "Hang Over" is more than familiar, but Crikey people! This guy was out of control! Now, I would have taken some primitive pleasure in causing significant bodily harm to this idiot, but cooler heads prevailed, as they are want to do, and the cooler head was none other than John Aris Watson. Let me simply say that he resolved the issue. This man rocks! Let's move to the pool bar. Christen is a young girl who serves at the Main Pool Bar. She is unusual, in that she is born and raised in Phoenix. Once again, we have another outstanding and positive personality embodied in this gem of a person! Need I say more? Which takes me to the Spa. Weary and stressed from travel, I sought refuge in the Spa. By the way, I didn't realize this during my first three days at this oasis from life in the desert, but Spa access is included in your room rate there in Nirvana! Yay! I have A.D.D. sorry. "Flashy Silver Object look!" HaHa... Where was I? Oh yes. The Spa. Well, upon arriving to enjoy a well earned massage, I asked the attendant at the Spa counter for help in contacting the Concierge for assistance in obtaining flowers to assist me in winning the heart of the forementioned perfect lady for me. There I go again! Shut it Joel! Lol! So, this young lady at the Spa is named "Elissa?" Not sure, but WOW!!! She stunned me too! Here's what happened: So, I want to order a floral arrangement to give to my future wife (Ooops!). Elissa over hears me struggling to order flowers and offers her assistance. Thank God! So, she asks what I'm looking for, and I tell her that the girl of my desire, mentioned she likes Lilly's. I live in Hawaii, I think flowers are amazing, but I wouldn't know a Lilly from a Frilly! Elissa says, when do you need them, I tell her, and just as my massage is finished, there is a knock on my changing door. The attendant tells me that there is a floral arrangement waiting for me at the Front Desk. Holy Toledo! Wow? They were amazing!!!! Did I say amazing again? Well, that's the Biltmore! Well, I have gone on too long, I'm obviously not a writer, and I am running out of attention span, but certainly not the accolades for the staff at the Biltmore that makes it not just a Hotel, but a true home away from home. (That was a run-on sentence. Darn!) If I was really rich? I'd move in tomorrow! Besides, then I'd be closer to that elusive butterfly I want to be my wife one day;) There I go again... Can't say I didn't warn ya!! Trust me. Go to the Arizona Biltmore. Stay a few days, then you, like me, will extend your visit. Again and again. Not kidding! It's that amazing. It will alter your vision of the world. Maybe you'll find your soul mate too! Relax, Play and Breathe! Joel Edwards Maui, Hawaii P.S. This was fun!

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: sdiegobrian49
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something special and I recieved mediocre. Disappointing. The worst is the refusal of concierge to tell me the price of a cab to the airport (it is about $25 including generous tip by the way). They said they were not allowed to me although they gave me the phone number to a cab serivce. All they had to offer was a "deal" for $35 plus tip with their service. C'mon.give the customer what he wants.....Hilton, your reputation is worth more than a few dollars' commission from Executive Limo. Also, the lunch was "Holiday Inn" not Waldorf collection. No bread was available in the hotel with salad! Please......... Oh also the previous guests' room service tray sat outside my suite for 2 days.........

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Manmtn
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is a beautiful resort and the conference facilities are very well laid out and organized. The rooms are clean and typical of other locations.

Reviews.Title: “finest and most responsive staff anywhere...”
Reviews.Author: sooner144
Reviews.Content: i have been here almost three weeks and am happy to comment that, without exception the staff and service at the resort has been outstanding......the restaurant staff (frank and alberts) in particular has been wonderful....the day manager matt went out of his way to ensure that all was well with myself and all other guests.....the wait staff to include tom and cheryl were excellent....tom may have been the finest, most polite, enthuiastic, attentive yet not overbearing, and knowledgable waiter i have ever experienced (i travel the world extensively)....the food was excellent and the chef scott robuck must be complimented on his efforts and interest in creating a perfect dining experience...chef scott went out of his way to be certain that my food was prepared well and to my liking as he visited my table several times in my stay.......the resort experience was excellent while the restaurant (frank and alberts) and staff, was PERFECT in every aspect......i will return....myles fisher...villa 7128

Reviews.Title: “Communication”
Reviews.Author: JamesValona
Reviews.Content: Everything was great with the exception of one incident: I had left my phone in a friends car who dropped it off the following day at 10am. I asked the Front Desk throughout the day if a phone had been dropped off and throughout the day they said no. I really needed my phone to pick up work emails so I started to get a little panicked. It was finally at 8pm that I asked the Bell staff and they in fact did have my phone. I am just curious as to why there isn't any communication between valet and the Front Desk?

Reviews.Title: “Frank & Albert's @ the bar with Matt as a bartender= great time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: TrishsDishAZ
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stopped by the bar to check it out. We know Muamer Habul the new General Manager. Great for you AZ Biltmore. We just wanted to be sure to comment on the great service we recieved from Matt the bartender. Matt is one of those guys that will keep you coming back because of his personality and outstanding service. We enjoyed the Hollywood & Wine promotion. Loved the fact you have Arizona wines on your list. AZ Stronghold white blend was so refreshing. The Duck Fries! Do not ever take them off the menu. We will be back! Trish's Dish.

Reviews.Title: “Plan to stay again - longer!”
Reviews.Author: jkmtres
Reviews.Content: We had a change of plans that ended our Arizona vacation in Phoenix and booked the Arizona Biltmore last minute. Our stay was excellent; staff were professional, accommodations superior. I feel we received excellent value for the cost. We plan to make it a destination vacation this winter.

Reviews.Title: “Frank and Albert's- Very impressive!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcfarlinsusan84
Reviews.Content: While i didn't stay at the Biltmore, i had the pleasure of dinning at Frank and Albert's. I was very pleased with the brand new restaurant and how clean everything was kept. Jason the bartender, was very nice, attentive, and poured a great martini. The happy hour bar bites were a fun and tasty surprise served almost Tapas style. The smoked trout was to die for!! Chef Kyle came to the bar with a comforting smile and asked if I was pleased with my visit, which was a nice touch considering I was by myself. Thanks for making me feel welcome, Chef!! Everything was great. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: taxchick0101
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great, food at Frank & Albert's was wonderful and spa services were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC PLACE TO BE AND STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: bcdw
Reviews.Content: I have to say the customer service was outstanding, and we were treated so well throughout our whole stay. The spa was wonderful! I had a facial by Lana Shalomopova that was superb! The pools are beautiful and fun, and the outdoor Biltmore Cabana Restaurant was great, as was the bar. The food at every restaurant in the hotel was outstandingly good, and we were wined and dined graciously. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay at a luxurious oasis in the Arizona Desert!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the salon and spa are the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: christine7797
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Biltmore was ideal. The hotel and staff were perfect, as usual. We had several spa treatments during our visit which were wonderful - extremely professional and relaxing. Our manicure and pedicure experience at the salon was wonderful - our nails were flawless, and we had a terrific time (make sure to ask for Mi Nor or Marylee!).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: ktleyed
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a fabulous stay at the Biltmore. This was my first time and I stayed for a long weekend with my two sisters. We shared a large and spacious room in the Ocatilla Section of the hotel and it's well worth the extra money. The lounge there provides a delicious continental breakfast, a happy hour with unlimited drinks and hors d'ouevres and later after dinner cordials, coffee and desserts. This is such a great deal and the service was tops. I got a very low rate too since it's off season. The Ocatilla concierge gave us a great recommendation to a nearby authentic Mexican restaurant, they printed up my return boarding pass and delivered it to me at my table at breakfast. I was charmed by the Biltmore. The separate Ocatilla pool was almost empty, even on the weekend, the workout room was clean and not crowded, I had no waits to get on the equipment, plenty of ice and water and towels and the spa ladies locker room was great as well. We had a roll a way for one night and they didn't even charge for it, and even though we had valet parking each day, we were charged as if it was the self parking ($12 instead of $27). I was pleasantly surprised with the bill. I have no negatives about this hotel. The grounds were immaculate and so beautiful and sprawling. It's somewhat of a walk to Ocatilla from the main building, but not bad, you pass the shops and it's a nice stroll, but hot if you're in the sun. I was pleased to no end and found no signs of wear and tear and need for a refurbishment and I can attest that our room was cleaned daily! I ran into the maid and she was so nice and accomodating, everyone was polite and made an effort to make our stay perfect! Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Better options for what you get”
Reviews.Author: lknight26
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I have stayed at the Four Seasons Troon, Fairmont Princess, JW Camelback Inn, Montelucia, and now the Biltmore. The Biltmore is definitely last on my list. First off $28 resort which does not cover parking. Parking is $27 valet and $12 self park, so pretty much ridiculous! Additionally the fee doesn't cover much which is why I have no idea why they charge a resort fee. Besides internet services, the other options are pretty much included within the STANDARD room rate at the other resorts. And yes while the others may charge a resort fees, PARKING was included. The hotel is old and I stayed in the Ocatilla tower which suppose to be the newer section. If that's new, then I sure hate to see the old. While decent, they can't compare to the competition I stated aboved. Turn down service was awful, whereas they don't service your room just give you towels. No clean up or NOTHING. They were suppose to run bath water if you request it, never happened. Don't get wrong not running bath water is not gonna ruin my trip, just don't offer it if you aren't gong to actually do it. This is suppose to be included when you stay in this tower because again you pay more $$$$ to stay in the Ocatilla. One person though who was awesome is Jazmin with the Ocatilla Conceirge, she was very nice and extremely helpful. The Ocatilla pool is suppose to private and only for club guest. Pretty much open to anyone, so again why bother paying extra for this tower if the rules aren't enforced. The cabana rental I must say were nice if you do it during the week when they are half priced. Othwerwise, don't waist your money because you are paying double when the cabana is really only worth the mid-week price. Everything is pretty much really expensive at the resort which is to be expected, but the nickel and diming for what you get in the OLD hotel is why I would not recommend it to others. If I have to be nickel and dimed, then I'd rather stay at a newer resort with better amenities! There is no way I would pay regular price when housekeeping isn't up to part, $28 resorts fees, plus parking which is a mile away, rooms are very dated, and the daily activities they offer all hae fees attached! Forget it. Save your money and stay at the Phoenician or the others I listed. Lastly, the staff was very nice but that is to be expected for what you pay and they are just as nice at the other resorts. So again, Biltmore just doesn't cut it with the competition and for what they are charge. You can save yourself the headache and some money by staying a newer and nicer resort where they appreciate your business, and provide a GOOD expereince for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Service Lousy, Parking a mile away!”
Reviews.Author: alnjudy
Reviews.Content: We checked in and we were told that the parking next to the rooms were all filled up and that we would have to use the parking thats a mile away from the actual rooms! Which by the way cost 12.00 just to park there. Ridiculous!!! We were also told that a golf cart would pick us and our lugguge up and take us to our rooms so we would not have to walk the distance. We passed 5 employees standing around. No one had a golf cart and no one offered to go get one. If they are going to have parking such distance away then they should have golf carts ready and waiting to take people to their rooms. We walked the whole (Seemed like a mile, no joke) way with our luggage. We have stayed in alot less expensive hotels and received better service. We will never return!!!! We were looking for a monthly get away, this will not be it!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gretta1122
Reviews.Content: I have never been treated as awesome as the person who checked us in treated me!!! Her name is Sarah and she made our stay so wonderful. She was so friendly...it is nice to start a trip out with such a friendly person.

Reviews.Title: “They need to refresh this place”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: Although some might appreciate the "rustic" charm of this hotel, it has clearly seen better days. A total refresh of the decor and furnishings is in order. In the cottages, a lot of maintenance has been deferred. While the service was quite good, the lack of upkeep is showing and the overall hotel experience is not worth the exorbitant prices being charged.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and classy place to stay and dine!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmg1935
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore for a "Girl's Weekend" and it was fabulous!! I have stayed there before and the facility just gets better and better. Our Aaron, the Bellman, greeted us and took such good care of the group and Ashley at the front desk was so pleasant and knowledgeable, we were all so impressed w/both Aaron and Ashley. Our rooms in the Ocatilla building were wonderful and of course, the executive lounge was a real treat. We dined at Frank and Alberts, after having a cocktail at the Squaw Peak Bar, served by Cory & Tony - they know how to mix a drink!! F&A's was great - Mo and Tom treat us like family every time we dine there and Eric makes sure our dinners are exactly what we ordered. You will not find a better place to stay in Phoenix - my thanks to all the very competent and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gussunfun
Reviews.Content: What a classic jewel in the desert. This resort has class and history. From the gold ceilings to the grounds. Just a great feeling, I felt like a superstar staying with the lakers. This is a place to see some spenders. Great to people watch. Its a resort that has something like 800 rooms. wow. So choose wisely. I had a room in the main lobby the first night. The room was small and had little space to move around.The next morning I spoke to Shane a desk manager who offered a larger room with a view, and offered a bellhop to help. I said sure. The bell guy named william was outstanding. He moved my belongings with no problems, seeing that i had completely unpacked. He told me to not worry. He gathered all my stuff and we moved to the next room. This gentleman was a historian knowing so much about the resort. He offered to set up a history tour and reserve a spot for me. That next day i took the tour finding out about the rat pack and all the presidents aswell as marylin monroe. Thanks to the historian Robert. This hotel was a outstanding compound. I would love to bring my family next time. Thank you for great hotel experience. shine some light on Shane, William and Robert.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cpete
Reviews.Content: I lived and traveled world-wide and stayed in 1-5 star properties. This was the worst night's sleep I have had in 35 years. I was told the day before arrival for a one-night "staycation" that an early check-in would not be a problem as there were plenty of rooms available. When we arrived, an upgrade to a suite was not available. I requested a rollaway which took two calls and two hours to arrive and a coffeemaker which also took an hour and a half. Micah at the front desk apologetically gave us a $25 credit. The afternoon at the pools, water-slide and swim-up bar was wonderful. Food at the poolside restaurant was good, service was fair at best. The drama started around 11 p.m. From 11-12:30 a.m. I was awakened four times by young parentless children running down the halls laughing and talking loudly. After reprimanding them myself, I finally had to call a security guard who promptly helped. At this point it was too late. In the morning I staggered to one of the restaurants with my young son, looking forward at least to the $40 breakfast coupon that came with our package. One clueless and apathetically slow hostess tried to field a line of hungry guests. When we finally got to the front she told us there would be another half hour wait. I returned to the front desk and told them of my disappointments (the coupon was not valid for room service). I was told that they could only offer a monetary reimbursement but that they were terribly sorry. That monetary reimbursement has yet to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay I have had in 50 years.”
Reviews.Author: Bryant_10
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the service was excellent, the food was excellent and the staff went out of their way to ensure we lacked for nothing. Some of the most beautiful landscaping I have ever seen as a backdrop to the golf courses. The Frank LLoyd Wright architectural style building nestled under the palm trees is extremely unique.

Reviews.Title: “They said it was better than it was”
Reviews.Author: zags40
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel as it doesn't measure up to other properties in the area. Yes the grounds are fabulous, and I know it was designed by Wright, but I still think it looks like a prison. We got a good deal at the Ocatilla ($179/nite) pool view, however they told us a few things about the Ocatilla that weren't true. In two different phone calls they told us they served free beer starting at 11am. It sounded too good to be true and it was. The pool was not private as they said, it was open to anyone, in fact there were many non-hotel guests at the pool (who were asked to leave late in the day). There was no drink service, no bathroom at the pool and no music. Self parking was minimal and the property is so big, it was a nightmare trying to find our room the first night there. Service was overall good, but somewhat spotty. We have stayed at several resorts in the area, and this just isn't that great. When you book look at the property map to see where you want your room. If you want a relaxing pool experience with music and a bar (and bathroom) at the pool, this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkeyb68
Reviews.Content: What a cool place to have a company holiday party. The room was nice & clean, the property & history of it was great for the architecture fan in me. can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Historical, and Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: If you haven't been to the Arizona Biltmore you are missing an opportunity to visit a wonderful and historic hotel. The grounds are breathtaking and spotlessly maintained by gracious employees. The front desk folks are accomodating, the valets are perfect, and the housekeeping is just so, so. During an extended stay on three occasions they forgot to clean my room. I am not sure how someone forgets to clean a room but 20 percent of the time that is what happened. The hotel is just huge so look carefully at your possible room. The main pool is great for kids and families. I stayed in a more secluded area with a private pool that was also just wonderful. Despite the housekeeping issues this is a marvelous place to spend a few days.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Manicure & Pedicure”
Reviews.Author: Ruby1213
Reviews.Content: Just a short note to recommend JALEH to get your nails done. She is top notch and a wonderful stylist. I received a caviar manicure & pedicure and got five star service ****! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore is a classic in every way.”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveller2010
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is a lovely hotel and the accommodations are generously proportioned and well appointed. The hotel facilities are up-to-date and the amenities' list extensive. It's a great getaway destination for couples and families. It's always reliable and the staff is very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: AnnaPhoenix_az
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Arizona Biltmore because my husband was going to be participating in a golf tournament so we decided to extend our weekend a little and make a little vacation out of it. Our stay was exceptional, and it all started from the very beginning with an extremely friendly valet named Charlie Castillo. Mr. Castillo represents the unmatched service the AZ Biltmore is known for. He went out of his way to make sure our luggage was handled properly and directed us to the correct area to proceed, given there were quite a few events going on when we arrived and it was a little confusing. He also made us aware of the locations of various popular places on the grounds, such as the fitness center, the main pool, and the shops. Also along the way, making several recommendations about restaurants on the property, for instance Albert & Franks where we enjoyed breakfast, and Wright's where we had dinner and drinks. We never had to leave the property because we were so informed and pleased with the valuable information Charlie gave us. He made us feel at home. The rest of the staff also was equally as polite, everywhere we went, they acknowledged us and said hello, making us feel valued. We will definitely be returning to the Biltmore again soon.

Reviews.Title: “one star service”
Reviews.Author: jeckel13
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference. Service was awful. Meeting room was moldy. Pool has little/no service. Children running wild. You have to get your own towels. The food and drinks are double the price of the Westin Kierland. Our room was in the main building. The terrace outside our room had meetings held. Imagine my surprise to walk outside my room in the morning to have a man standing outside it smoking. We asked to move to the Ocatilla our last few nights. We were told we would be called when the room was ready (they had told us specifically what room we would have). We arrived at the hotel and were told that we had been moved to the Paradise wing because there were no rooms in Ocatilla. We asked to speak to the manager several times, but were told she was too busy. With MUCH ADO, after 30 minutes they miraculously found the room. We were told it was a sales room, and by giving it to us, it would be costing them sales. My husband asked that a manager call us, but that never happened. The rooms in the Ocatilla were nicer, much more modern. Again, NO SERVICE at the pool, except for 1 morning. Towels never picked up or replaced at the pool. All rooms are a long walk. Self parking has very few spaces. We have stayed at the Royal Palms, Phoenician, and Westin Kierland, and this hotel doesn't even compare. The Adobe Golf course was like a poor public course, no elevations, no trees, etc. Unfortunately, our conference is here again next year. We wil not spend any extra time here.

Reviews.Title: “So great!”
Reviews.Author: tvnewseditor
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the Ocatilla wing of the Arizona Biltmore in early May. We had a ground floor room with a patio that overlooked our private pool area. There were plenty of chairs, umbrellas, towels, etc. The grounds of the Biltmore were absolutely stunning. We spent several hours at the Paradise pool and it was totally and completely relaxing experience. We ordered poolside lunch. I strongly recommend the greek salad. I was disappointed that the floating loungers cost $10/day to rent, but I guess they gotta pay for those beautifully manicured grounds somehow. Expect to spend a lot for food/drink. Even more shockingly, a 20oz coke at the on-site starbucks cost $4.50! Dinner was at Frank and Albert's - great menu, lots of choices. I wanted to order about 5 times more than would have been reasonable :) The $28 resort fee is a bit steep, but I knew in advance I'd have it so no surprise there. I would strongly recommend staying here, whether it's for one night or one week!

Reviews.Title: “Jaleh in the beauty salon was very special.”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixGoplay
Reviews.Content: Jaleh took care of me in the beauty salon. My hair always looked perfect. Jaleh treats her clients with the utmost courtesy. Jaleh is totallt attentive to each client she is attending, is always on time, and is always to be found with a smile on her face. Jaleh really made me feel special. I always am happy when I return to the salon. Thank you, Jaleh

Reviews.Title: “Night Construction Work”
Reviews.Author: Tkcmw
Reviews.Content: At a resort of this caliber you would expect that the hotel management would not allow construction work to take place at 1:30 am. However, work continued even after three calls to the front desk manager. On the third call the manager advised that the night work was authorized by the General Manager and it would not be stopped. To allow masonry work, involving tile saws, drilling, hammering and load talking to take place at these hours shows total disregard by the General Manager for his guest.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: bdecore
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful! Customer service was timely and very good. We enjoyed our stay so much. The staff was always friendly and responded in a timely manner. The room and balcony were very clean and we enjoyed the view tremendously. The gardens are lovely and we enjoyed walking around the site in the early morning. We enjoyed the deli for a quick breakfast. The hotel environment is lovely; we felt very safe and well taken cared for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, from the rooms to the service to the amenities, the Biltmore delivers.”
Reviews.Author: carolcolombo
Reviews.Content: The villa suite was large and lovely. The kitchen was equipped with everything that I needed to make dinner. The amenities were fantastic, especially the pool area, and the staff was very responsive. The Biltmore is a modern classic and we had a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to find a hotel that has a restaurant onsite serving organic foods”
Reviews.Author: PassingthruOmahaNe
Reviews.Content: We were most impressed with the on site restaurant Frank & Albert's. The menu included organic vegetables, free range turkey, and hormone free, antibiotic free beef. The kids loved the food and looked forward to eating there repeatedly ( 3 dinners and 1 breakfast). The restaurant servers Anna, Billy, Mandy, Adrienne were all polite and prompt. Thomas C. one of the managers made a point to visit all the customers present. The hotel was very full the entire time we were there and the only time that was an issue was finding an open lounge chair at the main pool between 11am to 4pm. Otherwise no overcrowding problems. The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back-kid friendly with style”
Reviews.Author: fencingmom2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 daughters (ages 4 and 17 months) returned to the Biltmore for our 3rd Easter in a row. Each year we look at other places in Phoenix since we'll be in town to see family, but can't find a better mix of style, good restaurants, kid-friendly amenities and location than the Biltmore. With the addition of the Frank and Albert's casual restaurant, things have gotten even better. In the past we'd leave the resort to eat lunch or dinner at the nearby Cheesecake factory or California pizza kitchen because the resort lacked a kid-friendly restaurant. This year we booked an all-inclusive package that was terrific and so we ate about 10 times at Frank and Alberts and never exhausted the options. The food was really good--mostly organic fare, fresh ingredients, nice presentation--and the restaurant is very big with nice outdoor seating so we never felt like we were bothering the adult parties in the restaurant (a separate bar area helps, too). Our girls loved the paradise pool and playground, my husband played a round of golf (a bit pricey at about $300 covering greens fees cart rental and rented clubs but very nice), and I got spa treatments. In particular we had great service from Adrienne at Frank and Albert's and Judith at the squaw peak lawn. The only downside is that lovely grounds are very spread out I wish I had brought a double stroller--getting from place to place is real hike and my girls occasionally fought over who was going to be carried and who was going to ride. And housekeeping usuallly comes late in the day so it can be challenging to coordinate naps; we opted to let the girls nap poolside in the shade, which was fine. In all though, service was terrific and we'll likely return next year, particularly if they offer the all-inclusive package again.

Reviews.Title: “High priced inconsistency”
Reviews.Author: durigirl1
Reviews.Content: There is not doubt this is a beautiful setting with amazing architecture. Yet, the tone is not set for a highly rated resort. We were greeted by a rude valet , a screaming child in the lobby and had to wait for our bags. WE had asked for a quiet room. We were woken up that night by a barking dog in the next room. When it started barking again we called the front desk. When I asked why we were being woken up by a dog two nights in a row in a quiet room the answer was "we are a pet friendly hotel." I was transferred to security and was told pets were not allowed in our building. To management's credit, they did comp our room for a night. Service at Frank & Alberts was indifferent and inconsistent. Wright was wonderful. There were both kids and adults bathing in the fountains. i would be hesitant to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Service, A True Slice of Americana!”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: All in all, my wife and I had a truly enjoyable stay at the Biltmore. The hotel is an amazing historical treasure. I really enjoyed walking around and looking at all of the photos of the hotel through time. There are some spectacular aspects to the property including the architecture and the grounds. The pools are all quite nice, but were crowded on our weekend stay. If one wanted a chaise lounge by the pool, you had to be down there to "claim" it with a towel and book by 8am... This was a bit too much "cruise ship" lack of quality to me, not what one should expect at a Waldorf Astoria. The rooms were quite acceptable... I can understand where someone would say that they need to be re-done, however, they are truly appropriate for the time period in which the hotel was built. The decor (very Frank Lloyd Wright, straight line and plain) appears bland, however it is correct for the hotel design and period of acrchitecture. The grounds are AMAZING and kept to perfection. The bathroom was very nice with a rainfall showerhead. The linens were first class, triple sheeted, with high thread count cotton. The bathrobes were equally nice. Finally, the restaurant was wonderful (Wrights). This was one of the most imaginative dinners for a truly classic hotel. We enjoyed the Chef's Tasting Menu with the WIne Pairings and found both felt that it was one of the best "hotel meals" that we have ever had. The sunday brunch was equally nice. The bottom line is that the hotel is really a true slice of American history. The architecture is fabulous, the rooms are very nice, and the grounds are amazing. My only complaint was the lack of chaise lounges at the pool (as well as the number of young children at the pool). I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjsteve77
Reviews.Content: Overall.../little things here and there, but quite an extensive, attentive stAFF AND CLASSY!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again if they paid me.”
Reviews.Author: kekwiatkowski
Reviews.Content: We were allocated this hotel as apart of a travel package with WWE Wrestling. Since we were staying in the USA for about 3 weeks, we thought we'd arrive at the Biltmore a couple days early. I have been here approximately 28 hours, and this is my review so far - it will take something magical to change. I will preface this by saying the landscaping and gardens are beautiful; but thats where the beauty stops. For starters, at check-in, there was no friendly greeting and an early check in was "sighed" at, due to the inconvenience, despite 4 other people checking in early before us. They initially did not give us directions to our room, no map of the "resort" and no information regarding the breakfast. When we arrived at our room, their "standard" room we've come to learn, we realised our room was far from the quality expected of a 5 star resort. there were wet patches from steam cleaning (still damp today); no coffee making facilities (I thought even 2-3 star hotels had this); modern LCD tv but the rest of the room has not been updated in over 10 years. You could not even bathe two toddlers in the bath it is so small. There is no WiFi in the rooms, only a frayed ethernet cable which I refuse to plug into my $2000 laptop. Our next revelation came when we found out the only bus service is the hotel shuttle which takes you to the only near by "mall" - a few restaurants and shops but nothing to write home about. Had to walk an additional 2 miles to buy bottled water at a CVS since the hotel wishes to charge $US8 a bottle. Due to the hotel having 2 conventions on and the wrestling fans arriving, no rental cars are available on site, so we are now on a waiting list in case one is available today otherwise have to wait till tomorrow. That will mean that 2 days accommodation and stay in Phoenix have been wasted doing nothing. Any attractions are a $US25-50 one way taxi fare away. Upon approaching the duty manager and multiple different concierge for assistance, we have been laughed at; looked down upon and not offered any advice or assistance. We have stayed at multiple 5 star hotels that the concierge teams go above and beyond to assist their guests - apparently at the Biltmore, unless you are a rich golfer or doctor, you're not a worthy, respected guest. I really dislike this hotel. They need to learn customer service; we've met one nice bellboy and that is it. I would never dream of coming back here, even if they paid me $US300+ a night to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Marcoland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned last week from a perfect stay at the Arizona Biltmore. The hotel is lovely: the architecture is stunning, the furnishings are interesting and completely in keeping with the style of the buildings, and the grounds are breathtaking. Our room was spacious and comfortable (great bed and pillows) and the food was outstanding. However, an equally notable feature of the hotel was the topnotch service, from the room attendants to the restaurant servers to the front desk staff - it was clear that their primary goal was to make every guest feel welcome and happy. We had an issue with the temperature in our room and Chris, one of the front desk assistant managers, made certain that an engineer was sent to our room within minutes and he checked back with us regularly to ensure that the problem had been taken care of and that we were satisfied. He indicated the option to switch our room but we were otherwise so pleased with our accommodations that we wanted to stay put. He was friendly, pleasant, and a true professional. We had a wonderful getaway in Phoenix (so much to see and do), but it was our stay at the Biltmore that made our vacation just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly65201
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip. He was meeting colleagues. We were given a room on the second floor overlooking the desk. The rest of our party were placed in cottage rooms but our rate was the same. The room was small and very noisy from the outside and an 80's party one night. The air conditioner was very loud and not easily regulated. The maid spoke no english so a request for more shampoo was fruitless. The service at the cabana restuarant was terrible. They were out of the spring rolls I wanted to order and the waiter said it would be 20 minutes. Then he forgot to come back and take out order so I decided the now 10 minute wait would be ok but now he said the wait would be 30 minutes! The gift shop closed at 10 pm. We arrived at the outside door at 9:50 and it was locked. 2 men working inside just looked at us. We went in to the inside door and it was open. We got our bottled water but the cash register was already down. They were not at all helpful. For $400 per night I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and quality!”
Reviews.Author: kmh3
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the Ocavilla part of the hotel. We had our own concierge, who happily did everything and anything for us, continental breakfast every morning, cocktail hour with appetizers every evening, our own pool and own lounge with firepit. Our room was plenty big and the bed was super comfortable. The Frank and Alberts restaurant was a good restaurant but Wright's was over priced and had a very limited menu. Our concierge found us some great restaurants off the grounds that we enjoyed. The staff was really really friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this place and would go back. I think staying in the Ocavilla was a must. I think it would be great if they had some kind of entertainment on the weekends, although they did have a nice piano player in the lobby at night. The golf courses were "okay". Nice fitness center, beautiful tennis courts, nice spa.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING. I can't believe this isn't at 100% thumbs up. One of the funnest nights I've had on a trip”
Reviews.Author: CareBear122
Reviews.Content: My wedding reception is at the Biltmore in the Gold Room, my sister and I stayed for just one night on a Sunday. Our room was comped for site inspection, and we were LOVING it all the way, whether it was comped or not. The front desk staff was super friendly, answered all our questions with humor and patience, and let us take our own tour of other suites, just for fun. The place is like a compound, just massive. immaculate grounds, 8 pools, shopping, etc. We stayed in a junior suite in the Ocotillo Building and were SO impressed. I live in Vegas and have seen 5 star/5 diamond hotels, but the Biltmore is so architechturally different and unique and the grounds so sprawling, our room was huge, probably 1000 square feet, with a pool view, plush beds with good sheets, huge plasma TV, everything you need in the gorgous, modern bathroom, huge stone tiled shower, walk in closet. Prompt room service, rushing up just to bring a toothbrush and toothpaste. Fantastic late night room service with good food, great movie selection to order on demand. Best part is the executive lounge in the Ocotillo building. From 5pm - 10pm they offer complimentary hors douvres of all kinds, vegetables with dips, varietyof snacks and a very well stocked bar, along with wines and champagnes. Comfy, clean and modern lounge with free internet and a staff that does NOT even bother you. Firepit area outside. My sister and I stayed in there having mimosas and snacks for 4 hours and just catching up. I',m bummed we missed the complimentary continental breakfast from 8 -10 the next day. The beds were so plush we didn't want to get out of them. We roamed the grounds after and just had fun looking at all the little details of each restaurant and sun room. It's all the little details, there were even candles in black sand next to the jet tub to light for a bath. My only regret is that we couldn't stay longer. And my reception room, the Gold Room. Breathtaking, unique, huge, inviting. Props to cool Stacey Shapiro who does MY job here, event director. Energetic, cool lady who's on her[--]. ! Yeah, this hotel is expensive as [--]. But worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore: 5 Star Grounds, 1 Star Service, Room Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Travelinglynn
Reviews.Content: Few hotels anywhere have more beautiful grounds or architecture than the Arizona Biltmore. Unfortunately, however, our recent stay there was terribly disappointing. Most all of the service was unfriendly, unhelpful and unresponsive. With the exception of a helpful bellman, one likable and funny waiter, a hair stylist, and few others, we were greeted with scowls, long waits (including for any phone inquiry), and frequent negligence. The incidents of poor service are too numerous to describe. Although our travel agent made certain that we requested an accessible room, we were put in a worn down room in the middle of the property inaccessible by car. We were taken in a golf cart past the laundry, tennis courts, far away from any services, and brought up the freight elevator since the bellman thought it would be faster than me trying to hobble down the long hallway. We were told that another closer room with a view would cost an extra $175 per night. It took a lengthy negotiation to land in a villa closer to the main building. The room was small with filthy, ripped up carpeting, a small, extremely old television and the worst hotel bed I have slept on in ages. The notice indicates that there is turn-down service, however, you will never need to call for it, since the maid staff turn down the bed in the morning. That's right, they never make the bed up completely. The poor service was more than frowning faces everywhere who acted like they were doing you a big favor to change a bill, or show you to a table. Never before have I been completely blown off by a concierge who I tipped 20$ to make a reservation for me at a local restaurant, and a hair appointment. That's right. I requested that he call and leave a message with the info at our room, but he did not. I left my glasses at the beauty salon, and the operator refused to put me through to the salon directly. I was transferred to security but there was no voice mail, back to the operator 3 times. I tried calling the spa, explaining that I was disabled and had to ask if someone could walk over to the salon to locate my glasses. The spa agent said she would, but she also never returned my call. There was an endless phone que for anything: room service, salon, housekeeping, security, spa. Terrible. The hostess in Frank's restaurant was beyond rude and unhelpful, though the food was fabulous. I will say that the food at the Biltmore was consistently superb: Frank and Al(?), the Wright room, the Cafe, room service. Do go to enjoy the grounds and the meals at the Arizona Biltmore.. Not one person inquired about our stay, and the rooms had no hotel survey about the staff, grounds or service, as most do. No wonder. It is clear that the management really does not care. Terrible, terrible attitude throughout the hotel. One other note about parking. Guests have two parking options: 1) valet parking in the main hotel for over $24.00 per day (excluding tips), or 2) self parking for $12.00 per day. Be advised that there are not enough self-parking places often, and you may have little choice but to pay the full valet parking fee when you return to your room on Saturday night and there is not a free spot anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “loved it , loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: call4less
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Biltmore. I was, am very impressed with the resort. My patio room was beautiful and spacious. I enjoyed the pool, gym and the spa. The grounds were lovely. I especially enjoyed my meals at Frank and Alberts. I had dinner there twice and my server was a delightful young man named Brad. He took care of me both times and was a pleasure. He managed to be very attentive while not being intrusive. I like that. He was professional, knowledgable and obviously happy to be working there. He even told me about the tour you offer to your guests, which I thoroughly enjoyed! I look forward to returning in the fall with my husband and friends in tow. Keep up the great work! Sincerely, Dubois Lynette

Reviews.Title: “Off the charts!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JULESVERNE66
Reviews.Content: I am a traveler. I am Gold Elite on Continental Airlines. I am silver with Hilton. This is very important information for my story. My husband is a TOTAL high maintenance traveler. this is my 10 stay at the Biltmore but they total exceeded expectations tonite. My son who is 5 fell asleep while having cocktails on the veranda. The staff saw that he was asleep and went to find a blanket to cover him up. WE had a 6:30 dinner reservation at Frank and Alberts. The STAFF made sure that since my son was asleep they blocked the booth next to us so he could sleep and we could enjoy dinner. The restaurant was totally packed and they had no problem taking the hit to the table so we could enjoy our dinner. Whats important here is that the management to the wait staff made absolutely sure that we were happy and to the hotels determent (by loosing revenue for the table). You cant make that kind of service up and I got the hotel manager to come and take pictures so he could show the management how its not the hotel but the people. YOU wont GO wrong here if you are looking for service!!!! STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: jkchen1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort and very old moneyish. I just wish they had coffee in the rooms. Also, my bed in RM 3107 needs to be replaced. Loved the Frank Lloyd Wright inspired hotel. They have a hotel tour on Thursday morning 10am. Great History.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Feel the History”
Reviews.Author: BlueCamaro
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into the lobby, you can feel the history. The design and architecture are spectaular. Pay attention to each detail and you'll notice something new around every corner. We stayed in the main building and our room was generously appointed. We had an excellent view of the courtyard. Our only issue with the room was the size of the bathroom- too small. We ate at Frank and Albert's and the Cabana Club- all excellent meals. I can't think of a better time than laying by the pool and drinking a "Marilyn". At the Biltmore, you'll feel like Marilyn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay w/ kids”
Reviews.Author: CooperAlex
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Biltmore and brought my family (kids ages 7,5 and 1). It was great. They have 8 pools (one w/ a waterslide) and the grounds were beautiful. The room was very spacious (and inexpensive at $229/night) and the family had a great time. The service was excellent and the conference was set up very nicely as well. I have no complaints whatsoever. This was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at (maybe Ritz-Orlando or Fairmont Princess in Scottsdale are as nice) and we really enjoyed ourselves and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip! Planning the next one...”
Reviews.Author: debrossha
Reviews.Content: After seeing the Biltmore on the Travel Channel a few years ago, we have been saving our "pennies" to take a trip out west and stay there for a few days. The Biltmore lived up to everything I saw on the Travel Channel... The grounds are beautiful, rooms were very comfortable, spa and services fantastic and several wonderful meals at Frank and Alberts, and the two smaller cafe's on site. We had a very relaxing stay and as a final note, I believe every single person on the staff at the Biltmore, landscapers to wait staff to front desk, had a smile or hello to offer us... We loved it and can't wait to return. Thank you Arizona Biltmore for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “fun, fun, fun”
Reviews.Author: barbiflys
Reviews.Content: We are here right now and love it!!!! Our room is a Catalina pool villa. Simple room w/ a very comfortable bed, nice large bathroom and free internet. We have a gorgeous balcony that has very nice furniture and overlooks one of the pools. The only negative I could give the room is that there isn't a coffee maker in it. We played golf here yesterday and had a great time. We ate and drank at 2 of the hotel bars and everyone has been lovely. The food was excellent too!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LaliBird
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went for a weekend to relax. We had a great time. We had the all-inclusive package which was a great savings. We loved the spa - had massage and facial. Food and service was good at restaurant. Grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @ Biltmore!”
Reviews.Author: CultureWarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ocatilla wing -- large room, great bed and nicely furnished room. Bathroom isn't huge, but has great soaking tub and good amenities. Ocatilla includes a club level service for breakfast and evening appetizers -- although these rarely last more than 30 minutes. The hotel grounds are gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to eat on the lawn rent a cot outside, but stay away!”
Reviews.Author: sbolhack
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this resort are spectacular. In fact, if you wanted to camp outside all night, this would be an unbelievable choice. However, the condition of the rooms and the service are horrible. Our room had only three sets of towels for four people, one of the sinks did not drain, and the shower did not drain. You ask yourself that at a five star hotel, what systems do they have in place where these issues are missed. Did the cleaning service really clean the rooms with stopped up sinks and shower and never notify anyone or did they just not clean the rooms? They never asked us if we wanted a bellhop to carry our bags to the journey to our rooms. This is not good service even for a motel 8. The meal at Frank's was also disappointing; the service was great. They clearly had no systems in place. People were complaining about not having their drinks served with the answer that we were really busy (it was Valentine's Weekend); meals were clearly being left under the heat lamps without being served on time. My fish dinner was returned. It was the first time that I actually had to use a knife to cut into the fish as the heat lamp stonified my fish. If I were the chef I would be yelling. The substitute hamburger was like a hockey puck; again ordered medium and the victim of the heat lamps. If you must see this place, then just go have a drink at night outside and enjoy the grounds. But stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Returned to Arizona Biltmore 11/09”
Reviews.Author: VenetianLady
Reviews.Content: My husband & I returned to the Arizona Biltmore to spend Thanksgiving with Family. Although we booked an inexpensive room with a senior discount, the front desk suggested we upgrade, for a fee, to the Ocatilla Building. The thought of having a dismal room again in the Paradise wing was discouraging, expecially after leaving NY's dismal weather and being in sunny, warm Phoenix. The Occatilla room was much better. The continental breakfast was okay and complimentary soft drinks during the day was a nice amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge/Bartender”
Reviews.Author: Beadelight
Reviews.Content: Traveling as a single lady it is nice to feel comfortable dining solo. I stayed several nights and ate on property most evenings at their bar-restaurant and talked with Olga who was making awesome martini's and great conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed With Service”
Reviews.Author: mthor53
Reviews.Content: I have never left a review here before, but this time I feel compelled to do so. We were really looking forward to staying here and wanted to love it. But that was not the case. We were in Phoenix for business and leisure, and we picked The Biltmore because of its reputation and location. We have stayed in luxury hotels comparable to The Biltmore and have never experienced the indifferent service this hotel provided. The grounds are beautifully maintained and the suite was large and clean--no complaints there. However, the atmosphere in general is cold. We cut our 5 night stay to 4 nights and will never stay there again. We were promised the opportunity of an upgrade upon check-in which never happened. The clerk was indifferent at best. We had to call housekeeping two times for towels, there was never any ice, no turn down service, and had to ask for toiletries to be restocked. It was as if once we checked in we didn't exist. We were also promised complimentary goodies in our room upon check in--there was nothing. Also, be prepared for a hike to your room from the parking lot. It got worse one night when there was a wedding and valet parking "reserved" the majority of nearby parking spaces for themselves. I started watching the staff and I noticed that their demeanor in general was not welcoming. I didn't see many smiles. We just checked into the Enchantment Resort in Sedona and it was a 180 degree difference. They are incredibly friendly at Enchantment and could show the staff at Biltmore a thing or two.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad hotel. It's just old. I was really looking forward to staying here but left underwhelmed. The service is worthy of a Waldorf but that's where it ends in my humble opinion. The rooms were spacious but dated. The grounds were nice but not overwhelmingly beautiful. This is a very solid 4 star property. The history of this storied property is interesting. If you can catch a rate go ahead and check it out. This hotels' biggest asset is it's past though, so please adjust expectations. The Biltmore area of Phoenix offers quite a variety of high-end distractions. It's a nice place to visit. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay...”
Reviews.Author: jk03
Reviews.Content: We needed to get away for a few days.. not interested in being on a timeline or needing to feel like we had to be somewhere. The Biltmore has a Old Hollywood feel, very luxurious and relaxing. The staff is SO friendly, the accomodations are comfortable, the spa is terrific, i recommend the reflexology massage and the restaurant and lounges are 5 star. The evenings are perfect, fire pits everywhere, great service. we will return.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PLACE !!!”
Reviews.Author: Francois_travels_Mtl
Reviews.Content: I had seen the Biltmore in art magazines but being there in person was a totally different experience. They advertise as a Frank Lloyd Wright inspired hotel...and, believe me, it is. Everywhere you look, you really are in the man's world. If you like architecture you'll be in awe during your whole stay; every detail has been thought of....amazing. Take a long slow walk our the hotel grounds, you'lll get to see all the pavillions. Tips : If you choose to park your car yourself, in the section to the left of the main entrance (where the condos and townhouses are located) you HAVE TO come back all around the main building and enter through the main entrance and lobby; we did not think of doing that, took the short cut through the pool section and went in by a side door... So, around the main building, you go in by the main door, first you get a peek and two of FL Wright's Midway Gardens statues outside, then the famous 6' high glasswork (inside) and walking to your right, you get to the main - exquisite, redone by architects of Taliesin West in the 70th, following a fire - lobby. Our room was on the third floor in the main "historic" building. They said it was an upgrade for Hilton Honors members, we had also booked as CAA/AAA members. Our total cost of 427$ included one night for 2 people, small king size rool, amazing terrasse - front of the building, free (but slow) internet access in room / terrasse, 2 free drinks at the Frank's bar, a few extras and tax...Worth every dollar !! The next morning, we had breakfast at their Albert & Frank restaurant : great food; this newer building reminded us of FLW's japanese work...worth a visit. Also, if you like FLW's work, you have to visit Taliesin West while in Phoenix / Scottsdale : it is beyond anything we had imagined it would be. François, Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Awful service....rip off place.”
Reviews.Author: mgross75
Reviews.Content: Don't make the mistake and stay here unless you want awful indifferent service and outrageous charges. It starts with an additional $28 "resort fee" for wi-fi service and no coffee in the room or any other place in the morning except by going into the restaurant. I had requested a quiet room. The room in the main building was over the bar which rocked til mignight and there was an outdoor party behind my room with a loud band and firecrackers til 10:30 pm. When I called the front desk they told me that I could come down and get some ear plugs. Apparently that is what they do as the clerk acted like they have to give them out all the time. The termiinal at the airport would have been a quieter and better place to sleep. No one in management called to apologize or provide another solution. Don't bother going here and try the Westin or Palms instead. This place is old and over rated. You will regret it. The room cost $400 and the place does not care about their "guests."

Reviews.Title: “The Housekeeping Dept. at the Biltmore does a great job!”
Reviews.Author: mpmfire
Reviews.Content: We had left some packages in our room and the manager of housekeeping (Jeremy) and his department were diligent in searching over several days for the items. They did finally locate everything and were courteous and professional in all aspects of our request s- from recovering the items to having them shipped back to us. "Above and beyond" customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby for a classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventurer26
Reviews.Content: My visit was for leisure. I was disappointed with the condition of the bathroom and room,outlets hanging loose from the walls ,bathroom ceiling paint flaking off, and most annoying the worst air conditioner and bathroom fan ever!! We sat outside at night near the fire pits to only have cats jumping around and sitting on outdoor furniture. I asked the server whats the story with the cats ,she said they live here. I don't appreciate sharing my evening with felines who jump on and off furniture. I have allergies therefore that ended my nice evening with family outside. Come on Biltmore , capture the cats, repair shoddy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel. Would stay here forever!”
Reviews.Author: Netty13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Arizona Biltmore a number of times and have never been disappointed. The rooms are elegant and clean, the pools and grounds beautiful and the whole atmosphere is calm and tranquil. This trip, the Biltmore Grill had just been remodelled and we happened to check in the first night it was open to the public. The wait staff were a little confused and it took a while for us to be seated, but the food was great. The staff at breakfast were much more on the ball. We were lucky enough to get a room leading onto the Paradise pool, with the swim-up bar. Delightful. And the room service pizzas are fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “A sophisticated hotel with some rough edges”
Reviews.Author: adanacsim
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with beautiful grounds and, on the surface, a very sophisticated place. The reality, however, can be disappointingly less. Starting with the staff: since the grounds of the hotel are especially pretty we asked the registration desk clerk for a room with a nice view and she assured us that the one she had for us had a great view. When we got to the room we found that it overlooked the hotel laundry, a road and a fence (some people must have curious taste when it comes to views). When we complained to a different desk clerk, he took matters into his own hands and upgraded us to a lovely suite overlooking the Paradise pool. Similarly, the waiter who served us our first breakfast was especially accommodating, going over to the (more expensive) cafe to get us some food that was not presently available in the restaurant. The next morning our different waiter was so clueless and useless (how hard is it to bring over coffee and toast?) that we decided to eat outside the hotel after that (try the adjoining golf club restaurant -- it's much better and cheaper). Finally, there were several conventions in the hotel and it was very noisy and very crowded in the public spaces, which clashed with the natural beauty of the hotel and its grounds.
