Bottom line is if you're lucky and get the right people to attend to your needs, and if the hotel is not so crowded, you're very likely to enjoy your stay. If not, in view of the cost of staying at this luxury hotel, you're not so likely to be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: sedonadweller
Reviews.Content: Sky Harbour Airport closed for light rain conditions late(10:PM) on the 21st of January. No rooms were to be found anywhere in Phoenix. The kind Desk Manager at the AZ Biltmore listened to our desperate needs and opened an important room for our brief stay that evening. Their courteous actions will make my decision to book the Biltmore in the future a definite gaurrantee! Thank you, Desk Girls and all, including security people, for a well needed rest I will always remember! Bill and Dorie!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lajasha
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, spacious rooms, elegant restaurants with great food and, perhaps best of all, amazing pools. Even though I was there on business, I felt really relaxed after my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Super Chef”
Reviews.Author: lindamkz
Reviews.Content: I would like to compliment Chef Todd Sicolo on his excellent culinary delights as well as his delightful personality. I was at the Biltmore on a business conference where over 600 people were fed at the same time. The food was always hot or cold as required, presentation was beautiful, taste was excellent and variety was always a pleasant surprise! The staff always went above and beyond to see to our every request. Linda Alumbaugh, Baton Rouge, LA

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lousy prices”
Reviews.Author: HankF99
Reviews.Content: Grounds, gardens, pools, everything is immaculate and interesting. My room was a bit dated but pretty good, certainly a comfortable bed but ancient shower, very ancient heating/cooling system. A few issues, one they ruined a suit jacket during dry cleaning (button gone and sleeve lining torn) and two they charged (without warning) $32 for (literally) a 5 mile ride in car service (after refusing to call for a cab as I requested). Oh yeah - it was $32 each WAY, which I discovered after the fact. (Arguably, I should have asked, but assumed it would be reasonable). All high end resorts are money pits and this one no different, I suppose, at least you have really sweet setting and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tomdenverDenverCO
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore hotel is a wonderful place. The buildings are beautiful and the grounds are very well maintained. The feeling of the place is of seclusion and luxury. The design is very comfortable, if you are a fan of great design you will love all the great details and beauty of the buildings. The food was very good and the service and staff were all excellent. The rooms are nice but a touch on the simple side-in keeping with hotels design. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really unique and wonderful place. An American Icon - check web for deals”
Reviews.Author: runningpie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Paid 99 dollars from a web deal. Was upgraded to a villa suite for free. That was the most insane bargain ever. Should have flown my family in. Basically a lux one bedroom apartment with my own access to one of the many pools. Just about as nice as a person could want. I believe my rate was 90% off book. Anyway the rest of the place is just glorious - especially if you like old-time American resorts. The architecture is awesome the grounds are rambling and wonderful. Can't say enough. Great stuff for kids - a club, playground, water slide, etc., while tons of sophistication for adults. By comparison I had some meetings at the Boulders and looked around. I would rather stay at the Biltmore in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Architectural eye candy with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: tachyonbb
Reviews.Content: Amazing architectural detail combined with a first rate staff makes any stay here an enjoyable if expensive experience. The tense atmosphere of today's world washes away into relaxed comfort when you enter this oasis. Make the time to take the history tour, it is worth it. Walk the grounds at night and appreciate the wonderful subdued lighting. In addition to above average rates, there is a daily "resort fee". Room service is exorbitant and even soft drinks/water are very expensive. So plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “The Biltmore is more than a resort.”
Reviews.Author: pjtutt
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Biltmore several times it is always a pleasure to return. You are always treated as if you are family returning for the holidays. We just spent the New Years weekend at the Biltmore and would like to mention that we were very pleased with everything from the time we arrived until we departed. From the help we received from the concierge's desk ( especially Jordan ), Rhonda's wonderful personality in Wright's bar ( her personal attention is unsurpassed ), Chef Todd Sicolo's personal advise to our teenage son who whats to enter the culinary field and best of all Nate Anseth ( Villa and Ocatilla Executive Lounge Manager) personal help in arranging our reservations. They are all the best. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection under the sun”
Reviews.Author: PRexec
Reviews.Content: Picture this. The sky is a deep blue, the air is fresh and crisp, the sun is coming up over the mountain and you're sitting in front of a roaring outdoor fire eating oatmeal and sipping Starbucks coffee. That's how every morning started when my husband and I spent four glorious nights at the Arizona Biltmore. We're huge Frank Lloyd Wright fans, so staying in this Wright-inspired Arizona landmark made it all the more fun-- and impressive. The hotel offers free 90-minute history tours where you can learn lively and facts about the Biltmore during its early years. Our tour guide, Laura (who works in accounting) was terrific. We were lucky to stay in one of the cottages original to the hotel which, although 80 years old, were beautifully renovated, spacious, and absolutely charming. There are many other room options that seem equally appealing, including a stay in the original hotel with its magnificent architecture, decor, and appointments. Everywhere you look, there's something to feast your eyes on-- from the magnificent back-lit stained glass panel at the hotel entrance to the signature Biltmore blocks gracing every building. No decent review would be complete without commenting on the food at the Biltmore. The new Frank & Albert's casual restaurant offered delicious and creatively prepared fare at a good price. You could spend your entire hotel stay dining at the hotel and we practically did! Really, there didn't seem any reason to try other restaurants-- the food at the Biltmore was that good (not often the case with other hotels). The staff at the Biltmore were friendly and helpful. From the extremely courteous and friendly desk staff and concierges to the hardworking housekeeper who cleaned our windows every day (yes, she actually wiped down the glass panes inside and out), the people couldn't have been nicer. The restaurant staff was courteous and well-mannered, providing A+ service at every meal. If this review sounds a bit gushy, that's because I'm truly in love with the Biltmore as a place to stay in Phoenix. As much as I love trying new hotels, it will be hard to resist coming back to the Biltmore time and time again. I'm confident they'll be around offering impeccable service in a charming historic setting for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: steve9000
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. The hotel was mostly designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and it is beautifully landscaped. The rooms are pretty much what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. It has seven beautiful pools. On the minus side, food so-so and expensive, coffee 5 bucks a cup, they have a $25 "resort" charge on top the advertised price. There are quite a few good restaurants within 10 minutes drive and I would recommend checking them out.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations on every level”
Reviews.Author: LynnDVancouver
Reviews.Content: Choose the Biltmore because of it's history, was a little worried that the rooms may reflect in the age of the building. Our entire family was impressed at the blend of the rich history(make sure you take the history tour offered by the hotel) and modern amenities were presented. The rooms were modern, newly refurbished, spacious with extremely comfortable beds, huge granite BR with 4 shower head showers and soaker tub. The 8 swimming pools were clean, warm and beautiful.. Stayed in the Octilla building, which provided breakfast, snacks, appetizers and dessert, great value and well worth it for a family. The staff were outstanding in their helpfulness and friendliness. Will be coming back for future stays in Phoenix, well located in the city, but no need to leave the grounds, which are immaculate and stunning! It lived up to its name of "Jewel of the Desert"

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dimed to Death”
Reviews.Author: Philigirl
Reviews.Content: I spent Christmas at the Biltmore and it was nice. I've been there twice before while on business and wanted my boyfriend to experience what made me love the place. The staff is always very nice and I am always placed in spacious rooms and even upgraded. The place has a lot of history, interesting decor, and is very conducive for relaxation. It was cold (50's F) so we did not use the pools or jacuzzi but they looked very inviting. What I don't like about the Biltmore is how they nickel and dime you for everything. Everyday you pay a resort fee charge, you pay to park, for room service there is a delivery fee, a service charge fee, and I believe the tip is taken out. One morning and the only morning that I ordered breakfast in it costs $85.00 for 2.The next day we had an earlier morning tour and stopped in the cafe for 2 coffees and 1 croissant which costs around 16.00 (huh?) I really don't mind spending money, however, the Biltmore is just a bit ridiculous. You kinda feel stupid when you get the bill. I like being able to travel the world and I can do so because I watch the pennies. I don't know if I'll be going back. I would still recommend because it is something to experience just be sure to spend your money off the property.

Reviews.Title: “Two star service at five star price”
Reviews.Author: stevem9999
Reviews.Content: Service was poor, not what we expect from a Hilton Waldorf collection hotel. Rather than cite all the examples, let's just say we cut our stay short and left a day early.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful people in beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: ind_sub
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay for the ASBA Annual meeting. Staff was very helpful and always ready to give directions or take us to our destinations. Felt like we got away from Arizona for a couple days.

Reviews.Title: “First class staff in a first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: eancel
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the elegant and beautiful Arizona Biltmore. Our rooms were clean, well equipped, and quiet. Best of all is the staff, especially the security staff. A few hours after checking out, I remembered, in a panic, leaving my jewelry in the room safe. The security staff, in particular David and Joel, kept in touch with me until they were able to retrieve my jewelry without intruding on the privacy of the new guest in that room. The staff is first class as is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, friendly, amazing architecture!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFool93436
Reviews.Content: Stunning grounds against rugged desert peaks, exquisite Frank Lloyd Wright inspired architecture, and 5-star service made our visit very pleasant. The rooms are a tad on the small side by modern luxury standards, but adequate and very nicely appointed. The towels are delightfully soft! I would have liked to have a coffee maker in the room, although there seem to be plenty of breakfast options on the grounds. Concierge Kevin was attentive, helpful and friendly, as was all the staff I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleJoeZ
Reviews.Content: Great choice for family vacation with grown children, but probably great with younger children too. The all inclusive Octilla is well worth it. The food was excellent and the head chef was very attentive to our daughter's food allergies. He called multiple times to check on things and visited our table regularly as well. The facility is gorgeous, and is a classic built in the 30's but entirely updated and perfectly maintained. There are lots of available activities on site as well as in the area. And it is within driving distance of the Grand Canyon, which is obviously amazing.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: 1sarina
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this fantastic resort. The staff was terrific, cordial and so helpful. We stayed at the Ocatilla within the Biltmore Resort they have an executive lounge that caters to the Ocatilla guest were from 6:30 am till 9 pm they have continuous offering throughout the day (breakfast, light snacks, beverage and sweets). and access to a computer station. We were treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing combination of location, food, price, and service.”
Reviews.Author: ronchefdoc
Reviews.Content: This was a thoroughly enjoyable visit, from start to finish. The surroundings are magnificent: an oasis in the middle of the Sonoran Desert. The staff was incredibly knowledgeable about the hotel the area. Do not miss the historic tour of the hotel. A side trip to Taliesen West is a must. The food at the hotel is superb. However, if you tire of that, the concierge is able to recommend a plethora of tasty alternatives, ranging from the relatively inexpensive (although trendy and incredibly lively) Cowboy Ciao's, to the extremely upscale Donovan's Steakhouse and Mastro's. My preference is the hotel's delightful outside dining, fire pits, and wonderfully accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: rickh59
Reviews.Content: Extremely nice place to stay but very expensive. Room was spacious with a shared balcony.

Reviews.Title: “First class property with grounds and food exceptional”
Reviews.Author: AssociationLead
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to airport and travel is made very easy. Hotel is world class with the grounds and the food five star. Rooms are just ok but how much time are you in them anyway? Golf course is average to below average in our opinion. Real golfers will want to go off property. We had over 350 business people there for a meeting and the staff was top notch, with Jeremy leading the team and the one you should ask for. Scott the chef was outstanding and very creative. Hospitality at its best!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jogger824
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was great. The service we received was perfect. The rooms were modern and very comfortable. The happy hour in the executive lounge was incredibly generous. The food, wine and fire pit made it for a great place to have a drink before dinner. The only critique I have is that the spa itself was a bit dated, however that didn't reflect on the quality of the spa services. We had facials and massages and we were all very pleased with the treatments we received.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic event experience”
Reviews.Author: fun4everybody
Reviews.Content: My work hosted an event at the Biltmore and the staff and hotel went above and beyond not only to make sure that my company had what it needed to make the event successful but to make sure that the guests who attended the event, had a pleasant, enjoyable and memorable experience. This is why we have continued to host our events at the Biltmore for the past 6 years and will continue to into the future!

Reviews.Title: “best services”
Reviews.Author: nsfrank
Reviews.Content: having just returned from a long weekend at the arizona biltmore i would sum up my experience by saying it was fabulous. from the food to the accommodations in ocatilla to the spa services and the staff, our stay was one of the best experiences. the spa itself could use a facelift as it looks old and worn, but the services and professionalism of the staff are some of the best that i've experienced. the staff in general were very helpful, curteous and follow-up on all requests. the new octilla rooms were spacious and spotless and the services that go along with the accommodations were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Historic but better for a visit not a stay”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an interesting example of Frank Lloyd Wright architecture. But its more like a museum so go for a walk round. In in terms of staying there overnight it is just not that attractive. Low ceilings and small windows that don't show the views - typical FLW trademarks. The rooms are large but but a average and the pools aren't great too. There are much nicer hotels in Phoenix for the price. Small and terribly expensive restaurant - had to drive to the nearby mall for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “OMG - Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: haynathrt
Reviews.Content: That pretty much sums up our 3 night stay 10/30-11/1/09 at the Arizona Biltmore to celebrate my husbands 53 birthday. The room was large and nicely furnished and decorated with a comfy bed with plush linens. The property is gorgeous - large, open, airy and clean - beautiful. Some reviews say it is too spread out - we disagree. It is spacious which keeps the resort from feeling crowded. The swimming pools are great - no matter which of the 7 you choose to enjoy. The spa treatment (couples massage in the outdoor cabana) was very nice and we had use of the spa and fitness facilities throughout our stay. LOVED, LOVED, LOVED our dinner at Wright's - and lunch at the Cabana Cafe at the pool was delicious. Cocktails outside in the lounge area was a highlight of a perfect evening with the cozy fire bowls and the fountain in the yard. The history of the Biltmore is the best part - - it takes you back to a time and place of yesteryear that makes you feel like a VIP. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “History and Pool”
Reviews.Author: dfkk
Reviews.Content: Price - US $250, double Cleanliness - excellent. Quietness - very good. Comfort - very good. Location - excellent. Friendliness - excellent. Breakfast - none. Classiness - fantastic history. Room included - shower, bath, TV - no coffee making. Big room and lots of pools.

Reviews.Title: “***** Excellence”
Reviews.Author: slmpas
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Arizona Biltmore was an excellent experience. The entire staff offered outstanding service, fantastic meals, and superb accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service that exceeded many fine hotels' service level.”
Reviews.Author: Maribeth
Reviews.Content: From the first evening, when I required a special meal at a large business function, due to Celiac Disease, the staff at the Arizona Biltmore proved that hospitality is not dead. Kathy Day and John the Catering Manager had a special gluten-free meal prepared that was delicious and beautiful ...and they provided it with a smile. Kathy then returned a jacket I left at the dinner to my room. Nisveta, a member of the housekeeping staff, delivered articles I'd inadvertently left behind to the second room I inhabited, due to my business travel turning to pleasure travel, with my husband and son arriving. And Travis at the front desk made that transfer seamless. Olga, the concierge, beckoned Nathan, the notary public, when we needed an item notarized. Nathan made a "house call" to our room, with his stamp, since my son was not feeling well and needed to sign some documents. Just an unbelievable level of service, delivered by happy employees. A pleasure, in beautiful surroundings!! THANK YOU. We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “It couldn't get any better.”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAzmom
Reviews.Content: Thank you AZ Biltmore. My daughter's wedding was absolutely perfect thanks to your resort, especially the staff. Down to every detail this was the absolutely best choice for hosting wedding guests, taking pictures, having fun and eating some amazing food. Don't pass up an opportunity to look into the Biltmore as your choice for any event you might be considering. Be sure to ask for Debbie in event planning...she was amazing. Kudos to the Biltmore for having her on their staff. THANKS!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Shawnee45
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to thank Dan Bauman for his above and beyond service during my most recent visit to the Biltmore. As always everything was amazing, but his personal and courteous service deserved an additional thank you!

Reviews.Title: “An historic hotel and a very comfortable resort.”
Reviews.Author: DCAttorneyMcLean_VA
Reviews.Content: I stay here every year on business and the resort has been consistent over the years. The architecture and history of the place are fascinating. The resort amenities are nice if you like that sort of lay-around vacation, but nothing exceptional. I strongly recommend the new rooms in the Ocatilla Wing. The rooms in the main building can be much too loud, and some of the other rooms can be a little worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, wonderful grounds for entire family to enjoy!!!”
Reviews.Author: dexymama
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel, and would definitely come back again! The staff was kind and the service was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “High class elegance”
Reviews.Author: kymbir
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at the Biltmore last month for my birthday and wanted to let everyone know it was absolutely perfect. Stayed in the newly rennovated Ocatilla Wing. This was high class luxury at it's best. A private concierge made several dinner and spa reservations for us, answered questions about surrounding sites of interest and catered to our every need. We were always greeted with a smile and despite the number of guests that must be staying there, the concierge staff never forgot our name and/or room number. The private Ocatilla lounge was luxurious with delicious continental breakfast, all day coffee, tea, iced tea and lemonade as well as a specialty coffee machine which made excellent latte and cappucino. The grounds are immaculate. I cannot imagine how many staff are part of the gardening crew but not a leaf was out of place. We took the time to visit each pool and espeically enjoyed the paradise pool and the history of the catalina pool. You can definitely imagine Marilyn Monroe sunning herself here. Unfortuantely while we were there, Wright's restaurant was closed for rennovation, however, the new Frank and Albert's had much cullinary fare to keep us well fed and wanting to come back for more. Needless to say this was a fantastic birthday celebration at a hotel that blends history, architectural significance and detail as well as luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Refined experience with service excellence - without complexity or conceit.”
Reviews.Author: travelhoundcanadian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Oct. 11-17 2009 as a leisure customer. The physical draw to this property is obviously compelling. Anyone who understands the background of this hotel, knows the architectural history and lore. Not only does the careful preservation of this unique aspect deliver - the unpretentious prestine flavour of the grounds creates an atmosphere that I have yet to experience at any other reseort - and I have been to over 50 resorts. The physical product remains consistent with the over physical nature of the property. Well, thought out attention to detail without the intensity. A few areas of wear and tear expose some cracks in the walking concrete paths around the resort. Probably a tough thing to keep up, but it is noticeable in comparison with the prestine feel of the grounds. I stayed at the "hotel within the hotel" - the Octatilla experience. For me, as an experienced traveller, this is worth the upgrade. The room design feels like a 500+ square room with the best bed in the hotel world. The sleek, slim TV wall mount, great desk working area, and plenty of storage all well designed to leave lots of floor space for a very open feeling room. The Octatilla bathroom contains his/her sinks with plenty of counter space (I did not travel with my wife, but I know she would have appreciated the counter space), nice soaker tub, complete with "Zen" bath salts and a separate stand up shower. To top off the physical ambience I was lucky enough to have my own small terrace. With 90 degree weather every day, the terrace was a great feature. The hallways were well lit and aesthetically pleasing - again without the intensity or the "trying to hard" element of say W hotels or some other resorts. The room product was very clean. The Octatilla comes with access to an executive lounge. The physical space here is once again well thought out and designed. A great blend of outside terrace seating (with standard tables and relaxing cushioned seating) mixes with inside board room tables, comfy living room sofas and also restaurant style seating. Two LCD panel TVs which help add to the atmosphere without the sense of intrusiveness. The lighting and decor makes me want to take a lesson in design! The lounge also has two computers and can be used for printing and boarding pass documentation. Octatilla also has a more private pool that literally sucked the stress right out of me. Day beds, regular loungers and Cabanas all available and easily accessible. Service- While the physical product is extremely compelling, the service experience what among the most genuine I have ever seen. Somehow the culture of this hotel transcends beyond the Waldorf Astoria expectation. The service staff seem genuinely happy to work there. The staff in the Octatilla executive lounge absolutely made my stay a memorable experience. They seemed genuinely interested in me and what I needed...again without a sense of intensity or insincerity. In fact, the day prior to my check out, they took the iniative to call my room and inquire what arrangements I required to better assist the departure process. The food offering at the executive lounge was quite substantial with a very healthy breakfast offering (important to me), and unique and creative evening hors doeuvres. They supplied some nuts and snacks in bowls throughout the lounge. The only thing I would suggest here is that I saw bare hands of other guests go into the bowls - yikes! The centre piece lounging area of the resort faces camelback mountain. The seating design and atmosphere set here was quite enjoyable. I had dinner here two nights. The ambience was unmatched with the firepit conversation areas and glow lighting. However, I would suggest offering a slightly more extended food offering in this area, although I appreciate that the intent is to have a lounge offering. The main pool was also quite stunning physically and I liked the layout. The daybed and casita rental appear tempting, but I didn't see any users. The food service staff was exceptional, but I also wish a slightly more extensive food offering was available. The main dining restaurant was closed, but looked quite interesting to eat it. The most pleasant surprise of this resort overall was the refined, unpretentious service matched with the unique but also unpretentious design and feel. I will bring my family back for the adventure experiences (hikes, mountain biking and lots of yoga). The fitness area is among the best I have seen for upscale resorts and clearly was not an afterthought. Free weights, lots of cardio and plenty of room in this well naturally lit facility made working out easy. One can also do some laps in one of the many pools. I am running out of room for more detail on the service package, but I will conclude by commenting on the location. Easy access from the airport, to sporting events and to some of the Scottsdale night life. I would return to this resort with my family, but I would also consider using some of the hotel's very unique and cool meeting space for business meetings. See you again Arizona Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “excellent high end hotel”
Reviews.Author: weakglovehand
Reviews.Content: a beautiful well appointed classic hotel. the grounds are very well cared for and are worth the price of admission. the food is all top quality and expertly prepared. wait staff is equal or better than what you'd expect from a top line cruise ship. you will spend alot of money here, but this is a high quality hotel, and there is a definate value in the expense.

Reviews.Title: “80-year-old desert beauty still a gem!”
Reviews.Author: MKM10023
Reviews.Content: A class act all the way. Superior accommodations and gracious staff made our all-too-brief stay totally memorable. Gorgeous grounds, terrific lobby and common areas, fantastic pool & spa, glorious history, etc. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “great ....we had an amazing time ...thank you”
Reviews.Author: alizaNy
Reviews.Content: we had an amazing time ...staff was great ,I would like to nominate certain staff members at the biltmore. 1-cara langley-amazing.....soooo nice and helpful.we oved her. 2-lana khoury-great job at the saon 3-carol ford-sooo nice,helpful,sooo sweet 4-leo despot-sooo helpful,so sweet 5-carolyn-ocatilla concierge-soooo sweet,so helpful,very professional,very helpful 6-hollie-seating hostess-so sweet,very helpful. we had an amazing time... Thanks for a great vacation

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WallyC2
Reviews.Content: The service, location, and overall feel and sense of history that this property combines make anyone that stays here feel special. We were lucky enough to get a corner room with a HUGE outdoor balcony, and it was a fabulous trip! We love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of History in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flagstaff0
Reviews.Content: The history of this hotel makes it a unique place to stay. Every president since Herbert Hoover (excepting Barack Obama) has stayed here. Wrights, the leading restaurant at the hotel, was closed when we stay. We ate at another restaurant on the premises. Food was good, though I wouldn't say excellent. Drinks were pricey. The bar area is elegant and outside firepits make for cozy spaces at night. The room we were in was spacious, though more elegant rooms are available throughout Phoenix and Scottsdale. Check out the Wrigley Mansion while staying at the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place but we were treated poorly.”
Reviews.Author: evieryland
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay here for vacation. The architecture and grounds are just unbelievably beautiful. I finally got the opportunity but was so disappointed in the quality of the amenities in the room. The furniture needed to be refinished and although we were told we had a great room with a view- the view was blocked by a giant bush and it was a far walk from the main hotel. Also the staff was very unconcerned about making our stay pleasant and even (embarrassingly) yelled for security on my husband when he lost his key and was knocking on our door. They actually asked him if he was sure he "belonged" in the hotel. There are too many smaller complaints I won't get into but when we were checking out, the front desk agent asked me how our stay was, and when I replied "Less than satisfactory:" She simply said "Oh, I'm sorry to hear that." and handed me my receipt. Perhaps she hears that response often. I wish I could say nice things about this place, because it is so beautiful, so I have to recommend that you visit it and take pictures of the architecture and gardens, but don't stay here- especially if you are looking to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hollywood Style in the middle of a giant strip mall”
Reviews.Author: taifei1220
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is a beautiful old Frank Llyod Wright-esque hotel with many different buildings. The lobby is dark with dark wood and furnishings but pretty. Rooms are clean. The queen beds looked more like full beds, but comfortably slept two women each. Our bathtub didn't drain, but they sent someone immediately to fix so it was just a minor inconvenience. The pool is beautiful and the padded pool chairs were great.

Reviews.Title: “The best family friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ssaa0919
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Builtmore on several occasions. There is always something for kids to do. My kids love the smores outside, movies by the pool, the play room and the outdoor playground was great for my 2 year old! I dont feel like I am a bother when we need something. The staff is awesome! We will continue to stay here for years to come. I would reccommend to anyone with younger kids.

Reviews.Title: “Love the classic beauty in the desert.”
Reviews.Author: CindyCLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here on and off for business since March and not only does the staff greet me personally by name every time I walk in the door, but they accommodate all of my sometimes demanding requests. We have used the property for meeting space, catering and business dinners and each event is done with perfection. I've also had time to use the spa and all of the recreation facilities and the amenities are all beautiful. The classic Frank Lloyd Wright building really sets this hotel apart from your typical Arizona resort. And the staff here really goes out of their way to make you feel special. I've have valets deal with broken down Avis cars of mine personally! Where else does that happen?!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Biltmore!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerAZ
Reviews.Content: Drive in with my attorney friend as a passenger to the valet in front of the resort. As the valet was opening my door I was moving my I-Touch to the center console of my car (just to be safe). Upon leaving Wrights restaurant, which was way overpriced for the quality of the food our group received, my friend and I want back to the valet to retrieve my vehicle. After tipping the valet a generously and getting ready to drive away, I opened my center console only to find my I-Touch and cash missing. After and hour of searching my vehicle and filling out a report with the valet manager, I was told that the hotel would make things right with me. After having to file a second claim from Hilton's fraud department, I was told that they would check into the claim and respond within 4-6 weeks. Again, as you could imagine, I was not pleased about their readiness to address the problem. 6 weeks to the date of the claim, I receive a form letter denying my claim, saying that Hilton Hotels is not responsible for any damages or theft . On my behalf, my attorney friend contacted the General Manager of the Biltmore. After another lengthy conversation with management, he was told that either he or I would be contacted the following business day to resolve this matter. That call never came. I feel that the Arizona Biltmore no longer cares about their valued guests. They have lost my future business!

Reviews.Title: “The Arizona Biltmore truly understands customer service!”
Reviews.Author: SkiSandpoint
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Arizona Biltmore for 4 days as an exhibitor at a nutrition conference. Our company was hosting a breakfast and speaker one of the mornings as well as exhibiting at the conference. The Biltmore catering staff greeted us upon arrival, worked with me make sure all final arrangements were to our satisfaction and checked back during and at the end of the conference to make sure all was satisfactory. Due to an ankle injury that needed daily therapy, I asked to be upgraded to an area near the spa and pool and my wishes were accommodated with a room immediately outside the spa. My every need was met, seemingly without even having to ask. My room was very nice with a patio outside. The bed was comfortable, the desk excellent for work purposes, and I even received a fruit basket and the Biltmore's famous box of truffles from the catering staff I was working with. The Biltmore is a beautiful property, and although I understand some guest rooms are dated, mine was great and I had no complaints. The restaurants and cafe' food is very expensive so having a car to go elsewhere is helpful. The Biltmore is one of the nicest resorts I've ever stayed at and is without a doubt, second to none in customer service. The pool is awesome and was a very relaxing place to take a break when not working. Kudos to the Biltmore staff for truly understanding the meaning of customer service!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: FemaleBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and was in one of the Ocatila rooms. This resort is spread out with different buildings and Ocatila is their club-class offering. There is a wonderful lounge there with friendly staff and lovely food throughout the day - I would recommending upgrading for this alone as it was so comfortable. I did not have much time to lounge around the pools, but each building has their own pool and there is one larger main pool. The individual pools seem to be quieter and well maintained. I dined in their new restaurant, which does not seem to be featured on their webiste, called Frank & someone?? It was pretty informal, but the food was good I had dinner there and breakfast. For dinner I actually had a couple of starters and this was ample, but I am used to smaller portions. Overall a really lovely hotel and great place to return to for a relaxing evening after busy working days.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service especially at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: re21
Reviews.Content: Our waiter, Thomas Burns, was the most curteous and considerate waiter my colleague and I had waiting on us. He went above and beyond and exceeded our expectations.I truly belive that Thomas should be the example and the perfect ideal in these issues that all perspective wokers shoul strive to emulate.He is a valuable asset to this Hotel and obviously should go very far in his carreer because of his humble inteligence and people skills....respectively submitted....Rene St.Laurent rph/dnm/ccn Tiverton, R.I.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a lot to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: BereniceGilbert_AZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had a weekend getaway here and were very disappointed! The hotel staff was neither friendly nor helpful. The food/drinks were way overpriced. We booked a couples massage and my husband was uncomfortable at how small the waiting lounge was. There were about 20 of us crammed in a room that only seated about 5! Then they took us back to our massage which was in a normal guest room set up with 2 massage tables. To top it all off we could here housekeeping vaccuming and roomservice while we tried to relax during the massage!!! Never again will we stay here. I highly recommend the Hyatt at Gainey Ranch or the JW Marriott Desert Ridge. The JW Marriott is by far the best stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice amenities, nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: ahkeela
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and two little ones. We booked the "all inclusive" package, which included dinner-we ate at The Wright restaurant, which was absolutely delicious and one of the best dinners we've had. Service was excellent! Package also included lunch and we chose to eat poolside, again, food was amazing and service was great. Upon checking in, we were given a room that was nice, and we began to unpack. I put my young daughter on the bed and as I began to unpack, I noticed something run across the bed. I called my husband over and we moved the covers to find a very large spider! I asked him to grab a glass and cover it, and I called the front desk. The person at the front desk (I can't remember his name but think it was T---) was very nice and offered to have the room sprayed. I did not want to be in a small hotel room, with my young children, where chemicals would be sprayed and my youngest did not want to get back on the bed after that so I asked if we could move us to another room. We were moved to room 6118 with a view of the pool. Our package included access to the Ocatilla lounge, which was very nice. The appetizers were wonderful, as was the desserts, and breakfast selections. Some of the staff in the lounge seemed either tired, or unhappy to be there. I was able to get a massage at the spa which was really really nice. The massage therapist was great and the spa facility is very nice! The pools and grounds are all really nice, one of the pools was very packed but it was an August weekend. The Ocatilla pool was much quieter. Overall a nice stay and definitely worth it with the all inclusive package.

Reviews.Title: “What a night!!”
Reviews.Author: Mesagal13
Reviews.Content: I live in the valley but decided to get away for a night of relaxation with my girlfriends. I'm so glad we decided to stay at the Biltmore in one of their Villa Suites! Not only was the pool amazing, there was so much room in our Villa that we never had to leave the hotel! Also, a HUGE thank you to Curtis who took care of getting us to our room along with any other requests we had! The next time we need to "get away" we'll definitely look to the Biltmore!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great architecture. Great food. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: MJMLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the AZ Biltmore many times, but the new management is stepping up their game. The Ocatilla Club in the former Arizona Wing offers a club lounge, continental breakfast, snacks, appetizers, cocktails and dessert as part of their package. Also, the deal included lunch and dinner at either Wright's or Frank and Albert's. Frank and Alberts occupies a beautiful new Frank Lloyd Wright inspired dining room that is New York hip and more casual than Wright's. Exec chef Todd Sicolo has done wonders. Everything from the food to the menu text to the plating has an architectural bent. The wait staff was unbelievably gracious and the new restaurant had only been open a handful of days. But it ran like a well oiled machine. Be sure to try: the duck fat poached French Fries (insanely good), Fallingwater cocktail (refreshing and sophisticated), the four flights of mini sundaes (a child's delight built for adults), the vanilla ice box cake, the fried chicken (amazingly moist), the Waldorf Salad (a great reinterpretation of the classic) and FAB pizza with a crispy semolina flour crust that brings to mind Nancy Silverton's pizza here in LA a Pizzeria Mozza. A great stay and wonderful service in an architectural masterwork. Pools for kids, cocktails for adults, golf and tennis nearby, privacy if you want it. The management now needs to work on the spa and gym to bring them up to the level of the restaurants, lobby and rehabbed rooms in the Ocatilla Club. We took a group of historians and architects here two years ago for a conference and they are still talking about their stay at the AZ Biltmore. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “We had wonderfully relaxing time at an amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagotoArizona
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went for Labor Day weekend and stayed in the new Ocatilla wing with its own concierge floor and very spacious and beautiful newly redone rooms. Were were also fortunate that the new resturaunt "Frank & Alberts" recently opened. The atmoshphere is wonderful and new menu and food was fantastic. I have been back several times to the resturaunt alone. On Sat. afternoons at the pool bar they have a fun salsa experience. However, even more important was the service. There was not one person we encountered that did not make us feel special and isn't that why people take a weekend off to get away, relax and feel special? This resort is so full of charm & history - you must experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: kvw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June while my husband went on a boys trip back east. I was here for 6 nights, and wished I could have stayed for much longer - it was amazing! As a Hilton silver member, I was given an upgrade when I arrived, and was given a room near the back of the resort. I had some friends who were also staying there and moved the next night to be by the main pool. I got this AMAZING suite overlooking the pool with an enormous balcony. The location was rather remote, but they provide a shuttle to the Biltmore mall, which we went to a few times for great shopping and ate there a few times as well. I ate breakfast in the restaurant a few times, the food was good (but the restaurant was VERY quiet!). Dinner was also very good. The gym was amazing! We ran on the treadmills every day, and there were plenty of cardio machines. The gym was spacious, and staff at the front desk were always helpful. The resort was very clean, well kept up. The pool and resort have set the bar so high for me now, it will be hard to find a place as beautiful as this one (in North America). I found it completely relaxing, which was exactly why I went. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone, and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: frankolizeth
Reviews.Content: I spend three nights at the Biltmore over Labor Day weekend. I had the most amazing time. This hotel is absolutely beautiful. It has beautiful gardens, undescribable architecture, and a historical importance that I have yet to see anywhere else in Arizona. I was fortunate enough to book the all inclusive acatilla package. The accomodations were excellent. What I enjoyed the most was having access to the executive lounge. They provided breakfast, complimentary appetizers and alcoholic drinks as well as deserts. In addition, I was able to eat at Frank and Alberts restaurant. This restaurant just opened with a new menu featuring organic entrees. The food was delicious! My husband and my two young boys had an amazing time. I recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates history, rich architecture, and the best pools in town. The hotel staff were very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, historic venue and overall a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: dwrkvr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a week at the Biltmore in Phoenix, Arizona. Our first contact was with the desk personnel and concierge. The front desk people were genuinely happy and seemed to enjoy their jobs. After checking in and with my wife due to arrive in less than seven hours the concierge in the main lobby found a florist and birthday flowers and roses for the airport were delivered with time to spare. The rest of the week was spent in the newly renovated Ocatilla wing with a separate concierge staff. During the week they handled several reservations for dinner, hot air ballon ride, and tours of local attractions. In seven days at this hotel we NEVER met an employee that didn't go out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. I would recommend the historical tour of the hotel itself. We plan on returning again. Best experience in years.

Reviews.Title: “Always pleasant to go and great service”
Reviews.Author: Chicago60604
Reviews.Content: We were recently at the Biltmore for a night and for a special birthday dinner for a relative. the biltmore has beautiful grounds, is wonderfully kept up and is exceptionally pleasant and relaxing-even in the heat of August. When my bag did not quite make it to Phoenix with me, the staff made a very special trip to get the bag at the airport so i would have it before the dinner that night. It was above and beyond the call of duty but was also done with true helpfulness. The food and the service at the dinner that night (for 14) were very special, exceptionally good, and very nicely served with consideration of the pacing of the function. We have done this before at the hotel and the biltmore has never disappointd.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aerolosangeles
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is the ultimate classic hotel in Phoenix. Worth the stay for the architecture and history if nothing else. The rooms and beds are comfortable, pools are great and there are a lot of them to choose from, though the food is so so. (though in my experience it's typical of phoenix in general) The grounds are very well tended, even if you do wonder how much of the colorado river it takes to keep that green expanse of lawn in the desert!

Reviews.Title: “Experience could not have been better...(unless it was free....)”
Reviews.Author: lsd300
Reviews.Content: Our (twice extended) stay was simply terrific: the physical plant, the food, the service. The concierge service was extra special: Nick, Olga, Becky, Jordan, and Kevin (among others) knew their stuff and shared it with great patience and good humor...all had killer restaurant suggestions. Bailey at the front desk was just great, along with her colleagues. As an architect, I appreciated the building's history (and the tour) and have enthusiastically talked the place up to everyone who will listen.....Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place. Worth it to check it out in the offseason.”
Reviews.Author: Boogie6868
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Phoenix last week for work and have stayed in most of the resorts but never the Biltmore. I really liked this place. It has a ton of character and pretty grounds. The architecture is interesting (and I'm not really into architecture) and the rooms were nice. These compound kind of places are nightmarish for business travel because you're a 10 minute walk from your car. It also makes it a process to get out to go somewhere for dinner, but it was fun to stay somewhere that was different. The staff did a nice job. They weren't as bow and scrape as they are at places like the Ritz but that isn't my thing. There are 8 pools and one is all set up with full service cabanas you can rent. I stayed in a room at the Terrace something which had its own pool that nobody was ever in. Be sure to notice the "resort charge" which was $28/day when I went. I see some people complaining about that but this is still a cheap rate for a great hotel in the off season. No wireless. Food/drink are expensive on site...$17 martinis at the bar. I may not go again just for convenience sake for work but would definitely go for a spa weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: terbergirl
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice stay with comfy rooms, however I was a little disappointed the slide at the main pool closed at 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me- You will get more from a Best Western than this place!”
Reviews.Author: Traybagz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore Aug 5-9 for a work related convention. I have to say that I did not even pay for this trip (company expensed it) and i was still extrememly annoyed at the lack of value for the money spent. Aside from the expensive nightly room charge, you will be surprised to find (when you get your bill the last day) they take it upon themselves to automatically charge you gratuities for every tom, dick, and harry in the hotel- whether you use their services or not (maid, bellman, etc.), so don't bother tipping cash. I would also advise you to look over your bill carefully before you check out. Aside from myself, there seemed to be a long line of others waiting to dispute several bogus charges on their bills. They tried to charge me $18.95 labeled under "mini bar"- I never even touched the mini bar! After complaining at check out they took off the mini bar charge, but would not refund me the "gratuities", even though i explained i had already tipped in cash. They pretty much gave me an "oh well" attitude. The hotel itself (grounds, rooms, pool, etc.) were nice and well maintained- but the resort is extremely big and spread out, so be prepared to walk alot. There are several seating areas throughout the resort, and it was especially nice at night to sit outside with a glass of wine and relax and people watch. There are lots and lots of pools, so you should have no trouble finding one that fits your needs. The pools are also open 24/7, which I thought was nice. The cafe serves starbucks beverages at about $1 more than the regular starbucks price- but they were well made and it was convenient having it there at the resort. The food at the resort is extremly pricy, so for this reason I recommend taking the free shuttle to the biltmore fashion mall and eating at one of the restaurants there. Other than the pool and the gym (which was average at best), be prepared to pay a fee for any activity you would like to participate in. I wanted to mess around on the tennis courts (which were empty my entire stay) and they wanted to charge me $45/hour to play!!! like I said - you get more out of staying at a Best Western!For what they charge to stay here- all activites should be included!! Pheonix itself is pretty boring. The "mountains" looked more like large piles of construction dirt off in the distance. I did head into Scottsdale one evening for dinner, and that semed to be where everyone went for nightlife. Lots of bars and restaurant to choose from. I do have to say that the absolute BEST part of my trip was when I rented a car ($50/day) and drove 2 hours to Sedona!!!! This is an absolute MUST DO if you are in the area!! WOW! Amazingly beautiful! Lots of stuff to do (Slide Rock Park, Chapel of the Holy Cross, Cliff casino, shopping, dining, wine tasting, jeep tours, helicopter tours, sunset watching at the Sedona airport, etc.) I got more out of the few hours I spent in Sedona than the few days I spent in pheonix! IF you are planning a trip to Arizona, I would definitely recommend staying in Sedona. As a matter of fact, I happen to see a few Best Westerns smack in the middle of everything in Sedona surrounded by the gorgeous red rocks (and thats where I'll be staying when I return to this area! Atleast they give you a free breakfast!) I would not recommend this resort. They charge more than they are worth. I have stayed at 2 star resorts and have gotten more than i did here (amenities, atmosphere, etc). save your money and stay in either Scottsdale or Sedona.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: LisaCea
Reviews.Content: Diamond award stay. Booked standard double queen room and was upgraded to Ocatilla. Nice big room with big bathroom, pool view, so far we are impressed. Saturday afternoon pool was PACKED, but we were still able to find seats at the bar and lounges. No problem with towels. Bar menu was good, nice Greek salad, drinks were reasonably priced for a resort. Service at the bar was fine, a chef came out and did a salsa demonstration and gave samples to all who wanted. It was part of the Biltmore's 80th birthday celebration. So far so good..... right? .....not. Two teens we brought were VERY unimpressed witht he water slide and complained of bordom for the entire stay. The dive in movie that was promised and the kids were looking forward to didn't happen. As happy hour rolled around we went to use our key to get into the executive lounge (that is supposed to come with the Ocatilla upgrade) and lo and behold, it won't work. So I make a call to the front desk and was told since we recieved the room upgrade we were not entitled to the executive lounge too. BS! I went to the front desk and had a chat with the supervisor and was given new keys and access to the lounge. We had a glass or two of wine and a few snacks (all accurately described above) and headed back to the pool area for a light dinner. We didn't feel like getting gussied up for the fancy restaurant. Apparently we showed up about 20 minutes before closing time (8PM on a Saturday night!) and the waiter took 15 minutes in an almost empty place (only one other table occupied) to even come offer drinks. We ordered some chicken wings and salads and sandwiches which took another 25 minutes to arrive at our table. The wings were completely burnt to a crisp. My daughter and her boyfriend, both veteran fine dining establishment employees, were agast at both the quality of the food and the service. After a complaint to the server, the wings were taken off the bill, but too little too late. We were offered free dessert too but know better about ordering more food from a kitchen after complaining. You never know what you are going to get Forest. The resort is absolutely beautiful, the grounds, the views, the art and the history are impressive to us as 17 year Arizona residents. Don't waste your money staying or dining there. Maybe it was a skeleton summer crew in Phoenix and the service may be better there in the "season". I'll never go back. If you want to see the place and have a drink at Wrights bar, walk about the property for a few hours, you can get a feel for the place it used to be. Its nothing like that anymore. Very very dissappointing after all the hype.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tamisu
Reviews.Content: Recently my friend and I traveled to Phoenis to stay at the Arizona Biltmore as I had been told the Hotel was fabulous. This was an understatement. The hotel was Beautiful and the service was impeccable. It was probably the best hotel stay i've experienced in a very long time. We hung out by the pool, had gret food at the Cabana Club and The Wright Restaurant, took in the pool views from our exquisite room in the Ocotillo Wing and spent way too much money in the awesome shops. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a great relaxing experience and meet lots of locals. It appears to be the place to go. Also...the beds were so comfy my friend and I didn't want to leave them for the pool...but we did.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: eugene63wisconsin
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the whole experience. The grounds were impecable, the rooms and decor were very impressive. I found the food to equal any 4 to 5 star dinning in my travels. This will be my choice of stay in az.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Flyer9512
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is a fantastic place to stay, regarless of season. The facilities, the staff and the rooms are great. Very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Clear Bed Bugs! Also Very expensive not worth it”
Reviews.Author: ngagedesign
Reviews.Content: My wife & I Stayed and broke out with bed bugs. very bad!!! the only thing they offered was another room or to change the sheets. I wanted a refund considering we were itching the whole time. Also if my wife had not been in a conference there we would not have had stayed. details are as follows: ExcuCab overpriced [--] Sodas $5 (get discount cab to grocery store and buy sodas and lunch items to substitute mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at the Biltmore!!”
Reviews.Author: perezam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore for the first time. The customer service was excellent from the moment we stepped onto the property. The food was excellent and the pool is huge!! The cabanas were spacious and drinks were extra cold! I have stayed in many hotels but this one tops them all. Rooms were very clean and very comfortable. Staff was great!! I recommend this for anyone looking for top notch service!!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: lvnick
Reviews.Content: I have to say from the moment you arrive, the AZ Biltmore shines, from the friendly and helpful outside staff to the food and beverage staff. The food was amazing not only at Wright's restarant, but the pool as well. I would highly recommend the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Fly-Away-PHX
Reviews.Content: I live in Phoenix, and this is my favorite hotel. I booked 3 Nights in their new Ocatilla wing, and REALLY enjoyed it. The entire experience was wonderful, from Scott who checked me in, to Curtis the Bellman who escorted my bags and me to the very nicely appointed room, to Leo and Leon in the private Ocatilla Lounge. I felt like I was a million miles away but still "at home" in the beautiful Frank Lloyd Wright creation. Spa treatments are wonderful and the poolside Cabana Club service was fantastic. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, overpriced, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Badger
Reviews.Content: This was defnitely the worst hotel we had stayed at on our two-week vacation. The resort itself is full of nostalgia and history. The Frank Lloyd Wright architecture is amazing, and the lobby is beautiful. Many famous people have stayed at the resort in the past, but that must be its only selling point today. The room we stayed in was dirty and shabby. The lampshade was frayed, and there was a hunk of wood missing from the closet door. The bathroom had penmarks on the wood around the counter, and there were two different kinds of mildew on the tub grout (the black kind and the slimy pink kind). Ick. On the second day, we actually caught a SCORPION scurrying across the bathroom floor! We put a glass over it and informed the front desk, and were merely told, "My apologies, I will have maintenance remove it." The rest of the stay was spent checking under our beds and in our sheets to make sure there weren't more hiding in our room. There were several pools available, and we spent most of our time in the smaller pools that were away from the main hubbub. The smaller pools were surrounded by broken and faded lounge chairs and had no towels available. They could also use a good scrubbing. The main pool could only be described as community pool meets spring break. There was lots of noise and commotion, small screaming children, and lots of younger couples and singles. It was definitely not an atmosphere conducive to rest and relaxation. Many of the frazzled lounge chairs that were scattered around the pool were reserved for those paying extra for the cabanas, though we only saw a few that were occupied. Towels were hard to find, and at least once we had to wait for them to be replenished. The actual service was the worst part of our stay. It was as if the employees had been instructed NOT to smile at anyone. Upon arrival, we were given a map to our room and a key. No instruction as to the amenities available, location of the pools, spa services available, etc. The first night, we headed to the bar and had to wait forever to be served. The second day, we ended up walking out because no one ever came to serve us (although employees walked back and forth past us several times). They looked busy, but a simple, "I'll be right with you," would have been appreciated. We instead walked next door to the on-site cafe for 3 bottled sodas, 2 beers and a cookie for a total of $40. The employees were odd, with simple requests (extra towels, an extra hotel magazine, etc.) being met with looks ranging from confusion to utter annoyance. As for the area, it was difficult to get in and out of the resort to find restaurants or shopping, even with a GPS. We did find ourselves in a less than desirable part of town several times, and resorted to traveling back to the area in which we stayed at the beginning of our trip (Fairmont Scottsdale--Excellent Review!!). In conclusion, if you are younger and are looking for a place to hang out, but don't have high expectations with regards to service or cleanliness, this place may be acceptable. If you are an adult looking for a clean and comfortable place to relax and get away from it all, stay far, far away from this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull for the whole family, what a blast, did not want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: atnaak
Reviews.Content: My sister and I wanted to visit some where warm! We could'nt take it any longer! Living in Michigan (me) and my sis in Wisconsin we decided it would be AZ. I have heard wonderfull things about the Biltmore Collection and we decided that's where we were going. Wow what a great choice! We went the 1st weekend of May 2009. We spent 3 nights and did not want to leave. There was a good amount of people there and we had a blast! The grounds were outstanding and the views were awesome! More than enough for the our 2 kids to do! (ages 8 and 10). The cost of the food was a little high, but wow did you get a lot! And it was wonderful! Our best part of the trip was the care and service that we received from the staff. We had a blast at the main pool! There is a beautiful swim up bar and lounge area you can sit at, and it does not smell like many resorts that I have been to, very clean! We had a blast at the Salsa Demonstration that was presented by the Chef at pool side. There must of been 8 or more different types he made! I was very impressed at the Frank Llyod Wright architecture. Our room was poolside and what a must have with the kids!! Out the door and away we went, how fun! Please take time to walk around the resort and see everything, it is amazing, but it may take you about 1 to 2 hours to see it all! We were located close to everything we wanted to do out side of the Biltmore, food, shopping and Mt. climbing. We will back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in an Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: budgie-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended our recent vacation in Arizona by staying for three nights at the Arizona Biltmore. We had pre-booked a room in the Ocatilla Club block as this included access to the Concierge Lounge. The hotel takes a little time to adjust to as the architecture is rather unusual and greatly influenced by Frank Lloyd Wright. The block we were in (previously known as the Arizona block) had recently been refurbished and offered really superb accommodation. Everything was new and we had a large HD flat screen LCD TV in the room which was super. The Concierge Lounge was one of the highlights of our stay and Carolyn and her colleagues went out of their way to be friendly and helpful throughout our stay. (They even helped us check in online for our return flights to the UK and printed out our boarding cards as well!). We ate breakfast in the Lounge, could have tea, coffee, or soft drinks all day, complimentary beer and wine, pre-dinner snacks, and post-dinner dessert, all included in the room rate. We did have one meal in Wright's, the main restaurant, but this was a little disappointing for the price. (There are plenty of good local restaurants a short drive away). We were slightly upset that the pool at the Ocatilla was being renovated (and we had not been advised of this when we booked) but there were several other pools. The Paradise pool was the main pool and quite busy (towels only available here), the historic Catalina pool was fairly quiet, but we discovered the Saguaro pool which we had completely to ourselves for two whole afternoons. The hotel was celebrating it's 80th anniversary and we went on a fascinating (and free) historic tour of the hotel which lasted about 90 minutes. The AAA rate for the room which we had booked via the internet was $152 per night including the resort charge. With taxes we paid $170 per night, which we thought was excellent value considering all the extras we had through the Concierge Lounge. The booking stated that there was a daily charge of $12 for parking, but we were never charged this. This hotel was great and a little different from the normal chain type hotel accommodation. It is a great location and very well maintained. I would not want this to be my only experience of staying in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area, but it was certainly an experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “FS/RC Level of Service - OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: td2926
Reviews.Content: First some background of my wife and I to help you identify with our travel pattern for this review. I am corporate mgmt type for a Fortune 100 and my wife and I travel a total of about 70 nights a year. We are both in our mid 40s. We typically stay at Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton properties and occasionally Peninsula and Mandarin Oriental properties in Asia. When these aren't available we usually will stay at Grand Hyatt, Sheraton Grand, Walfdorf Astoria Collection, Conrad, etc. I must admit that I often use TripAdvisor pre-trip, but have never once written a review...until now. Now for our experience at the Arizona Biltmore from 7/22 -7/26: I think the other folks who have described the property itself are right on the money with the overall beauty and location of the Arizona Biltmore. The history behind the location and the buildings themselves are wonderful, the pools and cabanas are excellent (fun waterslide even!), the Links course at the golf course is extremely nice and challenging. I won't spend time here as everyone seems to love this part of the experience and we did too. I want to focus on the area that really need to be accentuated since it is less subjective - The Service Level! The Service - We were originally booked at the Four Seasons Scottsdale for this 4 night trip, but by blind luck I noticed that the Biltmore was running a 4th night free deal on their Ocatilla Club Level and at a very good nightly rate as well. We always try to book FS/RC because the service is completely over the top, nothing left to chance and all whims answered with a yes. We both agreed when we swtiched our reservation away from FS we were taking a risk, but felt that given the pool atmosphere and the history of the place, it was worth a calculated risk,especially on the Club Level. I can not possibly dojustice to the outstanding levelof service we received the entire time! The Ocatilla Club Lounge opened every morning at 6:30 with coffee and an expanded continental breakfast, but the best part was the greeting upon entry from Leo, the young lady who handles the morning crowd as lead concierge. Leo was chipper without being overly so or fake and was definitely concerned with our trip being exactly as we needed. She worked with the hotel management to secure me a comp day in a cabana for my Hilton Honors upgrade as opposed to a different room upgrade (ours was already very nice). Regardless what request my wife and I had of Leo, the answer was always yes and she always followed through. Amanda is the young lady from Iowa who woked with Leo most of the time we were there and she was equally helpful and friendly! In the evenings even with all of the comp wine, beer, and champagne to go with the delicious tapas type offerings, (not to mention wonderful desserts!) the best part was seeing Carolyn every evening who acted as lead concierge for the end of the day. Carolyn I believe is from Conn and she really LOVES her job taking care of Ocatilla guests in the warm climate of Arizona! Again Carolyn, just like Leo went above and beyond in so many ways to make our stay pleasant. And it was actually our dealings with Carolyn that made us decide to write this review. There was a hiccup with a houskeeping issue, that could have been a pretty big deal for my wife and I. But as those of you who stay at the upper end of resorts know, its not the issues that make or break the experience, its the reaction of the staff to the issue that tells the real story. Carolyn, working with management and under a quick approaching deadline, not ONLY rectified the rather complex situation, she provided us with a detailed and accurate explanation of why the issue occured, gave us both the most genuine apology for our trouble, and then with managements approval she made sure that we were both more than happy with the resolution, which I must say was way above and beyond what was expected. We then received calls and visits from management to make sure that we were satisfied with the resort's handling of the issue. Let me clearly say that along with the luxury rooms and feather beds in the Ocatilla rooms, the delicious food and drinks in the Ocatilla lounge, the gorgeous grounds and fun pool and cabana environment, all of these pale in comparison with the service we received at the Arizona Biltmore! IF you are accustomed to the Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton service level (always addressed by name, over the top on requests, etc) then STAY AT THIS RESORT!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: brixton77
Reviews.Content: I just spent three days there on a business trip. I was disappointed. The hotel sells membership to the locals, so the main pool/spa becomes insanely crowded on the weekend. Because the pool was packed with people who weren't even staying at the hotel, I really resented the 28 dollar resort fee. The pool felt more like a public park than a resort. There were screaming kids everywhere, and their obese moms drinking pina coladas. It was Ohio in the desert. Just an awful scene. That said, the buildings are very pretty. Frank Lloyd Wright did not design it, but one of his students did, and it is a very pleasant imitation. As others have said here, it is getting a little worn. So, if you are looking for a family vacation, this might be a good hotel. I'd skip it if you are on business or looking for a relaxing resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: abmemories
Reviews.Content: Thank you Arizona Biltmore for a wonderful week! The new accommodation in the Ocatilla WIng was amazing! In fact, with the delicious food included in the deal we didn't need to leave the hotel at all....and the Staff in the Ocatilla Concierge Lounge became true friends! Carolyn O'Shea went out of her way to make our stay memorable...thank you so much Carolyn! What fun we had! Leo Despot (whose birtdhay it was) prepared our boarding passes with such professionalism and friendliness! What wonderful staff - we made new friends of these folk and felt we were truly cherished as guests. Such a marvellous holiday - we can't wait to return - it was worth the 10 hour flight from London and the connecting flight to Belfast. We can't wait to return - what wonderful memories! Carol Anderson Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RitaWesthampton_NY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore for several days in June. The service was wonderful and the accomodations were surpurb. The staff is very well trained in giving the hotel guests the most superior service, and everyone at the Biltmore went out of there way to make sure that my stay was better than I ever expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: Stay part of the time at the hotel and park at the villas. If you can afford it, the villas are well worth it. Full kitchen. Great room with fireplace. Your own patio. Seperate shared pool. We were very impressed with the Biltmore. The Frank Lloyd Wright designed building and furnishings were amazing. They inspired us when we built our own home. The grounds were very well kept. If you are a fan of Frank Lloyd Wright or the Arts and Crafts style, you must stay at this hotel. The pool was relaxing and great. They even showed movies at the pool. Overall, great room, great service, great food ... and we got a free upgrade to a villa. What's not to love?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff to die for...”
Reviews.Author: greenbqueenb
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the gorgeous 80-year old jewel in the desert, the Biltmore staff ensured that my every need was met. And they did so with an unusual charm of manner. Even if a problem I experienced had nothing to do with the hotel, they did their best to deal with it almost as if we were friends. Maybe that's what 80 years of experience does; in any case, the most pleasant staff and a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding facility and wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Conf-Coordinator
Reviews.Content: I coordinate several conferences each year and the Arizona Biltmore has been the most fantastic hotel that I have had the pleasure to work with. The conference coordinator, Jeremy Vasquez, was absolutely wonderful and worked closely with us to ensure a successful event. The entire staff was friendly, helpful and available to assist in any way. The AV staff anticipated our every need and went above and beyond! Thanks for such a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “The best meeting we have had in 15 years...”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoH2o
Reviews.Content: Our organization recently had the opportunity to bring together a number of our authorized dealers from across the country and our support personnel for a meeting at the Arizona Biltmore. We considered a number of properties before choosing the Biltmore. In these challenging economic times, we certainly understood the need to find an economical way to hold a meeting but we also knew that this meeting was going to be one of the most important meetings we have had in our company's long history. It was therefore vital that we choose our venue wisely and make good use of our limited resources. I am thrilled to let you know that the Biltmore far exceeded our expectations in terms of service, attention to our needs and professionalism. From the moment we arrived to the date of our departure, everyone in our group was treated like royalty. From the initial sales department contact to the planning with convention services to the handling of our final billing - the Arizona Biltmore's staff delivered on their promise. In the more than 20 years I have planned corporate meetings, I have never been more at ease on site than when I was at the Biltmore. I was certain that things would be done as promised. From catering to audio visual support, our needs were met and I would absolutely recommend that you contact the Arizona Biltmore for your next important function.

Reviews.Title: “Like going back to 1929”
Reviews.Author: KTVirginia
Reviews.Content: According to its website, the Arizona Biltmore opened in 1929 and is looks like it hasn't aged a day. The hotel is truly special in that it avoided two very easy and common mistakes: (1) it didn't try to update itself with the times only to have a mishmash of styles and (2) it didn't let itself go either. Though Frank Lloyd Wright was not the actual architect, but a consulting one, the Biltmore seems a museum to his style. The grounds and multiple pools are immaculately kept and the room I was in (a Garden room) was spotless with all current amenities (flat screen TV, Bose style alarm clock with holder for iPod). The shear spaciousness of the grounds gives the Biltmore its resort feel. I still can't quite believe this was $99 a night (maybe because it was the heat of the summer). There was no special deal; that was the price on the website, but I would have willingly paid double. I would suggest doing it up 1920s style with champagne (in the afternoon :) on the back seating area (gorgeous outdoor couches) with interesting statues and lush lawns. Great service, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Joe Beer Can can afford a Resort Stay and Feel Special”
Reviews.Author: BrianAZ
Reviews.Content: I wanted to book a special day for my Wife's birthday. I have a limited budget, and since we live in Phoenix, generally speaking the hotels here are reasonable during the summer time. Working with the conciege, she helped me with my limited expenses and made it work. She made sure that our room had "birthday amenities" that made my wife feel very special. The property feels as if you are on an island away from Arizona as the grounds were filled with beautiful blooming flowers. The service exceeded our expectations. The staff was continually opening doors, smiling, and wanting to be of service.

Reviews.Title: “Impecable Service, Food and Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeresaMeyer
