Reviews.Content: Returned recently from Regional Meeting at the Biltmore. Without a doubt one of the best meetings I had due to the hotel's service, food and beverage and staff! Their creativity and attention to detail. You can not find a better hotel in the valley for a meeting or for any type of event. I want to share how the banquet and Convention Services and Culinary team wowed us! Our group is a very well travelled group and we all said this was the best meeting we ever had.. The new room product was beautiful and the grounds of the resort were so well kept up as usual. They have put together a well staffed team and took care of every detail. There was nothing left unsaid what they would not have done for us and did it with a smile and asked us what else they could do. Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great in the Arizona Heat”
Reviews.Author: danfromtorrance
Reviews.Content: In order to have a good time be ready to use the pool to cool off from the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service-Remarkable solitude and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: jt_trainor
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a quiet getaway. The Biltmore Resort and Spa provided just that within the confines of the "Occtilla". The room was quiet and adjoined by a semi-private pool. The room was elegantly furnished and left nothing to the imagination. Comfort, style, and elegance best describes the amenitites. Dining within the Biltmore was another treat. The waitstaff was friendly, knowledgable, and very courteous. John and Martin stand out. Room service was very prompt, and unobtrusive. The Biltmore sent me home relaxed, and more than wishing that I should have booked a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, peaceful and accomidating atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: kateebaum71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. Our purpose was to "get away" and relax. Our experience (first at this hotel) was just that. Our room was perfect. It was spacious and clean. It seemed as though it was brand new. The bed was incredible and the extra things throughout the room were nice: little cactus on shelf, the sparkling white robe and slippers, the bath salts and candles, the big TV...I could continue. We happened to run into a Mr. Jeremy Beck, who was the director of the housekeeping crew and let him know how happy we were. Our dining experience in the Write restaurant was wonderful and fun. We got a kick out of the water/bread gentleman named Martin. He was charming and made us smile with his "Good evening" both nights we were there. We also asked him to take our picture and he did so and was just super cute about it. A charming man. The whole food experience was also something to talk about. We ate pork chops and then the steak with mushrooms. Superb. I especially loved the tomato salad and my sweetheart loved the onion soup. I could go on and on. The bottom line is our stay at the Biltmore, in the Occotillo section of the hotel, was terrific. Everyone was very helpful, our room was perfect, the pool was refreshing and the service was top of the line. Thank you. We will return. Kate Baumgarth

Reviews.Title: “Happy Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaJensmom
Reviews.Content: We returned from our 2 night stay at the Biltmore last night. It was one of the best stays that we have had anywhere! The rooms are fabulous. The facility has a casual, comfortable elegance about it and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Even at dinner - we mentioned that it was our anniversary to the very helpful staff member who made our reservation and we had at least 3 of the staff wish us "Happy Anniversary!" and then they presented us with a beautiful Chocolate Souffle complete with "Happy Anniversary" written on the plate in chocolate. The summer rates at the resort and Wright's, their premier restaurant, even made all of this very reasonable. I would definitely recommend The Arizona Biltmore to ANYONE, even the most picky of people will be pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience for Group Event”
Reviews.Author: kstone13
Reviews.Content: This hotel just recently hosted our company client meeting. The hospitality and service were one of the best I have experienced and I have been doing this for quite some time. The hotel went above and beyond to make sure that our guests had the ultimate experience. All of our needs were handled in the quickest manner and never did we have to ask twice for anything. The Chef was so creative with all of our functions and our CSM was thorough, insightful and ready to lend a hand for anything or everything! I would recommend this gorgeous property to any group that is looking to execute a great event! Another great thing worthy to comment is how close this hotel is to the airport. A short ride for the guests and a beautiful property!

Reviews.Title: “unpretentious luxury, gorgeous grounds and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: jahlers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore for our third wedding anniversary. We live nearby and had been to the hotel before, but never stayed there. As soon as we entered the grounds we felt like we were on a special getaway miles away from home. We spent the afternoon lounging by the pool in our private poolside cabana, which was not inexpensive but certainly worth the luxury and convenience of having our own poolside dining table with an attentive personal server, as well as a bathroom, changing room and TV (if you just can't do without it). The drinks were excellent and the poolside food selection was limited but very good (with the sole exception of the meager $12 portion of "chicken sticks"). We spent the late afternoon relaxing in our room in the Valley Wing, which had a patio leading directly out to a smaller, less crowded pool and jacuzzi. The grounds are so extensive and well kept that you can really lose yourself walking the property. We finished the day with dinner at Wright's, where our waiter was highly knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list. We strongly recommend the chocolate souffle for dessert!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic get away”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAznative
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Biltmore for our anniversary and had a wonderful time. All the staff at the resort are very professional and friendly. The pool staff was accommodating and on top of the service. Our dinner at the Wright's restaurant in the resort was amazing. The chef even made a couple changes to a dish that I requested. You have to try the soufflé!! We plan to return next year for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: damian17
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the perfect vacation Arizona Biltomore! A beautiful room, attentive staff, frozen drinks by the pool and spectacular weather made for an incredible vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A friend for life and a magnificent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ElPasoWright
Reviews.Content: What a magnificient stay. We came for two days and ended up staying two weeks. Every aspect of our stay was more than we would have expected. The entire staff was friendly and the concierge service was immpeccable. Carolyn our Concierge host was so wonderful and helpful with places to go for food and fun. We feel as though we made a friend for life. We were able to relax and feel at home the entire stay. From the valet, to the front desk , and in to the spa: it was simply amazing. We look forward to coming back to the Arizona Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Papai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in May, 2009, and found this hotel to be a great choice. We were trying to find the best value in a high-end hotel, and this one ranked one of the top. Booked through Hilton's own website, I got a rate of $89 per night, which is a great rate for this hotel. The prices go down quite a bit toward the end of May, and through the summer. The hotel architecture and grounds were beautiful. I liked that there is a lot of interesting history at this hotel, as well. Our room was just outside the pool area, and we took advantage of that all day and all night. The pool water was warm, and we swam until 4:00 in the morning. This was nice because some places close their pools at certain times. We ordered room service, when we checked in, and it arrived in our room right after we did. The room we stayed in was very roomy and updated. The bed, very comfy, as is most Hilton beds. The only thing I wished they provided was more amenities: free breakfast, a refrigerator you can stock, and a microwave. Many mid-level hotels provide these amenities, so high-end hotels should provide these too. The prices of entrees in the restaurants were very expensive, and so was room service. Overall, this hotel was very nice. I would just go eat to the many restaurants not far from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Architecture buff's delight”
Reviews.Author: margi0518
Reviews.Content: There's nothing to compare with the atmosphere in this Frank Lloyd Wright inspired property built 80 years ago. Don't come if you desire tons of activities and the glitz of a newer resort, although the pool area was full of activity on the Saturday we were there. Renting a cabana for the day was worth it for four adults and two babies. Service at the pool was excellant - just wish the pool bar and restaurant had stayed open later. Check your computer generated bill before leaving. We found a daily charge that even the staff couldn't figure out. They quickly removed it and actually gave us some credit for the fact that I was ill for part of our stay and hadn't been able to use any of the resort facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Wow--What great service!”
Reviews.Author: firegalarizona
Reviews.Content: I recently took a girl's trip and was thrilled with the friendly service and great deals at he Biltmore. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a wonderful getaway. We stayed in the Ocatilla rooms and enjoyed wonderful appetizers, breakfast and happy hours. The service was terrific and made us all feel very important! While checking in, we had friendly and helpful service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: catelyn
Reviews.Content: My firend and I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore last weekend and although the hotel and grounds are very nice the services that were offered were overpriced and just so-so. We had paid our bill in advance through Expedia. The room and beds were comfortable but the furniture was rather old and worn. Be sure and wear good walking shoes as at this resort you will do alot of that. There were only 2 restaurants Wrights ...pricey and Starbucks...also pricey $10 for plain coffee and a muffin. The Grill was closed due to renovation. The Cabana poolside grill was reasonable but we usually away in the daytime it closed at 7:00 pm. Wear good walking shoes to get to your car as the parking garage is about a quarter mile away and we were charged $12. a day for it. Finally my friend noticed there were almost $200 in pending charges on her debit card that she was not notifyed would be beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed there once --- don't need to do it again!”
Reviews.Author: dladams233
Reviews.Content: Our family of 8 people, including a 4 month old, was really looking forward to a nice relaxing vacation at the Biltmore over the Memorial Day weekend. As an added bonus, we got a great rate ($100/night including the resort fee!) for three rooms. That's where the excitement stopped. We had problems getting what we asked for (we are talking simple things like towels and ice), the pool was packed and ridiculously expensive with terrible service and rude people, and parking was awful. Check in was easy, however, with a baby, I needed a crib and a microwave brought to our room. When we got to our room, it was the furthest set of buildings in the hotel and a little worn out – could use some updating. I was told to use the refrigerator in the room, I’d have to empty the mini bar. When I went to empty it half of the bottles were open and half drank and never replaced. Gross --- not to mention I’m sure an extra charge to me. The crib came within an hour of check in without a hitch, but the microwave was a $25 charge, took 5 phone calls to get, and interrupted our baby's sleep by finally getting it at 9:15pm (11:15pm our local time) after we had been told they were out and we wouldn’t get one until the next day and were already in bed. To get ice in this hotel, you need to call food service, who then brings you a little container. You can’t take your ice bucket to get it yourself. When we asked the person who came if we could get more, he told us the first floor maid area had some if we wanted to go there to get it – of course this was after we had to tip the guy. In my parents’ room next door, they had the smoke detector going off in the middle of the night because of a dead battery. They called to get it fixed—the front desk sent an “engineer” who pulled the smoke detector off the wall and left the cord hanging. It was fixed two days after it was reported. We spent Saturday and half of Sunday at the Paradise pool. Our group is all early risers, so getting a chair wasn’t a problem, although it was for many around us. Our problem was they don’t start serving food at the pool until 11:30, and when they do, a cheeseburger is $18. A few people in our group ran to Safeway and brought back donuts for breakfast and sandwiches for lunch. We were a big group, so it would have been expensive to eat there. Upon bringing the donuts down to the pool, we were told that they served food in this area so carry-ins weren’t allowed. At 8:30 in the morning the line at the coffee shop was out the door and around the corner and the pool grill didn’t open for another 3 hours – give me a break, not to mention that it wasn’t posted anywhere because we looked. Our family is usually a pretty “go with the flow” kind of family, who gets along with anyone and doesn’t say much, which is why I felt compelled to write this review when we all felt strongly about our stay. The grounds are very pretty (which you see on your 20 minute walk from the parking garage), but we felt nickel and dimed the entire stay, the rooms could use updating, and the level of service we received was barely par level and certainly not what I was expecting from a place with the reputation of the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Never again will I stay at the AZ Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: Nem3422
Reviews.Content: Service was horrible at the pool and I couldn't even get a BandAid when my girlfriend needed one. Not to mention, the employees eye-balling my girlfriend the entire time. The guy told me that I had to buy them at the gift shop if I needed them. The food at the restaurant was good, but way overpriced.... just like everything else there. The location is horrible, especially if you can't rent a car. It cost me $100 just to get into Tempe and back, so I would not recommend this place if you plan on leaving the hotel campus. The thing that really made me angry was seeing the bill at the end of our trip. One thing that they don't disclose to you before you get a room is that there is a $28 room fee (plus $4 in taxes) for each day you stay there to cover the hotel amenities. For a 4 night stay, I paid $128 for room fees! Ridiculous!!! Trust me, the hotel is very pretty, but definitely not worth the cost and the hype. DO NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Accomadating Beyond Reproach”
Reviews.Author: BostonPetvet
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Biltmore where our company held its annual National Sales Meeting and our group could not have been more happy. Yes, the drinks and food that individuals purchased outside the meeting were expensive but the staff could not have been more accomadating or pleasant. Lots of planning goes into a meeting of 300 but there still will be last minute requests, on the fly changes and unforeseen needs that the Biltmore staff handled without batting an eye. There response was always - "we'll make it happen". The banquet food we were served impressed all, the grounds are beautiful and the scenic backdrop of the mountain is worth staring at as you sip your morning coffee. Sure some of the older rooms are not as nice as the newer Villas but with 8 pools, a staff that is eager to please, a convenient location to the airport and an interesting history, our sales team found it a great place for a meeting and many commented that they would return for a visit if they had the chance. Are there nicer more lavishes resorts in the Phoenix area? - certainly but you will be hard pressed to find a property that will do more to make your stay pleasant and enjoyable. For us, it was certainly the Wright choice.....

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous and relaxing, no issues.”
Reviews.Author: doremifa
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore staff was extremely accommodating, it was a wonderful stay. We stayed 4 days for a birthday celebration and the hotel did many many things to make it a very special experience. The room was clean and very comfortable and the food was great. I would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good Old Arizona elegance in the heart of the camelback district”
Reviews.Author: birdog28
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is quite possibly the Queen of Arizona hotels. It is elegant and beautiful and classy..... with a price of course, but you find yourself not caring what it costs because it's that good. We've stayed here when the kids were little and they accomodated them beautifully and as teenagers it's every bit as good. The pools are great in the summer, on campus restaurants are fine if a bit overpriced, and nearby restaurants are the best in casual dinning. Shopping nearby Biltmore is quite good... and Scottsdale fashion square with Nordstroms rounds out anything you might want. Memorable getaway especially with Kids, young adults and pets. Elegant grounds and recreation abounds... Great gym and tennis complex as well as full length golf course rumored to be very good (I've not played it) You can self park but wear comfortable shoes... it's a hike. The Biltmore should not be missed though... it's worth all the added on fees etc.... SUPER NICE surrounds. Flower gardens and surrounds and fun things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent Service”
Reviews.Author: hoppy4409
Reviews.Content: Holli, Our hostess for several meals was extrmely professional and attended to all our needs. You should consinder yourself fortunate to have such an employee. Mark W. Hopkins

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service at the pool!”
Reviews.Author: quirkychristine
Reviews.Content: We just visited the Arizona Biltmore for a "girl's" weekend and had a wonderful time. We spent the first day lounging by the pool and were instantly treated to exceptional service by Aaron and his staff. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome, attended to our every need, and even convinced us to change our plans for the next day and spend a second full day with them by the pool. In addition to the great treatment at the pool, the staff also didn't even hesistate when we asked for late night "room service" on the patio outside the lobby (enjoying the great weather). When asked what was on the menu, the response was "whatever you'd like." All in all, a wonderful weekend. We will definitely be going back again!

Reviews.Title: “The service of few made up for disappointing room and service of others”
Reviews.Author: cvmike
Reviews.Content: Attended corporate conference in April. Growing up in the hotel business I always appreciate 'observing' hotels and resorts as a guest. Valet and Bell Staff were genuine and cordial and check in was quick and professional. My room was in the Paradise wing. The Paradise wing is dated and so was the room. On the positive side, the room was spacious and quiet. On the negative side, the beds were way to soft and 'lumpy', the shower/tub drain was broken, the water drained slowly in the shower, the LAN wire for internet service was frayed and inoperable, the doorknob into the bathroom was completely broken.... I was amazed this room was put into service, (Biltmore, the room is 2205) My trip to the pool after my arrival was disappointing. After ten minutes and no server approaching I flagged down someone and asked for a menu. He told me he wasn't my server but could bring me a menu. Ten more minutes went by and I had to flag someone else down. She told me she also was not my server but would have someone come over. Finally when someone came over to take a drink order and I asked for a menu I was informed that they had just stopped serving food! She did apologize and was able to scrounge up a bowl of chips (but no salsa).....for which I was charged nearly $5. Despite all mentioned above I loved the layout of the property. It is spacious and exellently manicured and maintained. Other than the pool, the entire staff at this property is great. The banquet staff was teriffic and the food was very good. They helped overcome the negatives. Of special recognition was the server at the Wright's bar, Jami. Jami was professional, efficient and fun. She remembered our names form the previous evening(s), remembered our preferred beverages, and most importantly, was a sports fan that knows the game of baseball. Her enthusiastic attitude showed and she is a true asset to the Biltmore!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: M1styDawn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore for a very busy business conference, so I was not able to explore all of it, or use many of its facilities. I also don't know what the rates are like so I can't really comment on the value. I hear you can get VERY good rates at this resort during the summer months. The rooms were excellent. Sparkling clean, very large, very comfortable, and all of them seemed to have nice views. The bathroom in my room was huge and well equipped with a luxuriously deep tub and separate shower stall, heat lamps, two sinks, a separate vanity with stool, and a totally separate room for the toilet. The bed was so comfortable. My room was part of a building that had a small very private feeling pool in the courtyard. Just beautiful. The grounds were immaculate, but you hardly ever noticed the staff around working on them. I did not get to see the entire resort. It was August, and I'm Canadian. So even just the walk from my room to the meeting centre left me breathless from the heat. The surrounding neighborhood seemed very safe and well kept. It was nice to be able to take a walk off the resort and see the local architecture. Very different from my home! There main pool was huge, clean and beautiful. There were private cabanas with cool mist. The meeting facilities were excellent. Very large and well equipped. And there were several of these large meeting rooms available in a few different buildings. The food was excellent. Even the buffet type snacks and lunches were fantastic. I don't remember the service being remarkable, but it was not lacking either. I'm Canadian, so I find most Americans a bit rude (they don't apologize constantly ha ha). I do remember feeling that they were very polished and professional. I think my favourite part of my stay was having drinks on the patio in the evening. The heat was tolerable after the sun set, and the grounds are lit in such a beautiful way. It was so comfortable and relaxing. I did not get to see the golf course, but my colleagues were talking about how nice it was. I did not get to use the spa facilities either, sadly. No one else in my party used them either so I can not comment on that. I would definitely recommend this resort for business or pleasure. Especially if the prices in the summer are as reasonable as I heard.

Reviews.Title: “Service, par excellence”
Reviews.Author: zalmine
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of April, my 90 year old mother, my sister and I stayed for one night at the Biltmore. It was my mother's birthday. It was glorious, from the suite we had, to the dinner that night for her birthday, down to shopping at the Men's shop. My mother was in 7th heaven and I'll tell you why. It started with meeting Carolyn O'Shea at the Ocatilla Lounge. We really didn't have the time to use the Lounge but she went out of her way to make all of us feel welcomed and pampered. She showed us around the Lounge, gave us a couple of treats to try and then helped to get us reservations at Wright's for dinner that night. She arranged it. (We had reservations at another restaurant that night that we cancelled.) She was professional, kind, respectful and just the loveliest person. That was our introduction to the Biltmore! Almost everyone at the Biltmore was professional and wonderful to us even though we were staying just one night. Mario at the Men's Shop, Robert Wade (director at Wright's), Matt Case (manager at Wright's - we were very impressed with Matt), Paulina in housekeeping, and the manager in reservations (forgot his name) who set us up in a magnificent suite in the Ocatilla section when I first made these reservations. My mother and I look forward to visiting the Biltmore in the future. It was extraordinary and it's a birthday my mother will never forget. Thank you all!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Passover/ Easter Week Hassles”
Reviews.Author: piperturboarrow
Reviews.Content: First time our family stayed at this resort and unfortunately the last. When we booked we were told that there was a large Jewish family staying at the resort for Passover. Thought at the time it was an odd comment, until we arrived and found out it was a tour group of 750 people there to celebrate Passover. From check-in to about day 4 of our 7 day vacation our requests were generally answered with, "I'm sorry this or that is for our Passover guests". In particular I asked for a nicer roll-away bed for our son, but was told the full mattress types were for "our Passover guests." When we couldn't find a spot to sit at by the main pool, all were "saved" by 9 am, I asked to rent a cabana, but they were rented well in advance by this large tour group. On day 4 I asked to meet with the Manager or director of operations, I did this by calling the manager's office to set up an appointment. The Manager of the Front Desk did meet with me and was a very wonderful person and managed to convey my problems to the director of operations, who then upgraded my two rooms to a two bedroom villa and gave us a cabana for our use, even though two days prior I was told they were all rented out. I felt that I made a reasonable request to meet with the Manager or Director of Operations, but neither were available, even though I told the assistant I could meet at anytime. When a guest asks politely to meet with a Manger I was surprise and dismayed at the lack of response. For me that spoke volumes about their concern for my family and I as guests of the resort As good as their service recovery was, it still felt like a non-vacation, having to go to so much effort to be treated as a guest as important as the large tour group members. My suggestion would be to close reservations to everyone else and have the resort reserved for this tour group exclusively, because it was evident that they (the tour group) were the main focus of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Check before checking in”
Reviews.Author: bobsgirlrumson
Reviews.Content: Although the grounds were lovely and the history of the hotel was fascinating, there was one gigantic problem with this hotel.......If you are not celebrating Passover, do not under any circumstances book this hotel in the three days preceeding and succeeding this holiday or during it. When we arrived for our quiet first anniversary celebration, the first thing we see are masses of strollers and children running all about. Upon further observation, both visual and offered by the bellman, we were informed that the hotel becomes 90% occupied by the orthodox sect of Judaism at this time. For us, this meant incredible noise, children running everywhere, and worst of all, east coast manners of the parent clientele. Unbearable.........incessant cell phone usage, loud voices and general rudeness constantly.....There were no pools that were adult only and worst of all the children were often unsupervised and allowed to behave as they wished. Poolside, people would "save" chairs beginning at 9 am and then never sit in them until late afternoon if at all! There was also no towel service at the outlying pools unless calls were made. It was clear that management had either lost control or did not care to control the way people behave at their property. Certainly we wished we had been informed that a hotel we had believed would be a quiet romantic getaway had not been turned into a mass playground for hordes of children. I understand the sensitive nature of the foregoing and do not want the reader to feel we were being prejudiced, we are not. We are simply noting the behavior of what could have been ANY large group of people, not picking on one group in particular. I would not have wanted to share the hotel with 90% college aged spring breakers either. But I do feel it is incumbent upon management to somehow tastefully inquire as to the purpose of a person's visit and make sure it matches the ambiance the hotel provides. Having said that, our room was clean although the minibar was never restocked and on check out day, despite being granted late check out, housekeeping rang three times. The parking fees were annoying and self parking was too far and unlit. The location was great and the concierge helpful when asked for outside restaurant options. We loved the location of our room and had perfect weather.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection-world class service..”
Reviews.Author: mme08
Reviews.Content: Well I am writing this review from my room at the biltmore, and I have to say that the hotel is wonderful and beautifully maintained, and the service is top notch. When I checked in I was upgraded to a terrace suite in the newly renovated wing, and the resort fee was waived. I am impressed with the decor in the room, it is well appointed and feels like home. The plasma tv is huge, and the bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is beautifully done with double vanities, and a soaking tub with a large walk in shower. There are three phones in the room, and plenty of choices with the lighting. I also enjoyed sitting out on the terrace with the comfortable outdoor furniture. The staff is friendly and helpful. I just ordered room service, and they are preparing something for me that is not listed on their menu. I am enjoying my stay, it is a relaxing retreat in the city, and I would definitely return. This is a first class hotel all the way. The service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Visit IF...”
Reviews.Author: ArmoredMBZ
Reviews.Content: ...You Don't Want to Have THE ABSOLUTE BEST TIME of Your Life!! ;) My fiance and I just spent 4 nights at the luxurious Arizona Biltmore Resort & Spa in Phoenix, AZ. We stayed in the brand new Ocotillo rooms in the Arizona Wing - and wow - the beds were amazing! I've never slept so good in my life!! Make sure you get a great view of the pool - you won't regret it! The staff was amazing - and the service was A++! My only complaint was that I couldn't stay longer!! (my vacation ended too soon!!) I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a romantic and relaxing vacation spot. PS: The hotel is only a few blocks from terrific shopping and dining! If you get the chance, check out True Food at the Biltmore Shops down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing staycation that feels like a vacation”
Reviews.Author: nadofan8
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a four day stay at the Arizona Biltmore. It was a perfect relaxing and fun get away. The grounds of the Biltmore are absolutely beautiful and compliment the gorgeous Frank lloyd Wright architecture. My friend and I took our teenage daughters for a little spring break trip. We stayed in one of the cottage rooms. It was very comfortable and had a huge bathroom with a tub and a separate shower. We were able to use the well equipped gym everyday followed by a steam and sauna in the spa. It was incredibly relaxing to sit by one of the eight pools everyday while the girls swam. The poolside lunches were healthy and delicious. We were able to eat at Wright's restaraunt for dinner one night and really enjoyed the great food and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place that has something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: duke4ever
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the rooms were great too. The rooms were spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. We had a great view of Squaw Peak. The location was really good for our group. We had people arriving from all over the country for a wedding and we had easy access to the airport and the location is very central in Phoenix, which is a large city! The hotel grounds are very beautiful both during the day and when lit up at night. Definately an oasis in the city. I used the catering services to serve a meal to a group of 35+ after we took wedding pictures at the Biltmore and the food was both very tasty and served with lovely presentation. They did such a nice job and I could relax and enjoy the food and my guest before the 7:30 pm wedding at another location (it was a desert buffet ). Valet service was very effecient and helpful. The Concierge gave me the name of a terrific florist to use for my rehursal dinner and my flowers were outstanding for that event. The hotel was so helpful with getting handicaped rooms for two elderly couples that were in out party. I can't say enought about how the hotel, spa, salon, and all the people that work at the Biltmore made the whole weekend a very extra special celebration. Many of my friends had not been in the area before but loved the hotel so much they wished they could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: pjsmomi
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Biltmore from March 21 - March 28, 2009. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The grounds and architecture of this hotel are absolutely gorgeous! The surrounding area has many activities to take advantage of but if you are like my son and myself, you might very rarely leave the hotel! My husband was there for business so he wasn't there most of the day with us. We spent a majority of our time perusing the grounds and took full advantage of the 8 swimming pools. My personal favorite was the Paradise Pool that had a beautiful slide and the fact that a good portion of the pool is only 3 feet deep was very comforting as my son is only 7 and a novice swimmer at best. Having spent so much time at this pool, I became quite familiar with the staff of the bar. Phil and Kelly were always cheerful and helpful and went out of their way to make you feel like you were at your corner tavern. Aaron went above and beyond for me on several occasions and even provided me with drink recipes I could bring home with me. Tell me, who does that??? I have stayed at many resorts over the years from California to Orlando and have never had such personalized service as I did with these people. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to the Phoenix area. In truth, I never had much of a desire to go to Arizona but I would go back here in a heartbeat. I had a facial, manicure and pedicure at the spa and my husband took advantage of the massages. You will never feel so pampered in your life! Definitely try it! It's worth every dime you spend. The staff couldn't be nicer or more accomodating. My only complaint was towards the end of our stay, my son sat down on a lounge chair on our patio and fell through. It obviously had weakened due to the climate. When I spoke to someone at the front desk, they were apologetic but the chair was never fixed during our stay. If that is the worst thing that happens during a hotel stay, I consider myself truly lucky!! Also, I wasn't exactly thrilled with Wright's Restaurant. The service was good their but I really didn't feel that the food lived up to the hype or the prices.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay with superb facilities and great, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: tapestryencinitas
Reviews.Content: An historic hotel with great service and beautiful grounds. Great location to all in central Phoenix and short drives to other areas, such as Scottsdale. The staff is so pleasant and helpful with any questions. Our room was the standard or classic room, very nice, but the bathroom is a bit small. Very quiet where we were. There was a lot of hustle and bustle going on in the hotel, meetings, conferences, etc. The Spa is beautiful, and the canal is close by for a nice walk. The food was excellent in all the restaurants. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic , Historic, worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: gleuny
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel is worth a visit. We stayed in the Arizona wing (valley bldg) which was recently renovated. We even had a terrace which is a nice plus. This Frank Lloyd Wright building design is historic and the entire resort stays in character. Some of the furniture was re-upholstered and rightfully so. The carpets, Flat Panel, and bathroom however are 21st century. The main pool is nice, so are the several smaller ones. The staff is very attentive, polite, and cater to every whim. I can't say enough good things. Had dinner in the main dinning room. The $35 pre-fix is the best bargain. Nothing is cheap here, but it's reasonable for a 5 star hotel. Mini-fridge will store some items, but this isn't the place to go to save money, this is a splurge. You may want to consider the 'concierge level' Aside from liquor, computer access, other amenities, they also provide all day snacks, lunch and breakfast. Desert at night. Worth the $85 a day if you plan on drinking several $20 martini's during your stay. Yes the $28 resort fee sucks, but it's better than being nickel and dimed to death at the Pointe Hiltons. As for the $15 a day self parking fee, don't tell them, they won't charge you. For the record, I got a sale price under 200 a day, the same price I paid at the Point Hilton Tappatio and Sqaw peak. Wish I stayed here all 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Experience most memorable”
Reviews.Author: TastebudsNewJersey
Reviews.Content: General Manager: Aaron Beaver Servers: Ernie Mattson, Sharon Mc Grath, Brian Smith, staff at the Arizona Biltmore Resort & Spa, made our 3 day stay, one that we will not soon forget. There friendliness and attention to our requests, were all met which such enthusiam and professionalism. They were just awesome! The cabanas our group rented were an added bonus to our stay. We would highly recommend them to anyone visiting your establishment. With short notice, Aaron Beaver arranged and coordinated with the chef, an outstanding light buffet that was beautifully executed and so delicious. Thank you all for making our much needed get-a-way, a trip to repeat real soon! All the Best! Genevieve & Rowland Davies, III Brick, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, historic and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: ellieKansas
Reviews.Content: We spent spring break at the Biltmore and it was a wonderful family vacation. The grounds were beautiful and the staff was attentive. When we did encounter a problem at the pool, a manager handled the situation that far exceeded any expectation. The problem was addressed and we were more than sufficiently compensated. I would highly recommend this hotel for pleasure and business.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: AMPuglisi
Reviews.Content: My girlfiends and I met at the Biltmore for a "spa weekend." We found the service to be excellent and the spa services superb! That made up for the shortcomings of the room. We were not able to check in until after the guaranteed 4:00 p.m. and when we did, we spent about an hour and a half waiting on amenities: robes, extra hangers, an iPod docking station that worked, maintenance to unstop our sink. The carpet was very worn and the lawn blowers at 8:00 a.m. were a little (a lot) annoying--as was the fire alarm that went off in our room at 9:00 a.m. But, it was difficult for us to get upset because the people working at the Biltmore were so nice. Eric at the front desk was great when we called about all of the issues in our room. Aaron at the pool made the best Sangrias we've ever tasted. And, our waitress at our cabana at the pool, Sharon, was as attentive as we needed her to be. In addition, Sheila gave the best facial I've ever had! We are already planning another weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “this was the nicest hotel she has stayed at in the world”
Reviews.Author: JamesTorres
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many luxury hotels throughout the world and when my Wife states that this was the nicest hotel she has stayed at in the world that is a strong statement. I would like to express my deep and sincere thanks for the hospitality and professionalism by everyone at the Arizona Biltmore Hotel, who welcomed myself and my wife Sharon on our recent vacation. It was very comfortable room with great service and top shelf meals provided by the chef throughout the hotel and especially in our concierge section. I would like especially to compliment the new Arizona wing. I want to specifically point out Carolyn, Amanda and Cody, who were very professional, polite, punctual and both served and helped both my wife questions and me with excellent service. I will certainly recommend the Arizona Biltmore and in particular the new Arizona wing with its outstanding concierge service to my colleagues and friends. Best regards, James and Sharon

Reviews.Title: “Completly BAD”
Reviews.Author: chrisdj
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty, stains on carpet everywhere. We complained and got another room It was even dirtier! Waste of money. The maid was knocking on door at 7:00 am!!!!! The should change thier name as it nowhere near a Biltmore level.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds - great service”
Reviews.Author: BCEagle88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 5 nights at the Biltmore for AZ spring training and golf. The hotel is stunning - the architecture and grounds are beautiful with the mountains as a backdrop. The fitness facility was great - not the most up to date machines, but plenty of selection and the locker rooms included access to steam/sauna, etc. Very relaxing! All of the staff that we encountered were super friendly and accomodating and we met some really great locals and guests while sitting around the fire pits. As per previous negative reviews, the food and drinks are pretty expensive, but there are plenty of off property options to take advantage of. Golf was expensive as well, but no more so than equivalent courses in the area. And, yes, the hotel is "older" but we felt that the history made it more interesting. We would definitely stay again. Be sure to walk through the neighborhood - there are some amazing properties.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: caroleMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for our 43rd wedding anniversary. Our Room was awesome. We had breakfast in our room the next morning. Food was excellent and room service personnel were fantastic. We received a tour of the property by a staff member. He was very knowledgeable and shared some of the uniqueness of the resort, its beginnings and how it was built. Everyone we came in contact with was top shelf. We highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: apkiel14
Reviews.Content: Well kept beautiful property. We traveled with two young children (7 and 4) and we always felt welcome throughout the resort, especially in the club room during breakfast and in the evening for desert/wine. Concierge was always friendly and offered knowledgably advice on activities throughout the Phoenix area. Although it was cool in the morning and evenings, we were still able to enjoy the heated pools. Location was good … close to hiking and shopping. Staff was very friendly and personable. Great stay, we will defiantly say again if we are in the Phoenix area. Kids also loved the resort … ranks with Disney as one of there favorite places.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch staff at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: LAS64
Reviews.Content: This is our companies 2nd time in 4 months using the Biltmore. The staff is outstanding and as a meeting planner they really make my job easy and they sure do make me loook good! We hosted a Mardi Gras night and all the servers jumped in and wore masks for us which really made them part of the evening. From arrival to departure the event was flawless. Our customers had a great expereience and continue to rave about the fine staff at the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “great pool area”
Reviews.Author: karils
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great on the outside. Great courtyard and pool area. The rooms could use some work. Interesting history and decent restaurant. While I was there in a very hot month, the lobby/main areas air conditioning could not keep up. Overall it was a good stay and I was thankful for the great pool to cool off.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds but rooms need a refresh”
Reviews.Author: bdaniels
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice for business and the grounds are beautiful, the food is good quality and the conference areas are nice. The weather in February can't be beat and there is something magical about the trees brimming with oranges. Unfortunately the rooms are very out dated - old wallpaper, cigarette burns in the draperies in a non-smoking room, 1970s furniture & bathroom. At the price point the rooms are really a disappointment although the beds are comfortable. If you go, don't miss the incredible cookies - they are some of the best I've tasted.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: buckeyerailroad
Reviews.Content: Personnel were friendly and attentive upon stepping out of the car and throughout the stay. Even groundskeepers and housekeeping initiated greetings in passing. Room was clean and well appointed, simple but smart. Landscaping set the tone for the enitre stay. This facility is meticulously manicured. Erroneous mini-bar charge was corrected without event. As is typical with many upscale facilities, mini-bar is over-priced and I never utilize.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore is the Best”
Reviews.Author: Andromeda55
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the one-of-a-kind Arizona Biltmore. I can honestly say that the facility has come to acquire special meaning for me, on both a personal and professional level. The staff and service are everything you'd expect from a resort of this caliber. No disappointments there. Beyond that, the grounds, the architecture and the total "encapsulated experience" of gathering with close personal friends and colleagues within the Biltmore's environs....just takes your breath away. Thank you, for two exquisitely memorable stays!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly fast room service.”
Reviews.Author: nativeportlander
Reviews.Content: Only 30 minutes from the time we placed the order to the time it was delivered. I was expecting more like 45 minutes+. This was a wonderful surprise.

Reviews.Title: “A desert gem”
Reviews.Author: JC60
Reviews.Content: We spent three great days at the Arizona Biltmore at a conference recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. The property is a gem: an historic Frank Lloyd Wright creation that is timeless and beautifully maintained. The staff is attentive, friendly and helpful. Prepare yourself: this is an expensive 5-star resort. But the value is there. It's one of the great hotel resorts in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, great beds, snotty service”
Reviews.Author: g8trgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore in January as part of a promotional rate with the Rock and Roll Marathon. I had stayed before and convinced my girlfriends to go to this hotel for race weekend. A few drawbacks on service: As a Hilton Gold member, I had made one of our two room reservations and requested two beds in our room. I called about both rooms 2 weeks before our check-in and asked to gaurantee two queen beds for each room. The front desk clerk told me, quite snippily, that he couldn't gaurantee it, but it shouldn't be a problem because over 2/3 of the property had two queen rooms. I explained that this was a requirement because all four of us were running long distances - he said, no problem. Imagine my surprise when we checked in, and I was told that there was only ONE room available for us (at 1:00) with two beds; all other double rooms on the property were sold out. Despite the fact that NOT all the rooms were checked in, and we were standing there, the front desk would not, initially, find us a room with two beds for our second grouping. As it turns out, they did go through, room by room, for all the reservations, and found a single guy who had asked for two queens - and they switched his reservation - again, they said, the only one left in the property. Bottom line: If you really, really have a bed preference, you MUST have status to ensure that you receive it. I will also add that we were in the Arizona wing. Our rooms were large, though not the largest on the property (the whole wing looks bad from the outside, but the bathroom was the size of my first apartment and the beds were extraordinary, plus we had a balcony with a great view of the mountains). We hit up the large pool by the spa the first day, but despite the fact that all the cabanas were empty, there wasn't a single lounge chair to be found. Tip: get to the pool early if you want a seat, OR go to the pool at the Arizona wing, which is empty all day. Finally, for dinner nearby, go to Chelsea's Kitchen or Postino's - great fresh food that makes your trip to Phoenix unique. I'd go back to the Biltmore, but I'd be more picky about where I stayed AND make sure that I checked in as early as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Biltmore !”
Reviews.Author: LJBROCK
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for the Biltmore after booking a room there and became a little worried. We stayed one night for a romantic getaway on a Sunday night in January. We had a great time. Check in was easy and quick. We were upgraded to a king room, upstairs, next to the Catalina Pool. The room wasn't huge, but very nice. Yes, the carpet was a bit worn, but clean. The bed was comfortable enough, but we could tell it older and in need of replacement. Parking was never an issue. We were able to self park right in front of our room. We sat by the pool all afternoon. We choose to stay at the smaller catalina pool as the larger paradise pool was a bit crowded. The pool was clean, lovely and peaceful. The water temp was a bit too warm to be comfortable, more like a hot tub then a pool. But the next morning I noticed people in the pool despite the cool air temperature, so the water temp was probably perfect for that. I would imagine in the summer months, the pool is not kept that warm. We got breakfast from the cafe and ate outside next to the Squaw Peak Lawn. It was pricey, but nothing out of line for a place like the Biltmore. The coffee and food were excellent and the view from the patio beautiful. Service was great. All staff encountered at the Biltmore were helpful and provided great customer service. My husband used the exercise facility in the spa and said it was nice. We would definitely stay there again, next time for more then one night.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the negative reviews?”
Reviews.Author: propredicr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a corporate outing, Jan 2009. Property was clean, staff was accomodating, and the food was suprisingly decent. The room I had was just above a new building that they were working on, but, the construction never bothered me. Basic room, large flat screen, king bed, alarm clock that worked with iPod attachment and a refrigerator that you could store things in besides the $8/bottle of water they had. Buy your water in the sundry store and save a few $'s. It was very clean and fresh smelling (N/S room). Room service was prompt and inside of the 30 minutes they quoted on both occasions. The food was above average for the entire week. The hotel is fairly close to the airport and that is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Just a really cool place”
Reviews.Author: DeansDesk
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the AZ Biltmore and like in 2005 I found the resort to be very, very good. The design and layout is quite unique and the low ceilings (so different from most breathtaking hotels) lends to it's intimacy and sophistication. Rooms are spacious, modern and well appointed. There are multiple buildings, all in close proximity to the lobby and main building. Only four stories high. The grounds are beautiful, the pool a real show peice. The gym is free and well equipped. Food and drinks are solid+ and as expensive as you would expect to find in high-end places like this. Nice employee to guest ratio so finding "help" is easy. Not quite FS or RC level talent but close enough. Parking is easy and on-sight. Flawless Phoeniz winter weather makes this an ideal spot to escape for a few days. I'll be back and not soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Katerina_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference. It was not a pleasant experience. The furniture was old and shabby, both lamps were malfunctioning. My window (Room 3335) was facing some sort of a maintenance facility, may be even a garbage repository. Just awful. The service was even worse even though they charge $20 per day for resort service + $10 for vallet service (to carry one bag) + $3 for maid service. I spent 15 minutes on hold for room service to order breakfast. The bartender at the lounge bar seemed to ignore me completely. And now looking at other reviews i am not surprised. What does surprise me is that several travel magazines rate this as the best property in Arizona. This just shows you how unfair these rankings are.

Reviews.Title: “What Happened???”
Reviews.Author: jakrny
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a mess. Cheap coffee makers??? Bathrooms totally outdated. Even the security lock on our door fell off. And we were in a suite! I was an event planner and did an annual event at the Biltmore, before it was bought by Hilton. It was my favorite hotel due to its beauty and originality. Now the rooms are shabby and worn down. The overall feeling of the "grand dame" it used to have only can apply to the grounds now. The outside is still well manicured and a pleasure to walk around. The room service menu used to be great, now it's simply average; the chairs in Wright's Bar have NO character and used to be really special. The carpet on the first floor screams "hotel chain". PS. - Security really should monitor hotel guest’s behavior at the pools and stop people from bringing in cases of beer which they drink openly at the pool and on the terraces! It feels like a Motel 6 with spring breakers.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Millie-Irvine
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: November 16-19, 2008 My family arrived at the hotel for a conference during the dates listed above. When we arrived, we decided not to valet our car and parked in the self-parking lot. We knew that it would be a long walk, but the self parking lot was a good 10-15 minute walk from our hotel room. At night the lot was extremely dark and confusing to manage due to the odd layout of the hotel. Most concerning was the lack of security in the parking lot. The lot was merely an open, first come, first serve lot which overnight guests had to share with temporary visitors. There is no way that the hotel could discern who parked there. Despite the safety and distance issues, the hotel still charged $10.00 for self-parking. Once we arrived, we were upgraded to a cottage room but little did we know that would be a mistake. When we arrived the cottage room was decidely underwhelming for a room of that cost. The room was small and badly renovated. The bath was smaller than expected for this "caliber of hotel." The heating did not work (deserts can be cold at night) and the hot water ran out after 10 minutes. Ten minutes is fine for one person but not for a family. The check-in attendant (upon upgrading our room) stated that we had a semi-private room overlooking the main part of the grounds. Well, if semi-private means hearing the honeymoon couple next door and all the drunken noises from the bar, then the attendant was right. The windows are very old, which means there is no double glazing to keep in heat and keep out sound. There was no view of the grounds because the hedges are grown so that you can't see anything while sitting on the patio furniture. You have to stand up to see anything. (I noticed this problem with a lot of the cottages.) The reason the hedges are grown high is because many of the "amenities" are right next to cottage rooms. The chess and putt-putt amenities touted are immediately next to the cottage rooms. This means that when little Johnny misses his putting shot, it's coming into your room. Houseekeping was pretty decent but made weird choices. One day we were given washcloths. The next day the cloths were removed and replaced by a bath mat. The mat was then removed as well. One day during our trip, we decided to drop the kids off at the "kids korral" touted as a baby sitting option. When we arrived, we noticed that the entrance to the "korral" could only be reached by the back access road for commerical deliveries. The playground was also dierctly accross the "korral" separated by the construction access road. Avoiding the truck was a pain, however more disconcerting was the back door to the "korral" (room) was open to the access road with no direct supervision. The "korral" attendant was seated immediately outside of the "korral" room. However, one precocous child trying to get to the playground through a construction access area equals disaster. Oh, and I forgot to mention that the basketball court next to the playground was open with lots of power construction tools plugged in and laying around. The hotel's costs are usually arbitrary. The chocolate cookie charged in the Cafe was $5. The same cookie at the pool was $3.50. We used the bottled water in our room listed for $6. When we checked out the same water was $7.99. The miniscule amunts for the food paled in comparison to the overpriced food. Both the Cafe and restaraunt were wildy overpriced for the quality. Also, the cafe did not serve lost of "child-friendly " breakfast foods , so we were forced to order takeout from the restaruant. When we ordered oatmeal to go, it was given to us in a starbucks coffee cup. The last day of our stay was the last straw. Our family got up early to pack for our trip home. I'm glad that we did because the head housekeeper opened the door to our room at 8:50 am to inquire when we were leaving (despite the hotel's policy of a 12 noon checkout time ). Besides being completely unprofessional entering our room without permission, the housekeeper actually gave us attitude for not leaving earlier! No apologies, just attitude. On the way out of the property we saw several contractors from the Hotel condo construction project fishing in the aqueduct near the property. These contractors were actually taking up self-parking spots for the clientele for fishing. It seems that management has focused so much time on obtaining conferences and selling condos that they have forgotten the basics of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “worst service ever!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: auntieb007
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst experience I have had in a very long time. The front desk staff was rude and disrepectful. We had to wait over three hours for our room to be readied and then had to move our own bags. this is definitely NOT a five star resort. and NOT the place to stay in Phoenix!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just One Night But We Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: TOMxxx
Reviews.Content: While we stayed just one night during a work-related event, we were very pleased with our stay. We stayed in a first floor Valley Wing room with a small patio and it was very nice...right near a pool, quiet, nice bath...we would have enjoyed staying longer. We did not eat in a hotel restaurant but had a late night dessert which was nice but expensive; unfortunately, our breakfast order, placed the night before via telephone, was "lost" so that is our main complaint. The staff is friendly, accessible, and willing to go all out for you. The resort itself is beautiful - an oasis in the big city. Great pools, gardens, outside cafe/bar...if you can get a good rate, stay at the Biltmore and we'd suggest asking for the Valley Wing (since that's all we know and we had absolutely no complaints). Having a car is essential as restaurants and shopping are nearby but at least a 1 mile walk to the Biltmore shopping and dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Another relaxing trip to the AZ Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: Beldar
Reviews.Content: We had not been to the Biltmore in about 5 years, and were very happy to be back. We were only there for four nights, but it was a very relaxing visit. Our room in the Arizona wing was fine, and very quiet. The grounds were as spectacular as ever, although under Hilton management I don't think the rooms were as pristine as they were when the hotel was independent. We had nothing really wrong, but it just wasn't pristine. I'd rate the room a 4 and the hotel property and main pool a 5 (or even a 6!). For some reason we did not get hit with either the resort fee or parking fee, both of which we were told we'd be charged. Needless to say we kept quiet about that!

Reviews.Title: “Plan to spend out of pocket for everything”
Reviews.Author: NevadaHighdesert
Reviews.Content: The grounds were lovely and the room was adequate. Many of the pools and hot tubs are open 24 hours which is very nice, especially when the days are so hot. The two unexpected disappointments were 1) despite the fact that the resort tacks a $25/day "resort fee" onto your room, many of the listed "amenities" are somehow not covered by this fee. Want to play tennis on one of the seven courts? Plan on shelling out $20/hour and buying a can of tennis balls for $5 from the tennis booth. Planning on bringing your own car? (I would recommend it since there is nothing within walking distance of the resort for shopping/dining/movies, etc.) Valet parking costs $25/day and self parking costs $10/day. Do those poolside tent cabanas look like a fun place to hang out? They range in price from $300 - $500! 2) one of the three restaurants was, unbeknownst to us, closed for remodelling which severely limited the dining options. That left guests to chose from room service (very expensive with gratuities tacked onto the already way overpriced food), Wright's fine dining (good, very expensive, very decadent food, not a good place for a "light" meal in the heat of the day and not enough vareity on the menu when it is the only full-service restaurant on property right now) or "The Cafe" which is really a small deli where one has a very limited selection of pastries and sandwiches for anywhere between twice and five times the price they would be off the resort property. If you don't have a car (which we didn't) you are stuck with the limited food options and the highly overpriced dining options. That said, the pools, landscaping and staff were terrific. We enjoyed massages in the spa (the steam room and one of the showers in the spa men's locker room were broken and the locker room/spa area could have been much cleaner) and the run of the property but we found that we kept asking staff "how much does this cost?"

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed - DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: olivlisa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore a couple of weeks ago for 4 nights during a conference. I have to say that I had high hopes that this would be a great place to stay due to it's five star status and the Biltmore name. First, plesae note that you should definitely NOT stay in the section of the hotel at the back of the property called "Terrace Court". I have attached pictures of this area and all is can say is I felt like I was staying at a Holiday Inn! You have this nice facade, but then once you get into the inner courtyard you realize all the rooms have outside entrances and the hallways are very dark....not at all what one would expect from a "Biltmore"! This is an old, outdated building that should be torn down....they should not even be putting guests in these rooms. The other issue I have is with the prices of the food and beverages here. A starbucks coffee costs double what you would pay in a regular coffee shop! I understand that this is a "resort" but the prices were really ridiculous. One night I got all the way to my room and found that the key to my room would not work. Rather than walk all the way back to the lobby, I called the front desk. They said they would send someone to me with a new key, which they did. When I checked out I saw that I had a $10.00 charge on my bill for this service! I just think this is ridiculous!! On a more positive note, I thought the staff at the hotel were very nice and I have no complaints about the service that I received from any of them. Also, the landscaping here was beautiful and well tended to. Bottom line....I would not recommend this hotel to anyone...there are better hotels in Phoenix that offer more than you will get here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price! Free scorpion with room tho”
Reviews.Author: MJPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: To attach the esteemed “Waldorf-Astoria Biltmore” tag to this supposed resort and spa is shameful. My husband and I spent 5 days there for a conference he was attending (Sept. 9-14, 2008). Even though his company was paying for it and money wasn’t coming out of our pockets, we were still disgusted. The first night’s hotel room was large, but the bathroom had a weird layout with a shower stall showing age, mold, and cracks in molding. The carpet stains were disgusting and plentiful-yuck. There was a huge, very noticeable tear in the desk lamp. The decorative pillow was scungy and old with fabric balls all over it. The biggest surprise for me was the scorpion that crawled out from under the bed across the floor to the window drapes while I was alone in the room!!!!! Nowhere in the literature do they mention watch out for scorpions. The front desk wasn’t fazed. The maint. man who came to remove it wasn’t fazed. When my husband called the front desk after hearing about my ordeal, he got the sarcastic reply from Mark Lambert, “well, we ARE in a desert.” No, we’re at the BILTMORE and not camping on the desert floor. BTW Mark should not be in a customer facing job–he’s way too arrogant. They comp’d us the room and we moved to cottage K, which they ‘said’ they sprayed for bugs/scorpions. Cottage is about 90 yrs old and shows it. Dingy. No safety runner or handles in the marble floored, small, dark shower stall – what a safety hazard and lawsuit waiting to happen. Dark lighting everywhere. Dead bugs lying in the ceiling light covers. (hey, but no scorpions, aren’t we lucky!) A/C that barely spit out cold air, except after 9pm at night. No storage space for clothing. 1 of 3 small drawers was dedicated to mini bar liquor and snacks (overpriced) and the fridge was loaded with beverages and booze–no room for a water bottle. One restaurant was closed for remodeling and the Wright restaurant had a severly limited menu of choices that were overpriced. We went out a few nights just to get decent food choices. The Starbucks Café was another place to get food, but you paid dearly for items, such as coffee and bagel with cream cheese, and options limited. I know we’re on a resort but do we have to feel like prisoners? Give us food choices, vending machines and soda machines too for heaven’s sake. This place is sooooo overpriced and not worth the $200/night. The one day the housekeeper left our patio door WIDE open. Thank God our computer and valuables weren’t stolen! I went to the salon to get a champagne pedicure, $80. It was nothing special nor what you’d expect from a famous “resort and spa.” Very average service. I get more at my local salons, even a mimosa or glass of cheap champagne – nothing at the Biltmore spa though – just some iced tea. They may think the name will make people shell out tons of cash, but they’re wrong. We’ve been to the nicest places here and abroad and to the not so nice places, so we come with some experiences and knowledge. The AZ Biltmore is a loser–don’t bother staying there. Sure the grounds are lovely and many staff members are great, but you need more than those two pluses for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother - Service is Horrible”
Reviews.Author: silver33
Reviews.Content: You've got to be kidding. We have stayed in the best and worst of hotels/motels through the years. We've stayed here 3 times prior to this, but this particular visit was worst I've ever seen in my life. Upon check-in the fellow who was checking our car, was rude beyond belief....we had to literally beg for a cart for our luggage. Two days later we rented a pool-side cabana, and then we're in the pool, look up and see three people (security people) advancing on our cabana and entering the area...all other guests eyes are on us at this point.... we had brought a bottle of McCallum Scotch because the waitress said they did not have it available at pool-side. Mind you, this bottle was tucked in the cabana, not anywhere near the pool itself. No posting about the bad Karma this would bring us....we were practically "under arrest" partiucularily by the head of security - a pistol packing mamma. Rude...beyond belief. The customer serive at the Biltmore is sad, sad, sad, sad. We spent over $3,000.00 for 3 days of bull from every end of the spectrum. Our advise - stay the heck away from this place. There are other beaufiful places to stay....this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Handicap Access Perspective”
Reviews.Author: makua
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 nights at the Biltmore as part of a speaking role at a conference. I was restricted to a wheelchair due to multiple foot fractures. Good: The bell staff were excellent and timely whenever needed to push the wheelchair over the very large hotel campus. The architecture and history of the hotel were significant. Bad: The campus is not readily handicap friendly. It is not enough to have a sign on a restroom door when the door doesn't allow access. The construction of the campus with steep inclines forced a bellman to be called whenever you wanted to go somewhere. The restaurant for dinner was very expensive. A hamburger, tomato soup, Iced Tea for $35 (including tip). Plus, I have better burgers and fries at fast food joints. Also, the layout of the campus caused a lot of money to be spent on bellmen tips (even though I was already paying $12 a night- which I found out about upon checkout). Not reviewed: Due to the access issues, I was not able to visit the pool or other hotel amenities. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: irishinil
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of a conference in August - thank god I didn't pay for this experience. On check in my room wasn't ready and although they promised to call me, they never did.- I ended up calling back at 6pm. It took me 20 minutes to find my room in the Catalina section, the signs kept pointing different directions. When I finally got to my room, a dirty tray was waiting at my door. I ordered room service that evening and they picked up the dirty tray but never came back for mine. It stayed outside my door for 2 DAYS until I rang and complained. Other annoying things: The shampoo/conditioner tray had a film of shampoo on the bottom of it. When I used the shampoo I found out it had been watered down and didn't foam at all. I called for a golf cart to help me bring heavy items to my room from the conference center and it never came, I ended up carrying boxes in the heat. The lobby smells and in places linens were ripped. Place needs a complete overhaul and service in general is mediocre. Not many good remarks to share except the bed and pillows were very comfortable and the Catalina and main pool were really well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best staff I've ever had at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: divrdrew
Reviews.Content: My wife was lucky enough to have a conference at the hotel and we got an incredible rate (of course it was incredibly hot in August -;). I am a Gold with HHonors and my wife asked about an upgrade upon checkin (I arrived a day later). The front desk clerk told her we could have a 1 br villa at an extra $399. After chatting with the clerk for a couple minutes, she gave us the upgrade for free! This room was amazing...out the back porch was a small pool shared by the other villas. We had a small problem with one of our meals on Friday and the manager comped us a poolside cabana on Saturday. It was the largest cabana on the property! Food on site was fantastic, staff bent over backwards to help and the had some great family activities. Even in the heat of the summer, they built a little fire and had smores on Friday night! It was great! They had a nice little buffet spread set up with all the smores necesseties, plus popcorn, hot chocolate, water, iced tea, and milk. Saturday night, they set up a big screen by the pool for a 'dive in movie.' Overall, an excellent experience! Good food, but most importantly, the staff was simply incredible. They didn't know the meaning of the word 'no."

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing experience!!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastBc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a LONG week at the Biltmore. Never again! My husband and I had a conference to attend at the hotel so we decided to take our two teens, each with a friend and put them up in a separate villa. There was trouble from the beginning. Upon booking (for four) we were given a price of $319.00 nightly (conference rate) After talking to a colleague, who was quoted a price of $299.00 I called back to be told that the villa could not accommodate 4 after all due to fire regulations not allowing for two cots in the living room. We had already booked flights etc. so after much back and forth we were told they could relax the rules. We arrived, went to the villa. No cots. We were told two could sleep on the pull out couch. (The couch and chairs were full of stains) Went to get into bed after a long day of travel. No bedding provided and took over an hour to arrive. After three nights of toughing it out the kids (who are not whiners) were exhausted from the inability to sleep on the unbelievably low quality sofa bed. They brought in the two cots. We had got in food supplies the first night . Went to cook breakfast, no pots and pans, no dishes etc. Went to do the dishes, no clothes, dishtowels, scrubby. Every single kitchen detail has to be requested. There was no mention of the need to do this upon check in. In fact there was no orientation at all. Third night in, the air conditioning broke. In 104 F, not so great for sleeping. Be prepared for extra costs at every single turn and expect to pay 2-3 times regular prices for anything from tylenol to coffee. I could go on but it would all be in the same tone. Do check your bill at the end of your stay. There was about $100.00 in mistaken charges that they were very prompt in reversing. This hotel has had better days.

Reviews.Title: “The worst!”
Reviews.Author: verypicky8
Reviews.Content: The was one of the worst hotel experiences of my life. The moment my wife and walked in I knew there was trouble. The carpet was filthy and had an odor in the lobby. We switched our first room because of the odor and the next room we got had gum stains in the carpet, not to mention stains on the bed spread. Simply Horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: jen8579
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and i did extensive research before our "spa weekend" in Arizona. after much debate we chose the Arizona Biltmore. we were very excited about the historic element as well as the amazing architecture. all of our research was done online using traveladvisor.com and arizonaspagirls.com. when we arrived at the property we were in awe, the grounds are just beautiful. the grass was so plush we kicked off our sandals and walked through the front lawn : ) our room was great. far larger than a regular hotel room and the best were really comfy. we did not overlook anything special but their gardens are beutiful all over the property and we did have a view of one of the lawns. we had appointments booked at their spa in advance which was very helpful because it was busy! their spa is smaller than some of the others that we visited but it allowed for more personal attention and we really enjoyed it. in the mornings we used the gym facilities which were adequate. since we were on Chicago time we got down there at 5:30 a.m. and it was about 50% full (only about 12 treadmills, ellipticals, stairclimbers and bikes) by 6:30 it was packed! and people were waiting for machines. The 2 negative experiences that i encountered were #1 NO PARKING!! since this resort was built so long ago they did not account for the number of cars that would be visiting in 2008. i am sure back in the 30's there was ample parking. #2 The price of food!! at lunch they were service a chicken wrap for $15.95! and for breakfast i had a vegetable frittata (fancy omelette) for $21.95. needless to say, we left the resort most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Arcitecture”
Reviews.Author: tama12995
Reviews.Content: This is the forth and last resort that I stayed in on a long trip from Vegas to Phoenix. It was by far the best. This is a resort frequented by politicians and celebrities, so expect to pay for what you get. I stayed here in the off season so I probably would not afford it during the peak season. There is a fee for parkng (both self and valet). We opted for self (when you do this make sure you don't get lost going to your room at night!) The resort is very large and we were in the back building so we did get lost once. When we checked in, the lobby was beautiful and the staff was very helpfull. I am a fan of Frank Lloyd Wright and could see his influence throughout the resort. The prices in the shops are high (almost 20.00 for sunscreen). So make sure you do not forget anything. The walk back to our room, showed us how lovely the grouds where. The statues were beautiful. When we got to the terrace building the pool was being refurbished. This would have upset me if There were not so many pools and if I was paying for off season. The room was amazing. We asked for two beds but the were all booked (they were refurbishing rooms as well). We instead got a large king bed in a room that fit a roll away for our daughter comfortably. The bathroom was huge! Separate bath and shower with a great showerhead. the minibar was also high priced but I usually eat so much on vacation that I do not need late night snacks. We went to the main pool once. Most of the chairs are taken up by cabanas. It is so hot in Pheonix that the cabanas are popular. The second time we went to the main pool there were no chairs available. It too was undergoing refurbishing and the slide was closed. This is one thing that I wish I knew beforehand for my daughter's sake. We found chairs at the next pool over that was just as nice.
